loans.name: Ledys Yohana

texts.es:
Ledys una joven emprendedora de 22 años de edad madre cabeza de familia con un bebe de 2 años de edad, que se ha trazado una meta terminar sus estudios superiores a pesar de todos los obstáculos que se le presentan en el camino y lo difícil de ser una madre soltera. 
Vende mercancía que le permite no solo pagar sus estudios si no poder apoyar a su hijo y familia que le han dado la mano en momentos difíciles, distribuye sus productos a compañeros de clase, vecinos y toca puertas es una mujer muy persistente y que hora quiere solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía como lociones, productos de uso personal.
texts.en:
Ledys is an entrepreneurial young woman of 22. She is a mother and the head of her family, with a two-year-old baby. She has planned as a goal to finish her university education in spite of all the obstacles that are in her path and the difficulty of being a single mother.

She sells merchandise, which allows her not only to pay for her education but also to help her son and family, which has given her a hand at difficult times.

She distributes her products to classmates and neighbors and knocks on doors. She is a very persistent woman who now wants to apply for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of merchandise such as lotions and products for personal use.

loans.use: to buy lotions and products for personal use. She is a single mother

loans.name: Carlos Reinaldo

texts.es:
Carlos de 20 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, estudio hasta 1° año de bachillerato, su pareja es ama de casa, por el momento vive donde sus suegros en un casa que él mismo construyó y pasa con su esposa e hijo.

Carlos es peluquero, trabaja como tal desde hace 3 años, aprendió con un amigo, antes trabajaba como agricultor y en ocasiones como ayudante de albañil, ahora tiene su propia peluquería. El préstamo será utilizado para comprar un espejo grande, una máquina de cortar cabello, una silla de barbería y otros artículos para su negocio y su hogar.

Carlos sueña con tener su propio local, también quiere terminar su bachillerato, también comprar un terreno donde pueda construir una casa propia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 20 years old and married with a 2-year-old son.  He studied until the first year of high school.  His partner is a housewife and for the moment they live with her parents in a house that he constructed and then moved into with his spouse and son.  

Carlos is a barber and he has been doing this job for 3 years.  He learned the trade from a friend.  Before this he worked as a farmer and occasionally as an assistant construction worker.  Presently he has his own barber shop.  The loan will be used to buy a large mirror, a hair clipper, and a barber's chair, among other items for his business and home.

Carlos dreams of owning his own business site and he would also like to get his diploma and buy some land where he can build his own home.

loans.use: to buy a large mirror, a hair clipper, a barber's chair and other items for his business and home

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en:
Wilson, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed of 11 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills. He is married and has 4 children.

With a portion of this loan, Wilson will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of his loan means that now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. Wilson plans to use the profits he gains this year to send his children to school.

In total Wilson’s Group will use the farm inputs received from this loan to plant 5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Krowor Ladies Group

texts.en:
Krowor Ladies Group consists of three members who live in Teshie, Accra, Ghana. They applied for a loan of 2,800 GHS from ID Ghana to invest into underwear, slippers, rice, and yams. 

Evelyn is a 36-year-old married woman from Teshie, Accra, Ghana, who is the featured borrower. Evelyn didn't give up and started a business with the little money she had five years ago. She sells underwear at the market. Currently, she wants to buy different underwear, but she doesn't have enough capital. 

She decided to apply for a loan of 900 GHS from ID Ghana in order to purchase more underwear to sell to customers. She looks forward to improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for school fees at university.

loans.name: Leam's Group

texts.en:
Leam, 34, is married and lives with his family in a village of the Phnom Srouch district. He has one son. To make a living, he has been farming rice for 16 years, and the current business earns his family about 22,000 KHR per day.

This is Leam's first loan cycle with VisionFund. He is leading his group of 10 to ask for a loan. Leam will use his portion to buy a water filter for his family. He hopes to have clean water for drinking.

loans.use: to buy a water filter

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Seangly's Group

texts.en:
A woman living in Kampong Cham provice, Seangly is 53 years old and a mother of six children. For her living, she sells rice (rice and food) as her single source of income to support her family's condition. 

For Seangly, this is her first cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is a group leader. 

She will spend her loan to buy some materials to support her rice-selling. She hopes that she can expand her business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy some materials to support her rice-selling.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 50 years old.  She is the mother of four children. She  lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Shakeela's son is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of that he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Shakeela has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Shakeela is so much thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repairing cost of her son's rickshaw

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio tiene 41 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente y con carga familiar, vive en casa de familia de material noble en el distrito de Morropón, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Eusebio es la venta de arroz por cargas y granos en su domicilio, contando ya con clientela fija por lo que tiene experiencia en el rubro, siendo conocido en la zona. El destino del crédito es para comprar de sacos para almacenar arroz en cascara, con la inversion le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que los pobladores de la zona ya que producto esta teniendo buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 41 years old. He has a partner and dependents. He lives in his family home made of quality materials in the district of Morropón. The local population mostly work in agriculture, live-stock rearing and commerce. The area has basic services such as water and light. His community is located in the district and province of Morropón, Piura region, on the north coast of Peru.

Eusebio sells rice and grains from his home. He already has a fixed client base and is therefore experienced in the field and is known in the area. 

The loan will be used to buy bags in which to store the paddy rice, and will help him to make a higher income. The market has good prospects because of the local population and he gets a good price on the market.

loans.use: to buy bags in which to store paddy rice

loans.name: Mercylita

texts.en:
Mercylita is 52 years old and has two children aged 26 and 15 respectively. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. 

Mercylita operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling various items such as crackers, candies, detergents, noodles, canned goods, sugar, and coffee. She has been operating a variety store for more than 20 years. Aside from operating a store, she raises and sells hogs. 

Mercylita has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more ingredients and additional stock such as canned goods, seasonings, soft drinks and additional   pigs and pig feed. This will help Mercylita sell a variety of stock to the customers and raise more pigs.

Mercylita hopes that she can expand her business for sustainable living in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as canned goods, seasonings, softdrinks and additional pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Nilton

texts.es:
Nilton tiene 22 Años, Conviviente, Vive en casa de familiares ubicada en sector Popa Alto De Cayalti, junto a Sus Suegros, de familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Nilton se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales (terneros, borregos y aves de corral) y al cultivo de productos menores. Así también ofrece servicios agrícolas a particulares. El destino del crédito será para inversión en compra de animales para negocio (cuyes y patos) y compra de alimentos y mantenimiento de cultivo. Así, tendrá variedad de animales para ofrecer al público. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nilton is 22 years old. He is married. He lives with his in-laws in a family house in Popa Alto de Cayalti. He lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture, and farming. His community is located in Cayalti, a province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, in the north of Peru.

Nilton raises and sells animals (calves, lambs, and poultry), and he grows basic staples. He also provides agricultural services.  

This loan will be used to invest in the purchase of animals for his business (guinea pigs and ducks) and to buy food for the animals, and to maintain his crops.  With this loan he will have a variety of animals to offer to the public.  It will enable him to increase his income in a short time. He will be able to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals for his business (guinea pigs and ducks), and to buy food, and to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Mirgul

texts.ru: Миргул 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Миргул - среднее образование. Она очень трудолюбивая и ответственная. Животноводством Миргул стала заниматься с 1996 года. Сегодня в ее хозяйстве насчитываются 2 коровы, 20 овец, 1 лошадь и земельный надел мерою 2,0 Га, где она выращивает кукурузу и картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Миргул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 (KGS) для покупки коровы для разведения. Увеличение поголовья скота непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Миргул состоит в группе "Ничкесай", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Миргул планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на ремонт ее дома.
texts.en: Mirgul is 39 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising three children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education.  She is very hardworking and responsible.  Mirgul became involved in animal husbandry in 1996.  Today she owns two cows, 20 sheep and one horse, as well as two hectares of land on which she grows corn and potatoes.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy an additional cow for breeding.  An increase in the number of her farm animals will directly lead to an increase in the family's capital.  Mirgul is a member of the "Nichkesai" group, which, in addition to herself, consists of three more people.  She is planning to reinvest her earnings from this loan into increasing her herd and she would also like to save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 60 years old.  She is married, with three children.

Patricia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Patricia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Patricia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, and beverages.

loans.name: Minaiym

texts.ru: Минайым, 56 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. Старшие дети самостоятельны, а младшая дочь учится в школе. У Минайым- среднее образование,она знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. Минайым на пенсии, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством. Стартовав 14 лет назад с покупки скота на 15,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Минайым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы. Для содержания скота есть все условия: сарай и отгонные пастбища. Доходы Минайым катастрофически малы и их не хватает на достойную жизнь и воспитание детей. Поэтому Минайым обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Минайым развить ее бизнес, нарастить активы и улучшить уровень жизни.
texts.en: Minaiym is 56 years old and a widow.  She is raising three children.  Her two older children are already living independently, but her youngest daughter is still at home and a student.  Minaiym herself has the equivalent of a high school education.  She knows how to properly handle money and to make financial plans in order to achieve the goals that she has set for herself.  She is now a pensioner but is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  She started in this field 14 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 15,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns two cows, and she has everything she needs to take care of cattle: a barn and some land for pasture.  Minaiym's income is very small and vastly insufficient to provide a decent life and to take care of the children's upbringing.  For this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy four young bulls as well as animal feed.  The earnings from her loan will enable Minaiym to grow her business, build some assets and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed as well as four young bulls for fattening and resale, so that she can increase her income.

loans.name: Jeniffer Patricia

texts.es:
Jeniffer es una joven comerciante que ha pasado por muchas etapas en su vida que la han hecho crecer con tan solo 21 años de edad. Desde pequeña ella se apasionó por el periodismo, considera que es la mejor manera de contribuir al desarrollo social, ya que los medios no solo informa, también educa. Al llegar a la universidad no dudó en estudiar Comunicación Social. Ahora está cursando el cuarto año de la carrea con el apoyo de su abuela y de su tío, ambos comerciantes, y terminando un diplomado de formación política y ciudadana.
Jeniffer se siente realizada profesionalmente, porque a su corta edad ya ha realizado pasantía en distintos lugares, dándole la oportunidad de crecer profesionalmente. Sin embargo, ya en su último año de la carrea, quiere mejorar sus trabajos académicos, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y una cámara profesional, de manera que producirá sin ningún inconveniente piezas comunicacionales de calidad. Sus metas son terminar su tesis, tener una empresa de publicidad y de relaciones públicas.
texts.en:
Jeniffer is a young professional that has passed through many stages in her life that have helped her to grow in only her 21 years of age.  Since she was young she has been fascinated by journalism, and considers it the best way of contributing to social development, since the media not only informs, but also educates.

Upon arriving at university, she had no doubt about studying Social Communication.  She is now in her fourth year of her studies, and with the help of her grandmother and uncle, both of whom are shopkeepers, she is finishing a degree in political and civic training.  Jeniffer feels professionally prepared, because at her young age she has done several internships.  This has given her the opportunity to grow professionally.  Nevertheless, in the last year of her studies, she wishes to improve her academic work.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a computer and a professional camera, so that she will be able to easily produce quality communications pieces.  Her goals are to finish her thesis, and to have a company focusing on publicity and public relations.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and a professional camera for her studies.

loans.name: Misozi

texts.en:
Misozi is one of the most successful young Zoona agents. She has been a beneficiary of loans from Kiva lenders since 2012. She is 24 years old, and runs 11 outlets with a total of 19 employees.

Misozi has been able to successfully grow her business through help from Kiva lenders. She has already received and paid back 3 large loans which helped her open more outlets and employ more young people from her community. Having access to the Kiva loans has also given Misozi an adequate float of working capital in order to service her customers efficiently. Plus, Misozi enrolled herself in school and has attained her diploma in accounting, which is helping her become more skilled at running a business.

Misozi wanted to let Kiva lenders know that she is grateful for their support. Without the loans from Kiva's lenders and the support from Zoona, she wouldn’t be where she is today. She was recently awarded Zambia’s Top Female Entrepreneur, which gave her the opportunity to travel to the Washington, DC for the first time where she took part in a mentorship program. She encourages lenders to continue supporting small business entrepreneurs like herself.

Now that Misozi has successfully paid back her 3 previous loans, she is requesting a fourth loan to continue growing her mobile money business. With this loan, she will be able to service more customers in a community that needs financial services.

loans.use: to grow her mobile money business and service more customers in her community who need financial services.

loans.name: William's Group

texts.en:
William, pictured above, has been a farmer for 10 years, and he is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers in Butere District. He is 41 years old, is married, and has five children.

William likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills. 

He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. William plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, William’s group will receive inputs to cultivate 6 acres of land.  Some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, so that with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his harvests of maize

loans.name: Kafula

texts.en:
Kafula is 29 years old and married to Mubanga. The couple has two children aged 6 and 7. Kafula has continued to grow his Zoona mobile money transfer business with the help of his wife. His business is located in Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia. Kafula works hard. He’s a true entrepreneur. He opens his shops at 8am and closes at 8pm. He gets a lot of customers coming to his shop when the other mobile money outlets are closed. This gives him more customers and sets him apart from his competitors.

Kafula would like to take this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders. With their support, he has been able to open a total of five outlets in Lusaka and bring new customers on board. Kafula says that even though working capital still remains a huge challenge, he is happy with the growth he has seen in his business. He used the proceeds from his prior loans to enroll his daughter at a very good private school.

Kafula is requesting a loan to help him increase his working capital at his three new locations. This will be the fourth loan that his is taking out from Kiva. Kafula explains that the added services have increased his shop's demand. Therefore, he needs more capital to satisfy customer money transfer needs. Kafula thanks the Kiva lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To get working capital for his 3 new mobile money transfer centers

loans.name: Nkome Nfa Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two members who are part of the group called Nkome Nfa. It is made up of members who get on very well together and work hard. They both live in the same neighborhood, and are into selling fresh fish and second-hand clothing. 

Felicia is the featured borrower (standing on the left in the photo) and she is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. She will use her loan to buy fish from the market to sell to customers in another village. She has been doing this job for 9 years. This her 5th loan cycle with ID Ghana, which indicates that she is very loyal, because all her previous loans have been successfully repaid. 

She uses her earnings to take care of her family expenses, and ensures the smooth running of her household.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Murali

texts.en:
Murali is a 34-year old man who is married and has two sons, both of whom are studying. The family is living in Orvakal village, Kurnool, Andhra Pradesh.

Murali has completed his BA graduation. He worked in the promotion of sustainable agriculture, and he is very passionate about agriculture. Murali cultivates Bengal gram, red gram, cotton and jowar (sorghum) on his ten acres of leased land. The village he is based in is covered with agricultural land, ponds, and the river, so agriculture is suitable in this area.

Murali is requesting a loan to invest in agriculture supplies such as seeds and fertilizers to do millet trading. This will give him better-quality crops by the end of the season, so he can do millet trading.

He hopes to save enough for a higher education for his kids, and in the future, he wants to open his own millet-processing unit. Help Murali to fulfill his desires.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Wendlouimtaoré2 Group

texts.fr: Fatimata, responsable du groupe Wendlouimtaoré2 est mariée, mère de 4 enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés. Cette brave dame fait le commerce des habits depuis 10 ans. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter assez d'habits pour vendre pendant les fêtes de fin d'année. Elle pourra faire des bénéfices qui lui permettront d'augmenter le volume de ses activités et faire quelques dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Fatimata, the official of the group Wendlouimtaoré2, is a married mother of four children, of whom two are in school. This good and honest woman has been doing commerce in clothing for ten years. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase enough clothing to sell during the year-end holidays. She will be able to make a profit enabling her to increase business volume and cover a few family expenses.

loans.use: to stock up her store with clothing to sell during the holidays

loans.name: Xiomora De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Xiomara es una mujer trabajadora, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos quienes son mayores de edad que trabajan y estudian. Siempre ha sacado adelante a su familia sola, lográndolo gracias a su negocio que tiene desde hace mucho tiempo. Al principio el surtido de su negocio se componía sobre todo de productos de alimentación, pero con el tiempo se amplió por productos escolares y un poco de cosméticos ya que estos se vendían muy bien. Ahora Xiomara quiere ampliar su oferta aún más para servirles mejor a sus clientes y así crecer su negocio y mejorar su situación económica. El préstamo solicitado lo quiere invertir en ropa, calzados y cosméticos.
texts.en: Xiomara is a hard working woman. She has the support from her children who are older and work and study. She has always moved her family ahead, having been able to do it thanks to a business she has had for 12 years. At the beginning she used to have mainly food items in her business inventory, but with time she increased it to include school objects and some cosmetics because these sold very well. Now Xiomara wants to increase her offers even more in order to serve her customers better, and in this way grow her business and improve her financial situation. She is requesting the loan to buy clothing, shoes and other cosmetic products.

loans.use: to invest in her items for sale in order to give variety to her customers and improve her income.

loans.name: El Altiplano Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL ALTIPLANO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yanira ella es conviviente y tiene 40 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

 
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de carteras.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "El Altiplano." This bank is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

This member is Señora Yanira. She is 40 years old and lives with her partner. She works in her handicraft business. She sells weavings, sweaters, blankets, and fabrics. She sells various weavings. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has already had this business for 8 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business of selling weavings and fabrics. She is applying for the loan to buy weavings, sweaters, and fabrics. 

The members whose photos are inserted in the group photo had their photos taken after the meeting because they asked permission due to work reasons.

The other members work in businesses of selling clothing, selling shoes, grocery store, and selling purses.

This member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy weavings, sweaters, and fabrics

loans.name: Villa Rosario Group

texts.es:
Silvia es una mujer de 21 años de edad, vive con su pareja, no tiene hijos y su negocio es la venta de desayuno.
Ella es independiente, soñadora, optimista, activa, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en un mercado de su ciudad, caracterizado por comercio mayorista; donde productores en todas las áreas de manera desorganizada se agrupan día a día para ofrecer sus productos a la venta en grandes cantidades.
Silvia es de tez morena, cabello negro como la noche, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español por razones de comercio. Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción, viven en una habitación en alquiler y comparten el baño y la cocina con otros vecinos (la segunda de la izquierda, blusa negra, pantalon blanco). Debido a la necesidad de conseguir una mejor manera de vivir, formó una banca de personas con negocios como; tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería, venta de videos y venta de sándwiches, para solicitar un préstamo para invertir en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de Api (desayuno de maíz morado); Cuando la ciudad todavía duerme y el manto oscuro de la noche está a punto de levantarse para que se inicie un nuevo día, Silvia trabaja desde que tenia 10 años de edad y cada dia empieza su jornada en el mercado a la intemperie, en la capital cruceña y ella sabe que los comensales que habitualmente acuden a su puesto para desayunar no le pedirán café, leche o té, sino que, como ya es habitual en esta época del año, buscarán el api que prepara y que, a decir de uno de sus clientes, ‘solo ella sabe hacer bien’. En una olla grande hace hervir el agua y va sumando los ingredientes hasta lograr el espeso líquido de color morado que luego será acompañado con empanadas fritas y sopaipillas (pan de queso frito). Cerca de las 10:00 ya no queda ni para llenar una taza. “A veces tengo que hacer dos ollas, porque en invierno es lo que más buscan”, comenta la cocinera con la seguridad que le dan 11 años de trabajar en el mercado y de preparar la popular bebida caliente. Nadie puede discutir que el brebaje hecho del maíz morado o culli, como es también conocido, ha logrado imponerse en todo el país.
Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable y fijo, donde pueda trabajar cómodamente, ella desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de utensilios de cocina como también una cocina nueva.
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios de cocina y una cocina nueva para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia, a 21-year-old woman, lives with her partner, has no children and has a business selling breakfasts. She is a dreamer and is independent, optimistic, active, steady, responsible and hard-working. She works in one of the markets in her city, which is for wholesale trade. Here producers of all types get together in a haphazard way every day to offer their products for sale in large quantities. 

Silvia is dark skinned and has hair as black as the night. Her mother tongue is Quechua and she speaks Spanish for business purposes. She lives with her partner who works in construction. They live in a rented room and share the bathroom and kitchen with other neighbours. She is the second from the left in the photo in the black blouse and white trousers.

Because of the need to find a better way of living, she set up a communal bank of people with businesses such as: knitting baby clothes, selling chips, selling sportswear, local shop, butcher's, video sales and sandwich sales, in order to ask for a loan to invest in their businesses. 

Her business is selling 'Api' (a breakfast dish made of purple corn). When all the city is still asleep and the dark blanket of the night is about to lift away so that a new day can begin, Silvia starts her day in the market out in the open, in the capital of Santa Cruz, and she knows that the diners who regularly visit her stall to have breakfast won't ask for coffee, milk or tea, but, as is usual at this time of year, they will be looking for the Api which she makes. According to one of her customers "only she knows how to make it properly". She boils the water in a big saucepan and goes on adding the ingredients until she gets the thick purple-coloured liquid which will be accompanied by fried empanadas and 'sopaipillas' (fried cheese bread). By around 10 o'clock there isn't enough enough left to fill a cup. "Sometimes I have to make 2 pans, because in the winter it's what they want the most" says the chef, with the confidence that comes from 11 years working in the market preparing this popular hot drink. No-one could argue that the concoction made from purple corn or 'culli', as it is also known, has become established throughout the country.

This is the second loan cycle with the institution.
Her dream is to have a fixed stable business where she can work comfortably. She wants to expand her business by buying kitchen utensils as well as a new stove. This is why Silvia is asking for a loan to buy kitchen utensils and a new stove so she can serve a larger number of customers,

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils so she can serve a larger number of customers.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 51 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is still in school. Matilde is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Matilde has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Matilde would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elineta

texts.en:
Elineta is 49 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.   

Elineta has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elineta requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Elineta has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Elineta would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Isunga Elders Savings & Credit Sugar Cane & Chilli Group

texts.en:
Stella a 35-year-old lady and a member of Isunga Elders Savings & Credit Sugar Cane & Chilli group, where each member guarantees the others. 

Stella has a school, and at the same time is a farmer. She has been running these businesses for the last fifteen years. She faces challenges of parents who fail to pay school fees on time and heavy rainfall that makes it hard for the pupils to attend school. However, Stella hopes to build a permanent house and take her children to good schools.

Stella needs a loan to buy textbooks and chalk for the school.

loans.use: to buy textbooks and chalk for the school.

loans.name: Isaac's Group

texts.en:
Isaac is the 45-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and represents his group of 11 farmers in Webuye District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Isaac has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.  Isaac described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize.  He will now be able to reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Isaac’s group will be able to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, pictured above, has been a farmer for 10 years, and she is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Butere District. She is 40 years old, is married, and has eight children.

Beatrice likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. 

She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to save more money. Beatrice plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Beatrice’s group will receive inputs to cultivate 5 acres of land.  One member of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, so that with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 1 solar light.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Kampong Speu province, La is 49 years old and a mother of two children. To support her family, she grows rice as her single source of income. She can earn income of about 25,000 KHR per day. This is first time for La with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of nine members to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Tonghuo

texts.en: A young man living in Bantaey Meanchey province, Tonghuo is 19 years old and single. For his living, he works in one company in a local area. The current job earns him about $11 per day but he can save about $5 each day after deducting daily expenses. This is his second cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid his past loan successfully. He will spend his loan to pay school fee in university. He hopes that he can get a better job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay school fee in university

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Ou Chrov Dristrict

loans.name: Yamilet

texts.es: Es una mujer luchadora, sociable, sonriente, tiene 35 años de edad, madre soltera tiene 3 hijos menores: La mayor de 18 años estudia su primer año de carrera universitaria y dos adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Con el propósito de vivir de manera segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para cambiar la madera de su casa de tambo y comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavos, postes de madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra.  Su sueño es brindarles una vivienda a sus hijos con las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en: She is a determined, sociable, smiling woman who is 35 years old.  She is a single mother who has three children.  The oldest, who is 18 years old, is studying in her first year at university and the two adolescents attend elementary school.  With the goal of living in a safe and dignified manner, she is requesting financing to swap out the wood in her house built on stilts, to purchase construction materials like wood, corrugated metal roofing, nails and wooden posts, and to cover the cost of labor.  Her dream is to provide her children with a home that has suitable living conditions.

loans.use: to swap out the wood in her stilt house, to buy construction materials like wood, corrugated metal roofing, nails and wooden posts, and to cover the costs of labor.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a maize farmer. Ezekiel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his two children.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ezekiel had to sell his maize at ow prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ezekiel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Ezekiel spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses (school fees, food), and store his harvest to sell it later for greater profits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: set up the septic tank, install a toilet, and provide a better quality of life for his family, above all providing them with hygiene and a healthy environment

loans.name: Pio Xii Group

texts.es:
Teodora es una mujer de 47 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 13 años y una hija de 9 años de edad, y su negocio es la confección de polleras.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘la portada’ un sitio comercial populoso caracterizado por la variedad de productos agrícolas para trabajar y comerciar en el altiplano.
Teodora es de tez morena, cabello largo trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español (sentada sombrero negro, manta blanca). Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica al comercio de garrafas de gas y sus dos hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable y luz eléctrica. La necesidad por alimentar a su familia la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de productos cosméticos, elaboración de colchones,  venta de chamarras, venta de mandiles y lana, venta de chompas de alpaca, venta de chamarras para niños, taller de soldadura y tapizado de autos, para solicitar un préstamo e invertirlo en sus negocios. Su negocio es la confección de polleras. Para confeccionar una pollera, se necesita entre tres o cuatro metros de tela, siempre y cuando el ancho de ésta sea de un metro y medio. Si el ancho de la tela es menor -por ejemplo, 1,20 metros- se necesitarán al menos seis metros. Las telas no son baratas y la costura de la pollera es complicada.  Ella aprendió el oficio de su madre y toda la vida se dedicó a este arte, llegando a confeccionar vistosas polleras para conjuntos folclóricos porque trabaja con mucho esmero y dedicación. Su espacio de trabajo es un lugar pequeño dentro de su domicilio, eso le da la ventaja de compartir y estar más cerca de sus hijos. Su sueño es tener un taller de costura donde pueda confeccionar sus polleras con mayor comodidad y exhibirlas a sus clientes. Ella desea realizar la compra de tela por mayor, para confeccionar polleras y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes que compran por mayor a fin de año. Esta es la décima secuencia de préstamos con la institución en nueve años que trabaja independientemente.
Es por esos motivos que Teodora solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor y confeccionar polleras para vender por mayor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teodora is a 47 year old married woman with a 13 year old son and 9 year old daughter. Her business is making traditional skirts. She is enterprising, independent, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in "La portada" zone, a busy commercial site known for its variety of agricultural products for working and selling in the mountains.

Teodora has a dark complexion, long curly hair; she's short and dresses traditionally (hat, shawl, skirt). Her first language is Aymara and her second is Spanish. She is seated wearing the black hat and white shawl). She works with her husband selling jugs of gasoline and her two children study in school. They live in their own brick house, with drinkable water and electricity.

The need to support her family caused her to form a community bank with others who have businesses: making bedspreads, selling clothing, selling wool and aprons, selling alpaca sweaters, selling children's sweaters, a welding shop and auto repairs. To make a skirt one needs between three to four meters of fabric, always, and when the layer is 1.5 meters. If the layer is narrower, for example 1.2 meters, then at least 6 meters of fabric is needed. The fabric is not cheap and the sewing is complicated. She learned this work from her mother and has sewn all her life. she makes beautiful skirts and traditional outfits because she works with care and dedication. Her workspace is a small place in her home, which has the advantage of sharing and being with her children.

Her dream is to have a sewing shop where she can make skirts more easily and showcase them for her customers. She wants to buy the fabric at wholesale, to make the skirts and satisfy her customers who buy at the end of the year. this is the 10th loan sequence with the institution in the 9 years that she has been working independently. Therefore Teodora seeks a loan to buy fabric at wholesale and make skirts to sell at wholesale to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale and make traditional skirts to sell at wholesale to her customers.

loans.name: Cenia Uric

texts.es:
La señora Cenia tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene  casa propia su esposo trabaja en Estados Unidos y ella se dedica a la elaboración de rosquillas, hojaldras y quesadillas.
Doña Cenia cuenta con más de 5 años de dedicarse a esta labor y tiene una excelente clientela, vende sus productos en los negocios de la zona los cuales le prefieren por su calidad.
Doña Cenia está solicitando el préstamo para la comprar maíz, manteca, azúcar, harina, etc. que son la materia prima para necesarios para le elaboración de estos los panes.
Con este préstamo espera que su negocio aumente y mejorar su negocio y a su vez seguir apoyando a su familia en el hogar.
   
 Trojes, Honduras - Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Cenia is 32 years old. She is married and has her own home. Her husband works in the United States and she works making donuts, puff pastries, and cheese cakes. She has been in this business for over five years and has an excellent customer base. She sells her products to local businesses who prefer them for their high quality.

Cenia is requesting this loan to buy corn, lard, sugar, flour, and other main ingredients she needs to make her pastries. She hopes this loan to help her increase and improve her business while she continues to support her family at home.

Trojes, Honduras - October, 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, lard, sugar, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ignovación Group

texts.es: Al grupo Ignovacion lo integran tres socios emprendedores, quien lo coordina es la señora María Argentina de 32 años de edad y acompañada, que se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas y enchiladas en su domicilio desde hace cinco años, es un negocio heredad por su mamá, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de maíz, fletes de leña, arroz, aceite, etc. Otro integrante es el Carlos un joven de 24 años de edad comerciante de ropa desde hace ocho años en su comunidad, y Rodolfo de 25 años de edad, dedicado a la comercialización de calzado usado en su comunidad desde hace un año.
texts.en:
The group Ignovacion has three entrepreneurial partners. María Argentina is the person who coordinates the group. She is 32 years old and lives with her common-law partner. For five years, she has been making a living by cooking and selling tortillas and enchiladas from her home, a business that she inherited from her mother. She has asked for a loan to buy corn, loads of firewood, rice, oil, etc. 

Carlos is 24 years old and another member of the group. He has been selling clothes in his local community for 8 years. Rodolfo is 25 and has been making a living selling second-hand footwear for a year.

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, oil, firewood, etc. so that she can increase her business' production.

loans.name: Roosevelt

texts.en:
Roosevelt founded Zoontek, a graphic arts design company, in 2012. He has a college degree in graphic design and illustration and Zoontek specializes in logos, flyers, and other print advertising for small business. Roosevelt is the sole owner and his wife helps him with sales and phone call outreach. They live in the Bronx with their daughter.

Roosevelt says, “I honestly consider every sale a success because you never know what one client can bring you as a reference or future business.” Eventually, Roosevelt wants to open a store front; a physical location will lend credibility in the eyes of his clients. “Opening a store location would be an awesome step for us.” But, before he can do that, Roosevelt needs to make some investments in his business, starting with some major equipment purchases. First on his list: a professional paper cutter. This loan will help Roosevelt with this purchase and help build his credit toward larger equipment purchases, and in the future, a store front.

loans.use: to purchase equipment such as a professional paper cutter and supplies

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima hails from Carles, Iloilo. She is married to a fisherman. They have three children, ages 12, 13 and 14. 

Their fishing business started fourteen years ago. It is not an easy business when there are challenges in the weather, like the typhoon they experienced. She is asking a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy an engine, rope, crab traps, adhesive, plywood, and nylon. 

Zosima hopes that this will enable her to start anew on her business with quality tools to increase their catch. Her income will be used for tuition fees, food, and boat maintenance.

loans.use: to  buy an engine, rope, crab traps, adhesive, plywood, and nylon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a refrigerator to keep food fresh

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Neneta is 58 years old and married with six children.

Neneta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Neneta has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from food vending.

Neneta aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 62 years old, and she is married and has eleven children, one of them in school.

Adelina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to by feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Adelina has been in business for 15 years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her efforts.

In the future, Adelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to by feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nilüfer

texts.en:
Nilüfer is divorced with two children. She does not receive any alimony. Both of her daughters are in school. She needs to work at her house since her daughters are still young. She sells undergarments and pajamas to try to cover her children’s educational expenses. She is trying very hard to support her family. With the loan from Maya she is planning to purchase some more items to sell in order to increase her profits.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nilüfer Hanım,2 çocuklu eşinden ayrı.  Nafaka  alamıyor.  Kızları okuyor.  Çocukları okula gidip geldiğinden işini evden yapmak zorunda.  Çamaşır,pijama satışı yapıyor.  Çocuklarının eğitimini ve giderlerini karşılamak için elinden gelen gayreti gösteriyor.  Bizden aldığı kredi ile çok daha fazla ürün alıp,çok daha fazla para kazanacak.

loans.use: to buy undergarments and pajamas

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, inició su negocio con la premisa de que el tiempo se debe ocupar y que mejor forma que generando recursos para su familia; fue así como  decidió, hace 10 años vender minutos, y poco a poco fue incorporando distintos negocios; una miscelánea donde comercializar productos varios como papelería, accesorios femninos, para el hogar etc; venta de comidas rápidas, venta de celulares y accesorios, recargas, servicio de internet, heladería y venta de golosinas. Marina tiene 59 años, un hijo de 29 años y dos hijas de 37 y 29 años. Vive en un barrio que se encuentra ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, donde son varios, sus vecinos, amigos y transeúntes son sus clientes y proveedores;  gracias a la gama de artículos que vende, tiene mucha demanda de articulos que le compran de contado. Este negocio tiene un excelente flujo de dinero, puesto que sus ventas diarias lo dinamizan  y le permiten reinvertir. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer   crédito otorgado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para  ser invertido en la compra de celulares y accesorios, y dos computadores para ofrecer el servicio de internet. Marina con esta inversión, pretende aumentar sus ventas y así obtener un mejor nivel de ingresos y un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Marina started her business with the premise that one should fill his or her free time--what better way to do so than by generating resources for one’s family. This is how she decided ten years ago to sell minutes, and little by little she incorporated different businesses: a general store where she sells various products like stationery, feminine accessories, home goods, etc., fast food, cell phones and accessories, additional minutes, Internet service, ice cream, and candy.

Marina is 59 years old with a 29 year-old son and two daughters, ages 37 and 29. She lives in a neighborhood located in the Soledad municipality, where she has many neighbors, friends, and passersby as clients and suppliers. Thanks to the range of items that she sells, she has a high demand for items, which are purchased in cash. This business has an excellent flow of money, given that her daily sales stimulate it and allow her to reinvest. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan provided by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation], in order to invest in the purchase of cell phones, accessories, and two computers in order to offer Internet service. With this investment, Marina hopes to increase her sales and therefore be able to obtain a higher level of income and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cell phones, accessories, and two computers

loans.name: Rahmeh

texts.en:
Rahmeh is a 51-year-old conservative woman who asked her son, Fouad, to appear in the photo instead of her.

Rahmeh is a mother of five children; her husband has already retired. Now one of her sons, Fouad, is studying law in his fourth year in the university. He is 22 years old, a single man who is also working at a café to help in paying his own school fees. 

Now Rahmeh is applying for a loan to pay her son’s semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and has 12 children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though John is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group, formed by 14 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

John started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010.  He decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in that he has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

John’s group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so that, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, es propietario de un taller de enderezado y pintura de vehículos, vive en casa de su pareja desde hace 7 años junto a dos hijos de ella, el negocio lo inicio hace aproximadamente 20 años, luego de haberse firmado los acuerdos de paz en el país, trabaja de lunes a domingo, por el momento no representa dificultades.
Comprará cables, fricciones, lubricantes, pinturas y reparar el equipo de trabajo, tendrá en buen estado su equipo para desempeñar sus actividades y tener una situación económica más favorable.
Su visión es mantener el negocio en el mercado, resarcir sus deudas y apoyar a cubrir las necesidades familaires.
texts.en:
Miguel is the owner of a paint and bodywork shop for cars. He has lived in his spouse' house for 7 years with her two children. He started the business approximately 20 years ago after the peace accords were signed in his country. He works Mondays through Sundays, and right now he has no difficulties. He will buy cables, pulleys, lubricants, and paints, as well as repair the work equipment. His equipment will be in good condition to do his work and have a more favorable financial situation. 

His vision is to keep the business in the market, pay off his debts and help cover his family members' needs.

loans.use: to buy cables, pulleys, lubricants, and paints, as well as to repair his work equipment so it will be in good condition to do his work.

loans.name: Honorio

texts.en:
Honorio is a new member of Maya Mountain Cacao. He lives in the beautiful village of San Antonio. He is inspired by other farmers. His dad was a cacao farmer, and by seeing other farmers generating financial income from the production of cacao, he became inspired to do so also.

Honorio is requesting this Kiva loan to purchase his cacao seedlings so that he can expand and begin farming more cacao. He hopes to see a better future with planting more cacao trees and seeing a high production. He also stated that he plans to retire as a farmer and have some level of income from the farm.

loans.use: to purchase cacao seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 1,000 cacao seedlings

loans.name: Sherly

texts.es: Sherly de 23 años de edad es comerciante desde el año 2012, cuando quedó desempleada y para al mismo tiempo generar ingresos y atender su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y su pequeña hija de 3 meses, decidió emprender una aventura de negocios vendiendo ropa interior y exterior, accesorios femeninos  y todo lo que su clientela le solicitare.  Sus ventas las realiza a crédito trabajando todos los días sin límites en su horario, con el fin de lograr expandirse mucho más y ampliar y organizar su negocio. Serly con su decisión de emprendimiento ha logrado apoyar la gestión de bienestar de su hogar, la cual se encontraba totalmente en manos de su cónyuge. Su deseo hoy de crecer no se detiene, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumería, ropa interior y accesorios femeninos que han sido encargados por su clientela, Con esta inversión mejora su negocio en cuanto que aumenta su capital de trabajo y con ello la oferta a su clientela, lo que hace que su credikiva tenga éxito.
texts.en: Sherly is 23 years old and has been a retailer since 2012 when she was left unemployed. At the same time, to generate income and attend to her home, made up of her spouse and her 3 month old daughter, she decided to undertake a business venture selling undergarments, clothing, feminine accessories, and anything her clients ordered from her. She sells on credit, working every day with no limits on her schedule in order to achieve more and expand and organize her business. With her venture decision, Serly has managed to support the well-being of her home, which is entirely in the hands of her spouse. Her dream today is continue to grow without stopping, for which she is applying for a credikiva, the first financing she is doing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy perfume, undergarments, and feminine accessories which have been ordered by her clients. With this investment, she will improve her business and increase her working capital. With that she can increase her offerings to her clients and make her credikiva successful.

loans.use: to buy perfume, undergarments, and female accessories.

loans.name: Nesrin

texts.en:
Nesrin has 2 children and a husband, who is retired. Her daughter is studying at university. 

Nesrin is going through tough times. However, she is currently taking a cake baking course and trying to be trained in that field. She makes a small income from the things that she bakes and sells in her neighborhood, such as birthday cakes, muffins, and small pizzas for special occasions. 

Nesrin will use her loan to buy special equipment related to the cake business in order to expand her services, gain more customers, and thus earn more income.  

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Nesrin Hanım,2 çocuklu,eşi emekli.  Kızı ünversite okuyor.  Sıkıntılı bir hayat yaşıyor.  Pastacılık kurslarına katılarak,pastacılık eğitimi alıyor.  Bu aldığı eğitimi ile ekonomiye çevirmek için.  Çevresinde yaş günleri,misafir ağırlamalarda sipariş alıyor,pasta,pizza vs. yapıyor.  Para kazanıyor.  Ancak,pasta kalıpları,malzemelerde eksiklik yaşıyor.  Kredi alıp,malzemelerini genişletip,çok daha fazla çeşit üretmek ve daha çok para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy special baking equipment.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.es: Kevin de 24 años de edad se dedica al reciclaje desde el año 2007, cuando por iniciativa propia, tomo un pequeño capital ahorrado, para comprarle a sus vecinos papel, cartón,  etc. Kevin aprovechó que había trabajado 1 año en una recicladora y aprendió a todas las tareas propias de esta actividad. Una vez inició su propio negocio, generó ganancias que le permitieron comprar una carreta, con el que continuó desarrollando esta actividad. En su negocio Kevin compra enseres y equipos de segunda los cuales desarma y clasifica para lograr su venta final. Él usa un megáfono y va puerta a puerta ofreciéndole a sus clientes comprarle hierro, papel, y todo los artículos que son los insumos del reciclaje. .  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cartón, papel, hierro, aluminio, cobre y bronce; con esta inversión mejora su negocio en cuanto que aumenta su capital de trabajo y el volumen de sus compras, lo que hace que su credikiva tenga éxito.
texts.en:
Kevin, who is 24-years old, has made his living in recycling since 2007.  That is when, on his own initiative, he took a small amount of capital he had saved and purchased paper, cardboard etc. from his neighbors.  Kevin took advantage of the fact that he had worked for a year at a recycling plant and learned all that is required for his business.  Once he started his own business, he generated enough profit to be able to purchase a cart.  He uses the cart to keep developing his business.  Kevin purchases basic tools and second-hand equipment, which he dissembles and sorts for their final sales.  He uses a megaphone to go from door to door offering to buy his customers' iron, paper and all items that are of recyclable materials.  
Kevin is currently requesting a "credikiva," his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan, he will purchase cardboard, paper, iron, aluminum, copper and bronze.  This investment will improve his business.  Increasing his working capital and his purchasing volume will ensure that his "credikiva" is successful.

loans.use: to purchase cardboard, paper, iron, aluminum, copper and bronze.

loans.name: Deybes

texts.es: Frituras, patacones, papas fritas y rellenas, acompañado de una oferta de servicios de telecomunicaciónes ,son las actividades que realiza Deybes de 33 años de edad desde hace 8 años, cuando impulsado por la necesidad de generar ingresos y sin posibilidades de empleo, decidió emprender su negocio propio, con el fin de resolver esta situación. En la actualidad trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde sin cesar. vendiendo de contado a los estudiantes del colegio en el cual se encuentra ubicado su negocio. Su meta es ampliar su infraestructura, y mas adelante construír el segundo piso de su vivienda pero su maximo desafio es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para responder a este sueño de manera inmediata. En la actualidad está motivado por el crecimiento de su negocio a final del año, momento en el cual sus ventas se incrmentan y esta es justamente la razón por la acuala cude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará dos carros de frituras y de limonadas. Con esta inversión aumentará sus ventas, su liquidéz será mayor y las utilidades mejoraran sustancialmente haciendo que su credikiva mejore las condiciones totales d esu negocio.
texts.en:
Deybes is 33 years old and has prepared fried foods, fried plantains, french fries, and fried stuffed potatoes, alongside working in telecommunication services, for the past 8 years. Motivated by a need to generate more income, and lacking opportunities for work, he decided to start his own business with the aim to resolve this situation. He currently works Monday through Friday, from 5 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon without stopping, selling his products to high school students that are near his business. His goal is to broaden his infrastructure, and eventually, add a second floor to his home. His main challenge at the moment is not having sufficient capital to work towards this dream. 

Deybes is currently motivated by the growth of his business at the end of the year, a time when his sales increase. This is truly the reason he is requesting a Kiva loan, the primary financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will buy two food carts for fried goods and lemonade. With this investment, he will increase his sales and have greater liquidity, and these improvements from the Kiva loan will lead to better overall business conditions and opportunities down the road.

loans.use: to buy two food carts for fried goods and lemonade.

loans.name: Riker

texts.es: Riker es un joven luchador que trabaja como almacenera en una empresa, no pudo concluir sus estudios superiores por motivos económicos. Constituyo su familia con la cual vive en  una casa modesta, ellos son su gran motivación para todo lo que se propone, es por ello que desea brindarles lo mejor y construir su vivienda de material noble para una mayor seguridad y calidad de vida a los seres que más ama. Riker se siente agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que de brindarle el crédito podrá cumplir su mayor sueño de construir una casa más segura.
texts.en:
Riker's a determined young man who works in a company as a shopkeeper.  For financial reasons, he wasn't able to complete his college education.  He started his family, with whom he lives in a modest house.  They're his biggest motivation for everything he does, so he wants to give them the best and build his house of quality materials so the people he loves most have better security and quality of life.

Riker's grateful to Kiva lenders because with the loan he'll be able to realize his biggest dream of building a safer house.

loans.use: to build his home of quality materials

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: Ever, emprendió su negocio de billar y venta de bebidas hace 29 años,  gracias a que un amigo le recomendó iniciar su propio negocio y generar ingresos, fue así  como dio inicio a esta idea de negocio con la que ha logrado obtener los recursos para educar a sus hijos y mantener a su familia. En su negocio los clientes además de tener acceso a este juego de destreza y estrategia  pueden degustar cervezas, gaseosas y jugos. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y transeúntes a quien les vende de contado. Sus compras las realiza a crédito a las empresas distribuidoras de gaseosa y cervezas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para mejorar el stock de productos y garantizar un incremento en las utilidades, por eso comprará refrescos, bebidas y jugos naturales. Ever tiene 58 años y es padre de un hijo de 28 años y una hija de 25 años de edad, su padre es  un ejemplo de superación para ellos y a futuro desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida al hacer una ampliación de su vivienda por medio de  la construcción de dos apartamentos.  A futuro su desafío es lograr el acceso al crédito para  modernizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ever set up his pool hall  business 29 years ago thanks to a friend recommending him to start his own business and generate an income. That was how he initiated the idea of this business with which he has managed to obtain the resources to educate his children and support his family.

In his business his clients, in addition to having access to this game of skill and strategy, can try beers, sodas and juices. His main clients are his neighbours and passers-by who pay in cash. He buys his stock on credit from soda and beer distribution companies.

At present he is applying for a kiva loan, the first financing  it is making to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to increase his stock and guarantee a rise in his earnings. He will buy soft drinks, drinks and natural juices.

Ever is 58 and has a 28-year-old son and a 25-year-old daughter. Their  dad is an example to them of getting ahead, and in the future he wants to offer them a better quality of life, by extending their home with the construction of two apartments. His challenge for the future is to manage to get a loan to modernize his business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, drinks and natural juices.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a proud 56-year-old father of 9 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 16 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Joseph has noticed that he has learned a lot from farming trainings.

Joseph described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Joseph’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anita Limbani

texts.es:
Anita Limbani tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en el distrito de Oyotun, una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Anita Limbani se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(patos, conejos, cuyes, entre otros), desde hace 04 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, Anita Limbani solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; pues ella necesita realizar la compra de pavos, gallinas, cerdos, cuyes, pichones por campaña navideña; el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión de animales esto con la finalidad de incrementar su productividad de los mismos y satisfacer las diversas necesidades y preferencias de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anita Limbani is 48 years old, is single and takes care of one son. She lives in a house she owns in the district of Oyotún, a rural area where residents make a living in agriculture, trade and livestock. It is located in the province of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Perú.

Anita Limbani makes a living raising and selling small farm animals (ducks, rabbits, guinea pigs, among others).  For 4 years now, her business has been located in her home.  Anita Limbani is requesting the loan for working capital because she needs to buy turkeys, chickens, pigs, guinea pigs and pigeons for the Christmas season.  The loan will help her make a greater investment in animals with the goal of increasing their productivity and in order to satisfy the different demands and preferences of her customers.  This will allow her to improve her revenues in the short term, increase her profits and therefore improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to obtain a loan for working capital because she needs to buy turkeys, chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, pigeons for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, slippers, candles, flour and other products

loans.name: Ofrecina

texts.en:
Ofrecina is fifty years old. She is married and all her six children are now adults. 

She and her husband are engaged in fishing and the buying-and-selling of empty shells. They buy empty shells from fishermen, have them cleaned, and sell them to another buyer. The shells will be brought to the city and exported to be used for ornaments, decorations, and necklaces. 

Ofrecina is asking a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy a new boat, engine and as an additional capital to buy more empty shells.

Her income takes care of her needs for food and pays for household bills. In the future, she hope to expand her business for better profitability.

loans.use: to buy a new boat, engine, and shells to sell as ornaments

loans.name: Justus's Group

texts.en:
This is Justus, who has been a farmer for more than thirty years. Although he is pictured alone, he is actually representing his group of eleven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. Justus has always been described as a very hardworking individual, which is largely why he was selected to be the group leader.

Justus started working with One Acre Fund for the first time in 2012, and this year he decided to not only get farming inputs but also a solar-powered light as part of his loan. He is very excited about this new addition, as now he will be able to reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. He can’t wait to send his children to school using the profits he earns from this coming season.

With a loan of 106,030 KES Justus’s Group will be able to plant a total of six acres using the farming inputs and buy eleven solar lights.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize as well as a solar-powered light.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 53 years old and married with five children. For the past five years, she has been raising pigs and cows in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from selling food.

Benedicta is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her cows. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her cows

loans.name: Alfred's Group

texts.en:
Alfred's Group is formed by 11 farmers in the Webuye District and is represented by Alfred, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 40 years old and married with four children. For the past 20 years, Alfred has been a farmer and he is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Alfred isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has had more profit from each harvest since. This year, Alfred will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this as he will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Alfred's Group is requesting a loan to purchase a total of 13 solar lights and hybrid seeds and fertilizer to cultivate maize. The group will plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase solar lights and hybrid seeds and fertilizer to cultivate maize

loans.name: Murodaly

texts.en: Murodaly is a student of the second course at Tajikistan State University, Politics and Business. He is a smart and clever man. Murodaly studies economics. He studies well and he is one of the best students. He is not married and lives with his parents in the country. He has been busy with animal husbandry in his free time from education. Murodaly is a very hardworking man and he dreams of being successful in the future. He is asking for a loan of 600 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Hayla Johana

texts.es:
Hayla Johana tiene 32 años de edad, vive en casa de su padre vive con sus dos menores hijos, vive con su cónyugue. Hayla Johana vive en la parte rural del distrito distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú; contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Hayla Johana es el servicio de transporte urbano por mototaxi cuenta con unidad propia, unidad es conducida por su conyugue, el trabajo lo realiza en el distrito de Pucará y caserios aledaños. Cuenta con más de 5 años dedicandose a este rubro, además se dedica a la cria de animales domesticos, ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el crédito sin ningún problema. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en hacer arreglos a su unidad de trabajo, con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Hayla Johana, 32, lives in the her father's house with her two minor children and her husband.  Hayla Johana lives in the rural part of the District of Pucara, Province of Jaen, Cajamarca Region, of the northern mountains of Peru.  They have electricity and running water.  Her community basically engages in agriculture, ranching and commerce.
Hayla Johana makes a living with an urban transport service by mototaxi which she owns.  The vehicle is driven by her husband.  They work in the Pucara District and surrounding hamlets.  She has been involved in this work for five years.  In addition, she makes a living raising domestic animals, generating additional income which will permit her to cover the loan without any problem.  The object of the loan will be to invest in making repairs to her work vehicle with which she will be able to generate greater income and thus be able to improve her quality of life.  In this line of work, there is not better competition in the zone and with it she will obtain better prices.

loans.use: to invest in repairs for her work vehicle.

loans.name: Idona

texts.en:
Idona is 18 years old. She is a hardworking and smart girl. She is not married and lives with her parents.
