She decided to start a new business with buying and selling food items in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She studied at the course of ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and got enough skills for business.  

Her mother will help her with the business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 TJS to buy food items for organizing the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy food items for organizing a new business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 53 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc.

Delia has been in this business for four years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 54-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years. 

Lilia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Bader

texts.en:
Bader is a 20-year-old single man who lives in Almafraq with six family members. 

He is studying for his bachelor's degree in accounting and business law in his second year.  His dad is retired military  and his brother works in the military, too. 

Bader is applying for a loan to help him cover his semester fees. Bader’s future plan is to work in the field of his major .

loans.use: to pay for semester fees

loans.name: Aliet's Group

texts.en:
Aliet, pictured above, has eight children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Aliet is representing her group of six farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Aliet has been a farmer for 12 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Aliet is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 2.5 acres will be planted by Aliet's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 48 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Violeta has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman, 28, is married and the father of five children. He and his family live in Sana'a, Yemen’s capital, where he is the sole breadwinner of his family. He has an elementary school education.

Eman and his family’s home hasn’t a lot of furniture, and what it does have is very old. Because he doesn’t have enough discretionary income to purchase new furnishings, he has applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to buy some.

Eman hopes to send his children to school and finish building his house.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Chara's Group

texts.en:
Chara is a thirty year old Komaza tree farmer. He has four children, all of whom are in school. Chara is married and his spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Chara supports his family with farming. 

He decided to join Komaza to increase his household's income and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to to educate his children, restructure his house, and improve his farming through purchase of high-quality inputs. 

Chara’s favorite part about working with Komaza is maintaining his tree farm as its grows. Chara is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Johanna Annabelly

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Luz De América,
En este lugar vive la señora Johanna, tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres  hijos de 6, 4 y 2 años  de edad, los mayores estudian en escuela y jardín de infantes. 
Doña Johanna con la finalidad de ganarse la vida y la de sus pequeños se dedica a varias actividades, ella pinta uñas ya sea en su casa o a domicilio, pero también todas las tardes en sociedad con una cuñada se dedican a la venta de comida rápida, ellas preparan y venden  hamburguesas, papas fritas, sodas, jugos y batidos de frutas, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días en sus actividades,  ella hace lo necesario para darles lo mejor a sus pequeños y ya son más de 2 años con este negocio con el cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos y esmaltes de uñas. Lleva 3 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la facilidad para recibir los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the "City of the Royal Tamarinds", the members of “Grupo de Crédito Luz De América” (Light of America Communal Bank) meet every two weeks. 

This city is home to Johanna.  She is 23 years old.  She is a single mother of three children who are 6, 4 and 2 years old.  The older ones attend school and kindergarten. 

Johanna, with the purpose of earning a living for herself and for her young ones, works in several business activities.  She paints nails either in her house or the houses of others, but she also works selling fast food every afternoon in the company of a sister-in-law.  They prepare and sell hamburgers, French fries, sodas, juices and fruit shakes, among other things.  She works every day in her two jobs.  She does what is necessary to give the best to her children.  She has already been with this business for more than 2 years and she is getting ahead. 

She will use this loan to purchase provisions to prepare food and nail polish.  She has been in the communal bank for three years and she likes it for the ease in receiving loans.  

Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies and nail polish.

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en:
Arshak lives with his family in Vanadzor within the Lori region of Armenia. He is a beloved father of three children--two daughters and a son--and all of them are still school-aged. His wife works as a nurse at the local clinics.

Arshak has had a vocational education and is an electrical mounting specialist. He has always worked at this specialty and already has 21 years of experience. Now he works at the hydroelectric power station as a leading specialist. His wife and he greatly desire to see their children achieve higher educations and be good and clever workers, no matter what area of expertise they choose.

With the coming of New Year’s, Arashk and his wife want to buy their lovely children a special gift. To this end Arshak is applying for a 210,000 AMD loan through Nor Horizon in order to buy a computer for their children, which will be a great surprise and a nice present for them all.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his children

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 39-year-old hardworking woman married to Michael, who adds additional income to support their family. Theu are blessed with four children. Beatrice has been a farmer for a period of ten years, earning herself an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Beatrice is now servicing her fourth loan of KES 15,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm produce.

Beatrice plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have growth in her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Briggy Tatiana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Luz De América,
En este lugar vive la señora Briggy, tiene 21  años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos, uno de 4 años y un bebé de 11 meses  de edad, el mayor estudia en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es ayudante de topógrafo.
Doña Briggy con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, trabaja todos los días unas tres o cuatro horas por día,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  3 años y le gusta por la rapidez de los créditos. Sus sueños es ter su propia casa ya que viven en un departamento de sus familiares.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí and known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the partners of the credit group Luz De America meet every two weeks.
Briggy, 21, lives in the place.  She is in a common-law marriage and from this union she has two children, a son, 4, and a baby of 11 months.  The older one studies in kindergarten.  Her husband is a topographer's assistant.
With the intention of earning something on her own and with this be able to get her household ahead, Briggy makes a living selling clothing of all types.  She sells door-to-door and she also sells out of her home where she has a little space.  She works every day for three or four hours a day.  She sells on credit to her customers and collects every two weeks.  She goes to Guayaquil every two weeks or once a month to buy her merchandise according to the need.  She has been doing this for a year and it goes well for her.
She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothes.  She has been in the credit group for three years and she likes the rapidity of the loans.  Her dream is to have her own house as they live in an apartment of her relatives.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Charities

texts.en:
Charities is 32 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are in school, so she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc..

Charities has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine, pictured above, has nine children and is always described as a very trustworthy person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Catherine is representing her group of ten farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Catherine has been a farmer for 15 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Catherine is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 4.5 acres will be planted by Catherine's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Dastagiri

texts.en:
Dastagiri lives in Orvakal village in Kurnool district, Andhra Pradesh. As the river flows close to the village, the area has mostly agricultural land. 

He is 56 years old and is a tough, confident man with a strong willpower. He is married and has a child. 

Dastagiri cultivates Bengal gram and cotton. His wife is also helping him in his business. He has been associated with the local NGO “Sahaja Samrudha”; he is very active in NGO activities. 

Now Dastagiri is requesting a loan of INR 50,000 to improve his agriculture. He will use the money to buy quality seeds and fertilizers and for other expenses of agriculture. 

He hopes this will increase his monthly income. He wants to save enough money for his child’s education and for his future.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en:
Joan is a 40-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Joan has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Joan described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Joan’s Group will be able to plant a total of 10.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old and has one child in school.

Annie has a computer shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional unit for her business.

Annie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit for her business.

loans.name: Kadi's Group

texts.en: Kadi is a thirty-six year old Komaza tree farmer. He has eight children, all of whom are in school. Kadi is married and his spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Kadi also cultivates maize, cassava and cowpeas to support his family. He decided to join Komaza to increase his household's income, and contribute to afforestation and rainfall creation. Kadi plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to educate his children and improve his family's standard of living. His favorite part about working with Komaza is planting and maintaining his tree farm. Kadi is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Elora

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Элора. Ей 30 лет. У нее имеется собственный малый торговый бизнес. Элора на рынке занимается продажей женских одежд, а также тканей и материалов. В этом бизнесес она уже 6 лет. Данный бизнес она начинала с помощью матери в 2008 году. Элора разведена и живет с матерью в районе Спитамен. Мать всегда поддерживала и до сих пор поддерживает ее во всем. Она была очень огорчена когда семейная жизнь дочери не сложилась. Но Элора сильная женщина, она не отчаялась в жизни и всецело отдалась в бизнес. В данный момент Элора нуждается в заемных средствах, чтобы закупить сезонный товар и увеличить объем продаж. Кредит поможет Элоре расширить бизнес, получить больше дохода от продаж и тем самым увеличить бюджет семьи. Она верит и надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This is Elora.  She is 30 years old and she is running her own small retail business, selling women's clothes and fabrics at the market.  She has been in this business for the past six years (she started in 2008 with the help of her mother).  Elora is divorced and lives with her mother in the Spitamen region.  Elora's mother has always been very supportive and she still supports her daughter with everything.  She was quite upset when her daughter's married life did not work out. But Elora is a strong woman; she didn't give up and instead gave herself entirely to her business.  Elora currently needs to borrow some money in order to buy seasonal merchandise and increase her sales' volume.  This loan will help Elora to expand her business, increase her income and sales, and at the same time will help with the family's budget.  Elora is confident that she will receive support.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes as well as fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Martina es a la venta de abarrotes, cerveza y chicha de jora, Martina realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 7 años. Con experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias en la zona. El destino del crédito será para implementación de su bodega con una mayor variedad de productos. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Martina is 47 years old. She lives with her family in the Buenos Aires district, a community that works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It is located in the Morropon province, which belongs to the Piura region in the northern coast of Peru.

Martina makes a living selling groceries, beer, and "chicha de jora" (Peruvian corn-based beer). Martina has been doing this for over 7 years, and she has experience in the business as well as good references in the area. She will use this loan to stock her small grocery store with a greater variety of products. In the short term, this will allow her to improve her income, increase her earnings, and therefore improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to stock her small grocery store with a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Amos's Group

texts.en:
Amos is a proud 49-year-old father of 6 children. He is a group leader who is often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of 7 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Amos has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Amos described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Amos’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Walter Abel

texts.es:
Walter Abel tiene 44 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero. Vive en casa propia, junto a su hijo. Él cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad rural dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Walter Abel cuenta con ingresos del cultivo y comercio de alfalfa y panca, además percibe ingresos de crianza y venta de cuyes. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de madera para diseñar jaulas para cuyes, para poder criarlos en mejores condiciones, lo que le va a permitirlo venderlos en mejores condiciones(mejor calidad) a un buen precio; lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Walter Abel is 44 years old, and his civil status is single. He lives in his own home alongside his son. He has good personal and work references, and is from a united family. He lives in a rural community that is dedicated to trade, agriculture, and cattle raising. It is located in the Cayaltí district, in the Chiclayo province, of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Walter Abel relies on income from the cultivation and sale of alfalfa and corn husks, he also receives income from raising and selling guinea pigs. The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of wood to build cages for guinea pigs in order to raise them in better conditions, which is going to allow him to sell them in better conditions (better quality) at a good price. This will allow him to improve his revenues in the short term, increase his profits, and ultimately improve his quality of life, and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood to build cages for guinea pigs in order to raise them in better conditions.

loans.name: Eleida Genoveva

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Luz De América,
En este lugar vive la señora Eleida, tiene 66 años de edad, está separada y de esa relación tiene 5 hijos  mayores de edad e independientes, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa, con ella también vive un nieto el cual está por terminar sus estudios superiores.
Doña Eleida es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante junto a su familia, ella  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, aceite, arroz, detergentes, carne, pescado, queso y otros productos, ella también ahí mismo vende escobas, cepillos, artículos de bazar, helados y muchos otros productos, una de sus hijas le ayuda con el negocio,  ella tiene más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida y la de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para surtir aun más su tienda. Lleva más de 18 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la facilidad para obtener los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí and known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the partners of the credit group Luz De America meet every two weeks.
Eleida lives in this place.  She is 66 years old, separated and from this union she has five children, all grown up and independent.  Two of them still live in her house.  A grandson, who is about to finish his higher education, also lives with her.
Eleida is a woman who likes to work in order to get ahead with her family.  She has a shop of essential food items in her house in which she sells all types of products of primary necessity such as oil, rice, detergents, meat, fish, cheese, and other products.  She also sells brooms, brushes, bazaar articles, ice creams, and many other products there.  One of her daughters helps her with the business.  She has been doing this by which she earns a living for herself and her family for over ten years.
She will use this loan to buy essential food items to stock her shop even more.  She has been in the credit group for over 18 years and she likes the ease of obtaining loans.  Her dream is to have good health for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy essential foods items.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar tiene 56 años de edad, es casado, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Julio Cesar se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, Julio Cesar solicita préstamo para mejoramiento de infraestructura donde se encuentran sus animales, dicha inversión le servirá para criar en mejores condiciones a sus animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Julio Cesar piensa mejorar productividad de los animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 56 years old. He is married and does not have any children. He lives with his family in a rural area of the Oyotun district, which is located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. His community works in agriculture, livestock, and commerce. 

Julio Cesar makes a living raising and selling animals. He has more than 10 years of experience with this business, which is located in the rear of his house. Julio Cesar is requesting a loan to improve the infrastructure of the place where he keeps his animals. This will allow him to raise his animals in better conditions, which will greatly impact his business.

Julio Cesar hopes to improve the productivity of his animals in order to meet the diverse needs and preferences of the customers in the area. In the short term, this will allow him to better his income, increase his earnings, and therefore improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of the place where he keeps his animals.

loans.name: Real Atahuallpa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “REAL ATAHUALLPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
El socio Alfredo tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando como guía de turismo, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
EL socio solicita el crédito para la compra de boletos turísticos.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras,  restaurante, agricultura, venta de leña, transporte.
Los socios que salen en la  foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the communal bank "REAL ATAHUALLPA".  This bank is located in the District of Cusco, belonging to the Province of Cusco, and the Department of Cusco.
The partner Alfredo is 26 years old and is cohabitating.  The partner alternates his daily activities working as a tourism guide.  The partner does well with his business which goes well thanks to the effort he puts into his work every day.  The partner wishes to continue working in order to continue supporting his family.
The partner is requesting the loan to buy tourist tickets.
The partner feels grateful for the loan offered and promises to follow through with the established payments.
The other partners make a living in the businesses of vegetable sales, restaurant work, agriculture, firewood sales, and transportation.
The partners shown in the attached pictures requested permission to arrive late for the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets.

loans.name: Mahmadsobir

texts.ru:
Махмадсобир мужчина 35 лет , женат, молодой отец троих детей. Он вырос в сельской местности и с юного возраста помогал родителям ухаживать за скотом и работать на поле. У него была мечта переехать в город,поступить в университет и стать архитектором. Но его мечта не смогла осуществиться ,потому что в то время у его родителей не было средств ,чтобы оплатить за университет ,поэтому Махмадсобир закончил школу, женился и продолжил заниматься животноводство. В настоящее время у него есть собственный участок земли,на котором он и ухаживает за скотом . У него есть коровы,овцы,бараны. Жена Махмадсобира помогает ему в его делах.Он трудится день и ночь,чтобы его дети не знали ни в чем нужд,чтобы он был в состоянии дать им высшее образование. 
Махмадсобир собирается закупить корм для скота,но у него не хватает денег.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Махмадсобир заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие  и надеется,что МДО Арванд выделит ему нужную сумму .
texts.en:
Mahmadsobir is 35, married, and a father of three young children.  He grew up in a rural area and helped his parents care for their animals and work the land from a young age.  He would dream of moving to the city and going to college to become an architect, but was never able to as his parents didn't have enough money.  Instead, after finishing secondary school, he got married and continued to raise livestock.  He currently has his own plot of land where he keeps cows, sheep and rams, and his wife helps him tend to their animals.  He works day and night to provide for his children and ensure that they can eventually go to college and get a university education.

Mahmadsobir is preparing to lay in stores of cattle feed, but lacks the money to do so; as such, he's seeking a loan from MDO Arvand.  He hopes they'll be able to grant him the money he needs, and would like to thank them in advance for their trust and support.

loans.use: buy cattle feed

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.en: Shafoat was born in 1980. She is not married and lives with her parents. She is a very hardworking woman and always cares for the well-being of her family. Shafoat always wanted to start her own business. She is going to organize a business of animal husbandry. Shafoat, with this aim, took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and got a certificate. She will buy sheep, feed them for some months and sell them in a local market. Shafoat is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni to buy two sheep to organize her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy sheep to organize her new business.

loans.name: Yahal Tangni Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por 8 mujeres luchadoras y un hombre emprendedor, que se organizaron hace un año, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento, mejorar su calidad de vida y comprar mercadería para sus negocios, materiales de construcción para mejorar sus viviendas de tambo de madera, artículos para el hogar, como traste a través de la conformación del banco comunal Yahal Tagni, que en miskito significa Flor de Chaparro, es una planta que la población utiliza para lavar traste y los pisos de madera de las casas de tambo.

Sara: Es la coordinadora, tiene 53 años de edad, originaria de Waspam, casada, tiene 5 hijas: tres mayores de edad y dos adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Trabaja como cocinera, su esposo es albañil. Con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos, solicita financiamiento para comprar una paca mixta y venderla de manera ambulante y en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo de madera. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up of eight hard-working women and one enterprising man.  They came together to form the "Yaha Tagni" communal bank one year ago with the goal of accessing financing to improve their qualities of life, to purchase merchandise for their businesses, to purchase construction materials to make improvements to their wooden, stilt homes and to purchase household goods like dishes.  Yahal Tagni, means "Flor de Chaparro" in Miskito.  It's a plant that the people use to wash their dishes and the floors of their wooden, stilt homes.  

Sara is the coordinator of the communal bank.  She is 53-years old and a native of Waspam.  She is married and has five children, three of whom are grown.  The two adolescents attend primary school.  Sara works as a cook and her husband is a bricklayer.  With the goal of improving her income, Sara is requesting a loan to purchase a mixed bag of clothing to sell on the street and also from the passageway of her wooden, stilt house.  Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase a mixed bundle of clothing for re-sale.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  San Ramon está formado por  18 integrantes, pero en este ciclo solo solicitan este préstamo 17 de ellas, están  el tercer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Dora  quien en la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza que se le practicó esta en el nivel 3, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando. Se dedica a las ventas varias, ya que tiene un negocio donde tiene artículos de primera necesidad en su despensa.
Este préstamo lo solicita para la compra frutas, verduras, artículos de primera necesidad  y otros, de manera a poder surtir su despensa y seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The San Ramon communal bank is made up of 18 members, but in this lending cycle only 17 of them are requesting loans. They are in their third lending cycle with the women's committee program, and they are all working to help one another get ahead.

One of the members is Sra. Dora, who was a Level 3 on the "Stoplight Poverty" questionnaire she filled out. This means that she has been improving her poverty status through her efforts and continual work and by applying the necessary behaviors of a successful woman; she finds her situation improving. Sra. Dora makes her living selling a variety of items. She has a business that sells basic necessities.

Sra. Dora is requesting this loan to purchase fruits, vegetables, basic necessities and other items so she can stock up her general store and continue with her sales, as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, basic necessities and other items.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 31 years old, working in a market as the head of bread selling and she has requested a loan of 300 SSP from WOYE MFI. The loan will be used to improve the standards of her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more foods for customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fish and other food to increase her sales.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres La Central Group

texts.es:
De 32 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene cuatro hijos los primeros dos hijos ya tienen familias apartes y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad. (Dominga es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda de la fotografía)	

El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de trajes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 18 años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de verduras negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de cinco años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Dominga para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.

El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería de trajes típicos para luego venderlas por los alrededores de su comunidad. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
The borrower is a 32-year old woman who is willing to become known in her community for the activity she develops with so much effort and dedication. She is married, lives with her husband and looks to get ahead and reach the dreams in her life. She has 4 children: 2 already have their families and the other 2 are excellent students at the local school. Dominga is the woman that appears first from the right on the picture. 

The job that she performs with so much care is the purchase and sale of traditional clothes. She works at home as well as in nearby locations of her community. She has been in the business for 18 years. Her second activity is the sale of vegetables, a business that she has been in with her sister for over 5 years. This allows them to generate income for their families and to improve their financial situation and that of the community. 

She has been an example in her community, which is why a group of women have joined Dominga to start their businesses. She will use the loan to buy traditional clothes to be sold in the community. One of her dreams is to have a store in the local market and to see her children becoming professionals in their lives.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes.

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en: Sovann is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 28 years old and lives in a wooden one floor house  with her husband, her son and her relatives. They are 6 people living together.  Her family owns 6 hectares of rice field 2 hectares of cassava field and 4 pigs. In 2004 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong,  a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women, by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sovann makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for her field and pigs food.  Thanks to the loan,  Sovann will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en: Phoeun is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. He is 52 years old. He lives in a wooden pile house with his wife, their daughter and their 3 sons. His family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava field. In 2013 he was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social entreprise which fights rural exodus by offering sustainable work to men and women in the village. Phoeun makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. He uses his weaving income to pay for his family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for his field and to develop his business;  Thanks to the loan, he will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation fees of the loom. Please support him so he can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Sokorm

texts.en:
Sokorm is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 21 years old. 
She lives in a wooden one floor house  with her relatives.  Her family owns 2 hectares of rice field. 
In 2014 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong,  a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. 
Sokorm makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to buy fertiliser for the family's field. 
Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and start to weave her loom

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. 

She is 47 years old. 

She lives in a wooden pile house with her husband, their daughter and their 3 sons. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava field.

In 2000 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.

Kong makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the field and to extend her lending business. 

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of her loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk in order to weave her loom

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. 

She is 19 years old and lives in a wooden one floor house with her family. 

In 2014 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. 

Chantha makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. With the income she gets by weaving, she can help her mother in the daily expenses.  

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy dyed silk for her loom

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 25 years old. She is a responsible mother of one child. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of three people. She is well trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to people, at her own house. 

She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Shaheen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her own stitching business

loans.name: Maiz Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras, que se organizaron hace dos meses, con el  propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar su calidad de vida y comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios

JENELY: Es joven de 27 años de edad, amable, madre soltera de 2 hijos menores de edad. El mayor de 10 años estudia su cuarto grado de primaria. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar mercadería para su pulpería: chivería, granos básicos, detergentes, cloros, jabones, entre otros. Su sueño es establecer una distribuidora y apoyar al desarrollo humano y profesional de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group has 3 entrepreneurial female members, who decided to join 2 months ago with an aim to access financing and improve their quality of life. They plan to buy inputs for their small businesses. 

Jenely is a 27-year old kind woman and single mother of 3 minor children. Her oldest child is 10 and attends 4th grade at school. She is requesting a loan to buy stock for her grocery store: candy, basic grains, detergent, chlorine and soap, among others. Her dream is to set up a distribution business and to support the human and professional development of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store: candy, basic grains, detergent, chlorine and soap, among others.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia: Es una mujer alegre, luchadora, tiene 46 años de edad, madre soltera de 5 hijos: 3 mayores de edad, la de 18 años estudia su primer año de carrera universitaria y el menor de 13 años estudia su sexto grado de primaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace 24 años estableció su negocio de venta ropa usada, en un tramo en el mercado. Solicita financiamiento para comprar pacas mixtas en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Dionicia is a 46 year-old cheerful and hard-working woman. She is a single mother of 5 children, 3 of whom are adults. Her 18-year old daughter is at her first year of university and her youngest, aged 13, is at 6th grade. She started her second-hand clothes selling business 24 years ago, with the goal to provide for her children. 

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing items in Managua to be sold at affordable prices in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. Her dream is to have a profitable business.

loans.use: to buy clothing items in Managua.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Margaret, a 36-year-old farmer from a remote village in Kesses in the Eldoret area of Kenya. She resides with her husband, with whom she is blessed with three children. She has been actively involved in farming for the last 10 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming, and sells milk, eggs and various food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she is facing is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs. 

She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry, and sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy, and green grams (mung beans) for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production, and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. 

Apart from an increase in egg output, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure, and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that could have been spent in buying fertilizer. Your loan will bring joy to this family because she will be able to support her family and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Godelia

texts.en:
Godelia is 62 years old and married with four children. Godelia works very hard to provide for them.

Godelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, etc.

Godelia has been in this business for 20 years now. 

In the future, Godelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Familia J. B. Group

texts.es:
“Desde pequeño, mi papá me enseñó a ganarme la vida trabajando como comerciante” René recordó que desde niño, su papá lo llevaba a vender a otras ciudades a vender accesorios para autos como cubre asientos. Ahora René tiene 25 años de edad, está casado con Adela y son padres de un bebé y de un niño de cuatro años que aun no va a la escuela. René y Adela necesitan un préstamo para comprar tela y continuar elaborando cubre asientos.

A René le encantaba viajar a otros lugares, además podía compartir más tiempo con su papá. Al crecer René, también comenzó a ayudar a su papá con las ventas pero  notaron que sus proveedores de cubre asientos tenían muy buenas ganancias y decidieron comenzar a elaborar este producto ellos mismos y hace cinco años finalmente se independizó. Al principio solo tenía una máquina de coser en su taller y actualmente ya cuenta con cinco, además tres familiares le ayudan en la producción de los cubre asientos. La familia se reúne todos los días desde las 9 am para comenzar a trabajar y su jornada termina hasta las 10 pm. René vende toda su mercancía en Guadalajara y Sinaloa (ciudades ubicadas aproximadamente a 4 horas de su comunidad). Su trabajo es tan reconocido que también hay clientes de otros lugares que simplemente le llevan la tela para que él confeccione sus cubre asientos. “Es cuando estamos más presionados porque a ellos también les urge su mercancía” comentó René. Uno de sus sueños es conseguir más clientes a quienes compren por pedidos grandes para expandir su negocio y dar empleo a más personas aparte de su familia. 

Con toda su experiencia, René ha identificado que durante la temporada de lluvia sus ventas son bajas, pero ahora que diciembre se acerca, necesita comprar más tela porque tiene fe en que sus ganancias aumenten y se pueda recuperar un poco. 

René, Adela y Carolina conforman el grupo, viven en una comunidad donde la mayoría de los habitantes son artesanos, se dedican a la elaboración de gorros, guantes, bufandas, calentadores como Carolina que quiere invertir en su actividad para aprovechar la época de invierno.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la comunidad donde viven los integrantes*
texts.en:
"Since I was a child, my father showed me how to make a living working as a salesman", says René, who remembers how his father took him with him to sell car accessories in other cities. René is now 25 years old, is married to Adela and has a baby and a 4-year old child who is not in school yet. René and Adela need a loan to buy fabric and keep making covers for car seats. 

René used to love visiting other places and also sharing more time with his father. As he was growing up, he also started to help him with the sales, but they realized their suppliers had good income from the seat covers and decided to make them themselves. They became independent 5 years ago. They only had a sewing machine in their studio at the beginning, but now have 5 as well as 3 family members who help with production. They all get together daily at 9am to start working and do not leave until 10pm. René sells the product in Guadalajara and Sinaloa (located approximately 4 hours away from his community). His job is so well known that he has clients from other places that simply bring the fabric for him to make the covers. "These are the most stressful cases as they need the product quickly", says René. One of his dreams is to have more clients that buy in bulk so that they can expand the business and employ more people outside of his family. 

Thanks to his experience, René has realized that his sales are lower during the rainy season, but now that December is approaching, he needs to buy more fabric. He expects that revenues will go up and that he will compensate. 

René, Adela and Carolina are the team members. They live in a community where most people are artisans and make hats, gloves, scarfs, leg-warmers, etc., like Carolina, who wants to invest in her business and make the most of the winter season. 

*The picture was taken in the community where the members live*

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Beverly is 44 years old and has three children who are in school.

Beverly has a fishing business in the Philippines. Beverly requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipment for her business.

Beverly has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Beverly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her business.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a new client who is 25 years old. He is married with two children, aged 3 and 1. One of the children attends school at the moment. He also does cattle trading to earn income. He earns supplementary income by growing pineapple. He has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX (One million shillings only) to buy. 

He started plumbing in the year 2004 to earn income to support himself and his family.  He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for his pineapple plantation. He is a hard working man who works 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. He does farming from Kyamamali, Nyanga, a rural area, and his customers are all categories of people, especially the neighboring communities.  

His future plan is to be financially stable and construct a good house. He is faced with the challenge of an unfavorable climate of poor weather but is determined to do well through his hard work. Gerald and his wife are pictured in their pineapple garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his pineapple plantation

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 22 years old and a single lady from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a small, humble house. Her brother works as an employee with a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Anwar studies physiotherapy in the university and is in her second year. she would like to complete her study and find a job in a healthcare center to help her family in part of their expenses.
Anwar requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her study. By taking this loan, Anwar will be able to do her home works and read articles online.
Anwar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study.

loans.name: Shadrack's Group

texts.en:
Shadrack is a 65-year old KOMAZA tree farmer. He has 16 children, all of whom have completed or are attending school. Shadrack is married, and his spouse is also a farmer. In addition to growing trees, Shadrack supports his family with agricultural endeavors. He decided to join KOMAZA to increase his household's income and improve the environment. 

He plans to spend the money earned from the KOMAZA tree farm to to pay school fees and build a good house with water storage facilities. Shadrack’s favorite part about working with KOMAZA is ensuring that he keeps his trees healthy and free from pests. In the picture, Shadrack is the farmer with his hand raised.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Placida

texts.en:
Placida is 61 years old and has two children. Placida is married and has one child in school.

Placida is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Placida requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Placida has been in this business for 35 years, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Placida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tatevik

texts.en: Tatevik is 29 years old and she lives with her retired grandmother in Vanadzor city of Lori region. She has a higher education and now she works at a private company as a senior accountant. Tatevik is a very clever and hardworking lady who is greatly respected and beloved among her colleagues. Tataevik has now one important problem which she is not able to solve because of the lack of money. Tatevik has a health difficultywhich causes great difficulties during the night while she is asleep and also great discomforts during the whole day. After having a medical examination, Tatevik is very worried, since the doctor said that this kind of state in which she is now may cause great harm to her health and could cause harm to her heart and lungs. Because of her problem, Tatevik has great oxygen starvation in her body. Tataevik will use her Kiva loan amount in order to pay for her surgery.

loans.use: to pay for her surgery

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is an 18-year old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small humble house. His father works as an employee and has a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Ahmad studies Health Management in his first year at the university. He would like to complete his studies and find a job in a health care center to help his family with part of their expenses.

Ahmad requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to do his homework and read articles online. Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Joy is 34 years old and has two children in school.

Mary Joy has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

Mary Joy has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mary Joy would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business

loans.name: Akmal

texts.en: Akmal is a kind man. He lives with his wife and parents in North Tajikistan. Akmal since childhood has helped her children with animal husbandry. Akmal has own business deal with animal husbandry now. He is the main feeder and keeper of family and that’s why works hard. Akamal’s brother studies at the military academy and he must to pay for his tuition. Akmal wants to help his brother and, with this aim, he is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD to pay for his brother’s tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a 35-year-old single woman. She works hard to sustain her daily needs.

Marieta has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marieta requested a loan of 5000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Marieta has been in this business for six years. In the future, Marieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw products and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some household goods for her house.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 36-year-old man living in the town of Mundri, in the Western Equatoria state region of South Sudan. He is married and has two children; one boy and one girl. He requested a loan of 4,500 SSP from WOYE MFI. For the past seven years, Samuel has been working hard to manage his goods, selling cups, baby powder, family care oil, etc.

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Xiaodong

texts.en:
Xiaodong is 37 years old and married, with one child who is in school. He also has to support his parents.

Xiaodong worked in a shoe factory for over ten years. Two years ago, the factory was closed down, and Xiaodong and his wife went back to their hometown. After investigating the market for a few months, he found that Express Delivery is a continuous business. With the support of his family, he started the business. He works very hard and has a high reputation with his clients.

Recently, Xiaodong found that delivering bigger packages can earn more than delivering the smaller ones. He wants to expand to those businesses, but he only has an electro-tricycle. It can only handle small packages and cannot deliver too far. So, he wants to buy a truck to take more and bigger goods. Also, he can drive to more places than before.

He requested ￥20,000 from MicroCred to buy a truck. The income from the truck will help him to improve the business and to make a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a truck.

loans.name: Hongguang

texts.en:
Hongguang is a single 26-year-old man. His parents gave him up when he was born. He grew up with his foster parents. His foster father died many years ago. Now he lives with his foster mother, who is over 70 years old and cannot take care of herself. Unfortunately, Hongguang lost his right eye in an accident when he was a child, and now he owns an artificial eye just for good looks.

His first job was as a chef in a restaurant. Two years ago, he gave up the job, for he could not look after his foster mother. He rented an unfixed stall in front of his community and began to sell daily necessities. He is very honest and hardworking. Many of his clients are from the community.

In September of this year, he rented a front shop out of his community to expand his business. He spent all his savings to decorate and fulfill the shop. His business is going very well; many goods were sold out quickly.

Hongguang requested ￥10,000 from MicroCred. He will use one part of the money to stock some popular goods in his shop and the other part to cure his foster mother, who was ill recently.

loans.use: to stock some popular goods in his shop and to cure his foster mother.

loans.name: Nai Ping

texts.en:
Naiping is a 36-year-old divorced man who is raising a child alone at present. Six years ago, he was forced to divorce his wife, for his wife wanted a better life. His mother passed away last year, and his father is in poor health and cannot look after the child for him. In order to take care of his daughter and let her go to school smoothly, one year ago he quit his job in other places and went back to his hometown.

He rented a single room and lives with his daughter in the city. He began to set up a pet shop. He makes a living washing pet dogs or giving an injection and giving medicine to the pet dogs. Sometimes he sells pet dogs to clients. His earning is enough to afford the living expenses of himself and his daughter.

With the growth of his child, the necessary costs become more and more. He wants to give his child a better life; thus he should earn more money. Naiping is honest and hardworking. He requested ￥20,000 from MicroCred. He will use the money to buy more puppies and nursing products for dog uses. In this way, he can expand his business and earn much money to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy more puppies and nursing products.

loans.name: Labebah

texts.en:
Labebah is a 18-year-old single lady from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a small, humble house. Her father works as a taxi driver, with a low and unstable income. This is the only source of income for the family. Labebah studies elementary education at the university and is in her second year. She would like to complete her studies and find a job as a teacher to help her family with part of their expenses.

Labebah requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Labebah will be able to do her homework and read articles online.

Labebah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is a married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She has four children.

Nimfa runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She also has a tricycle which is used to transport passengers nearby to her place.

Nimfa is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the tricycle like a wheel tire, nuts and bolts, hooks and chains, and additional groceries for the store like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries. This loan will be used to improve her stock thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the tricycle like a wheel tire, nuts and bolts, hooks and chains, and additional groceries for the store like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Joventino

texts.en:
This is Joventino, 58, a resident of Busuanga, Palawan, Philippines. He is married to Roberta, a retired teacher, and they have children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Joventino operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-PHPs-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house.

He also has a carinderia (small restaurant) business for additional income. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operation of his businesses, he is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory, and to purchase raw ingredients needed in his carinderia business.

Joventino dreams to grow his business and hopes to give his children a good life and education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, toiletries and beverages he needs to expand his variety store, and to buy raw ingredients for his carinderia business to boost income

loans.name: Sitera

texts.en:
Sitera has applied for 500,000 UGX. She needs money to improve her banana plantation.

She has one child and lives in a remote area of Karagwe Itojo. She used the last loan of 400,000 UGX partly to pay school fees for her child, and she also bought manure for the banana plantation. She will use this loan to buy mulch. She thanks the Kiva lenders for the financial boost.

loans.use: to buy mulch

loans.name: Nory

texts.en: Nory is a careful mother to her three children. She works hard to earn a living every day and has had her own business dealing with buying and selling dried fruits for more than 15 years. Nory buys apricots, processes them and sells them at a local market. She has a selling place in that market. She has regular customers, thanks to her good attitude and service to her customers. She is going to increase her working capital and maximize her profits. Nory is asking for a loan of 6000 Somoni to buy dried fruits. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is 47 years old and lives with his four children, spouse and two other dependent children. They live in their own home in rural western Uganda. He has good personal and work references.

His community works predominantly in agriculture, livestock and commerce. Asaph has worked for 15 years growing bananas. He needs a loan to pay for labor to maintain his banana plantation, and to buy mulch for the plantation as well. With this investment he will be able to increase his yield, and earn more income. Asaph has experience in this business, so he hopes to have a good harvest.

loans.use: To hire labour and buy mulch

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
Roselle is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is 30 years old and a widow. God has blessed her with a child who is in elementary school. Life indeed is hard but, by the grace of God, she was able to raise her child well and she is working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Roselle owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. She gets her product from a wholesaler at a lower price then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby and the people in the community. She earns 300 PHP a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting 18,000 PHP.  She will use the loan to buy toiletries like generic diapers, assorted infant milk, and other merchandise needed to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Roselle desires that her business will continue to grow and she is hoping to have more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, home product supplies and other merchandise she needs to grow her business to help her child continue his studies

loans.name: Philimon

texts.en:
Philimon, 33, is not looking for a job now but even if he was to be hired, he says he "can only accept the position of pig breeding consultant, not any other position.”

Philimon is a very honest, hardworking and dedicated farmer who hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya, known to have the best weather patterns that favor crops and animal farming. Philimon has so much experience in pig farming, having done it for the past 10 years, that he is considered one of the best farmers in his village. Philimon’s primary source of income is selling pig meat, milk, eggs and crops.

Philimon has space on his farm that is unused, and he wants to use it to keep pigs. He is kindly seeking a loan to buy pigs. This will help Philimon to improve his living conditions and also the conditions of his three children by providing them with a solid education, because education is the “key to success.” The Eldoret area has a large population and a ready market for pork. Hence, Philimon will not have a problem selling the pork and increasing his income level.

Philimon is much disciplined with finances and he is sure that, through accumulated profits, he will open a large pork selling butchery and be able to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Rexhep

texts.en: Rexhep is married and lives in a small village in the southern part of Kosovo. His son is 14 years old and very ill. In order to receive appropriate treatment, he is getting his care at a hospital in another European country. This is a very large expense for Rexhep and he works very hard to make sure that he can continue to pay for his son’s care and treatment. Based on family tradition, he is involved in agricultural work, planting onions and selling them in the area. He has many customers and is well known. Now, he is asking for a loan in order to purchase seeds, so he can plant more onions and expand his crops to generate more income and sales. His goal is to be able to see his son be healthy again and give him happiness and a better future. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant more onions and expand his crops to generate more income and sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Elsa Robertina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Unión Y Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Dolorosa en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Elsa, tiene 72 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis  hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo no trabaja por motivos de salud.
Doña Elsa es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante  y más después que su marido no puede trabajar, ella  se dedica a la venta de ropa, joyas de acero y productos de Avon  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos días ya que sale a recorrer la ciudad y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería nueva, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 20 años que se dedica al comercio con el cual salen adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, joyas, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Está  desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozando de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Unión y Fortaleza” (Unity and Strength) meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of La Dolorosa in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year. Manta is a city of unequaled beauty and it has many tourist attractions.

Sra. Elsa lives in this place. She is 72 years old, married, and has six grown children. One child still lives with her. Her husband does not work because of health reasons.

Doña Elsa is an extremely hardworking woman who enjoys getting ahead. After her husband was no longer able to work, she began selling clothes, steel-plated jewelry, and Avon products (beauty products, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Elsa works every day by traveling throughout the city. She also sells from her house since customers come by whenever she has new merchandise. Elsa offers her products on credit and collects payment every eight days. She has been in this trade for more than 20 years and has been able to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, jewelry, perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics. Elsa has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys the assistance that she has received from the loans that have been issued. Her dreams include moving forward and enjoying her health.

loans.use: to buy clothing, jewelry, perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Grupo De Guineales Sector Las Palmas Group

texts.es:
De 34 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene cuatro hijos los primeros dos hijos ya tienen familias apartes y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad. (Micaela es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda de la fotografía)	

El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de trajes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 5 años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de verduras negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de cinco años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Micaela para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.

El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería de trajes típicos para luego venderlas por los alrededores de su comunidad. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Micaela is 34 years old and already has grand aspirations to have her community and everyone who visits the community get to know the work she does with so much effort and dedication. She is married and lives with her husband. She has the desire to move forward in life and reach the greatest dreams that she wants to achieve in her life. She has four children and the first two already have families of their own while the younger two are excellent students in the school of the community. Micaela is the first one on the right in the photograph.

The work she does with so much care is the purchase and sale of traditional clothing. She does this work in her home and in locations near the community where she lives. She has been doing this for five years. Her other job is selling vegetables, a business she has been in with her sister for more than five years. It generates earnings for them for the wellbeing of their families and to improve the financial situations of their families and community.

She has been an example in her community and for this, a group of women have united with Micaela to be able to expand their businesses because each of the women can rise above and have important incomes.

She will use the loan for the purchase of traditional clothing merchandise to later sell in the areas around her community. One of her aspirations is to have a shop in the community market and see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Kenyera Group

texts.fr:
Venant fait partie du groupe  Kenyera et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 57 ans et est marié Eugénie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de15 à 22 ans dont 2 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce de bière depuis  37 ans. 

Elle est  à  son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses de  bière à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Venant is a member of the Kenyera Group and lives in Gitega.  He is 57 years old and married to Eugénie who works as a farmer.  Together they have three children aged between 15 and 22 years.  Two of their children are currently studying.

Venant has been selling beer for 37 years.  This will be his second loan with the field partner, Turame.  He intends to use his loan to increase his working capital and buy many crates of beer for resale.  In this way, Venant hopes to earn more.

loans.use: to buy many crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Matar
