Elizabeth es una mujer de 41 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 18 años y una hija de 15 años, y su negocio es la atención de una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, constante, activa, responsable, buena madre y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Huayrapata’ un área alejada de la ciudad, dónde no ingresa el transporte público porque no tiene camino, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura aproximada de 12 grados centígrados durante todo el año. 
Elizabeth es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español por el comercio (sentada al centro, manta rosada, sombrero marrón y pollera celeste). Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que trabaja como transportista y sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Sus deseos de mejorar su actividad laboral la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; carnicería,  venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería, venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de tomates, confección de tejidos y venta de pescado, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad, como; pan, azúcar, arroz, fideo, huevo, leche, refrescos, etc., que atiende en su hogar de lunes a domingo durante todo el día; ‘a mi barrio no entran autos por lo que tengo que transportar mi mercadería en carretilla desde el camino hasta mi tienda…’. Su sueño es tener un minimarket para tener mayor variedad de productos a la oferta y mejores ventas, y desea realizar la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor para surtir su negocio. Esta es la 12 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 21 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elizabeth solicita un préstamo para comprar alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 41 year old woman who lives with her spouse and has an 18 year old son and a 15 year old daughter. Her business is taking care of a neighborhood store selling basic needs food. She is independent, enterprising, consistent, active, responsible, hard-working and a good mother. Her business is located in the ‘Huayrapata’ neighborhood, an area which is away from the city. It has no public transportation as there are no roads. It has a cold, dry climate with a temperature of about 12 degrees Celsius year round.

Elizabeth is dark-skinned, short and has long black braided hair. She wears traditional clothing ( hat, poncho and skirt). Her native language is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for business. (She is seated in the center with a pink poncho a brown hat and a blue skirt). She lives her life with her husband who works as a driver and her children who study at school. She lives in her own house which has running water and electricity.

Her desire to improve her work has lead her to form a communal bank of people with businesses like: a meat store, sandwich sales, plaster handicrafts, soft drink sales, a bookstore, clothing sales, the sale of fruit, tomato sales, making fabric and selling fish to request a loan to make the businesses prosper.

Her business is a neighborhood store selling basic foods like: bread, sugar, rice, noodles, eggs, milk, soft drinks, etc. She takes care of it every day Monday to Sunday all year long from her house. “Vehicles don't enter my neighborhood so I have to transport my merchandise by cart from the road to my store”. Her dream is to have a mini-market to have a greater variety of products to offer and better sales. She wants to buy basic need food to stock her business. This is her 12th loan with the institution in the 21 years that she has had her store.

For these reasons Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy basic needs food to better stock her business.

loans.use: to buy basic needs foods to stock her business.

loans.name: Letelia

texts.en:
This is Letelia, 60, a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Renato, a pumpboat operator and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.



Letelia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.



She is requesting a Php 35,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.



Letelia hopes that her business will grow bigger and she wants to improve the general living condition of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.



All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay groceries, toiletries and beverages needed in expanding her store to increase her sales.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en: Haneen is a 19-year-old single woman; she lives in Almafraq with five family members. Two of her family members are employed; her dad is a farmer and her brother is a driver. Haneen is studying for her Bachelor degree in Pharmacy; she is in her second year. Haneen's future plan is to take her Bachelor degree and a higher degree and to work in her field. Haneen is applying for a loan to help her to cover her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for semester fees

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Filesi is 45 years old and married. She has five children. She owns a market stall, where she sells clothes and fritters in her village. She started her business ten years ago.

She is requesting this loan to bulk buy clothes and flour, in order to attract more customers and maximize her profit margins. With the knowledge she gained about business management, in the training provided by MLF-Malawi, she believes that she will be operating a sustainable business. Her goal is to use any profit generated to support the family. In future she wants to purchase a second-hand vehicle for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and flour.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en: Grace is a forty-nine year old Komaza tree farmer. She is married with seven children, all of whom are in school. In addition to growing trees, Grace supports her family with subsistence farming. She decided to join Komaza because microforestry is an income generating activity and the trees provide forest cover to improve the environment. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to to educate her children and improve her farming business. Grace’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the planting the trees and maintaining them as they grow. Grace is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 54 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very resourceful person. Even though Mary is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Mary started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Mary’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 9.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Christopher's Group

texts.en:
Christopher, pictured above, has 6 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Christopher is representing hisgroup of 8 farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Christopher has been a farmer for 19 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Christopher is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 3.25 acres will be planted by Christopher's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LUZ DEL SUR, él socio continua dedicándose a trabajar como plomero y  en construcciones socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma  seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales como yeso entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Benigno is a member of the communal bank 'Luz del Sur'. He is still making a living working as a plumber and in construction. He has been doing these jobs for a a long time and he's doing well due to all the hard work he puts in every day at work. He hopes to be able to keep working so he can keep supporting his family. 

Benigno is requesting a loan to buy materials like plaster and other things. He is thankful for being granted the loan and he is committed to making his loan repayment instalments.

loans.use: to buy materials like plaster and other things.

loans.name: Christopher's Group

texts.en:
Christopher, pictured above, has 10 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Christopher is representing his group of eight farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Christopher has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to earn enough to feed his family, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Christopher is planning to buy a cow.

A total of 4.25 acres will be planted by Christopher's Group, and among them they will receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna is 54 years old, living in a community in Orvakal village of Kurnool District in Andhra Pradesh. He is married. He completed his education till tenth grade. 

Krishna does agriculture. He cultivates Bengal gram and maize. His family also helps him in his activities. They have always faced a lot of challenges to increase their yield. From the last yield of maize he got so little profit that he is thinking to cultivate another crop. 

He is requesting a loan that will allow him to improve the quantity and quality of his cultivation. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers and for other expenses of agriculture. 

Krishna’s happy and enthusiastic personality is something that really characterizes this entrepreneur, and it is reflected in the work. His dream is that his farm would be considered a model with a good, high-quality yield for which he works day in and day out as he is sure that this line of work has great economic potential.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Shekar

texts.en:
Shekar is a 26-year-old man who lives in the village of Orvakal in the Kurnool District in Andhra Pradesh. He is newly married. He completed his studies till tenth grade but could not study further due to their economic conditions.
 
Being an optimistic man, he is doing agriculture. He cultivates Bengal gram and jowar in his two acres of land. His income is inconsistent and insufficient to cover all his household expenses. So Shekar has decided to expand his agriculture in order to earn a larger profit. Shekar needs the loan to improve his agriculture and to buy a bullock cart.
 
He hopes, with the profit from his agriculture, that he can generate more income to provide financial security for his family and a better education for his sister and also save for her sister's marriage.

loans.use: to buy a bullock cart.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Improving her housing conditions and providing a good education to her two children, age 1 and 5 years old, are the goals that motivate Ruth to get up and work hard. 

With her business of keeping poultry and dairy cows, Ruth has managed to be useful and to help her husband with household expenses.

Looking to be more competitive and more assertive against the competition, to have a long-lasting business, to improve sales, and to have a better life on her farm, Ruth wants to apply for a loan to buy more poultry and to have a very high level of egg production, in order to become a distributor to be reckoned with. 

With the loan, she will be able to increase her income and move from subsistence to more commercial farming. With this loan, she will be able to improve her living conditions and enhance her food security and that of her community.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Claudia Fidencia

texts.es:
Claudia, vende ropa y tortillas, con este negocio puede cubrir los gastos de su hogar, el oficio lo aprendió con ayuda de su suegra, tiene un horario de seis de la mañana  a cuatro de la tarde, durante el día se organiza para realizar ambas actividades, su forma de trabajo es ambulante; es acompañada y vive con su hijo, quien es el único dependiente.
Esté financiamiento será de utilidad para comprar faldas, camisetas, blusas, etc., ofertará nuevas prendas de vestir con las que tendrá clientes satisfechos y mejores ingresos, espera continuar mejorando el negocio para tener un mejor bienestar familiar. 
Claudia aspira a contar con recursos económicos con los que pueda reparar su vivienda y así dar a su familia un techo seguro.
texts.en:
Claudia sells clothes and tortillas. With this business she manages to cover her household expenses. She learned the work with help from her mother-in-law. She works from 6:00 in the morning to 4:00 in the afternoon, organizing her day so she can do both jobs. Her businesses are ambulatory. 

She has a partner and lives with her son, who is her only dependent. 

This loan will be used to buy skirts, shirts and blouses, etc., allowing her to offer new clothing to satisfy her clients and generate better income. She hopes to continue improving her business to ensure a better life for her family. 

Claudia hopes to earn the money she needs to fix her house and in this way offer her family a safe home.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts and blouses, etc., allowing her to offer new clothing to satisfy her clients.

loans.name: Sheilla

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Sheilla. She lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, renowned for producing elite runners who have broken major world records. Sheilla is a mother of two and she has been in the agriculture business for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and maize. 

Sheilla has been relying on agriculture to make all her income. However, rising costs of farming inputs, such as fertilizers, and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting into farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Sheilla remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. 

Sheilla is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Sheilla will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. An increase in income for her is timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields. This loan will support Sheilla’s economic activity and will change her family’s living standards indirectly.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Ayub's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Ayub, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 42 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.  He is married and has four children.

Ayub is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to earn enough to feed his family, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Ayub says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2012, he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Ayub will use the profits from this season to save more money for the future.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of seven acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing  solar lights, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Newton's Group

texts.en:
Newton is 25 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has two children and is married. As a group leader, Newton is representing his group of 16 farmers in Teso District in Kenya, and he is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Newton's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

Newton and his group will receive a total of 11 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Elfet

texts.en: Elfet is 52 years old, widowed, and the mother of 2 sons. Both of her sons are disabled and handicapped. She is receiving social help. Her life has been difficult, raising two disabled children alone. She has never complained and always worked hard to earn a living to improve their lives. For the last 14 years, she has been running her own handicraft business from her home. This allowed her to supplement the social help money, which is low, and still be home to care for her sons. For the first time, she is now asking for a loan in order to purchase more materials for her work. This loan will help her to be able to continue her work and generate more income. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for her handicraft business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is married and lives with his wife in his own home. They live in a small community that is predominantly an agricultural area where he enjoys favorable personal and work references from his neighbors.

Alex has made his living for the last fifteen years raising and selling animals, such as ducks and turkeys, from his home. Alex is requesting the loan to purchase animal feed to fatten his animals. This way he will be able to grow his business, which will allow him to improve his income in a short period of time, increase his profit and therefore improve his own quality of life and his family's as well.

loans.use: to buy animal seeds.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine works as a custodian at an elementary school and her husband is unemployed. At the school she works at and its surroundings, she has been selling clothing goods. The sales have been going well and have made her life easier.  With the Maya credit she would like to buy more variety for her stocks so that she can make more income.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Emine hanım,ilköğretim okulunda hizmetli olarak çalışıyor.  Eşi çalışmıyor.  Evin bakımını kendisi yapıyor.  Çalıştığı okulda ve çevresinde çamaşır satışı yapıyor.  işler iyi gidiyor.  Para kazanıyor.  Daha rahat yaşıyor.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile şimdi çamaşır çeşidini arttıracak ve daha çok kazanacak.

loans.use: to buy more variety for her clothing stock.

loans.name: Shivayya

texts.en:
Shivayya is 42 years old. He completed his education till tenth grade and couldn't continue his studies because of his family responsibilities. 

He earns money by doing agriculture at Andhra Pradesh. He cultivates Bengal gram, maize and red gram in his lease land. He has two children who are studying MBA and BSC respectively. 

Shivayya is associated with the “Sahaja Samrudha” NGO and is actively involved in the NGO activities. Shivayya needs a loan of INR 50,000 to strengthen his farm by buying quality seeds, fertilizers, etc. to increase his yield. He has enough experience in agriculture. 

He hopes that the enhanced income will let him improve his standard of living. His main desire is to give higher education to his children and to settle their lives.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for poultry.

loans.name: Burastan

texts.en:
Burastan lives in the village Davit-Bek of Syunik region. Burastan now lives with her husband. Their son is married and he lives separately with his family in Kapan city, and with them also lives the smallest daughter of Burastan. 

Burastan’s husband on his own truck makes cargo transfers in his region, while Burastan is seriously engaged in agricultural activities. On her plot of land she cultivates potatoes, beans, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions and garlic. She also has 40 chickens and she manages to sell a lot of eggs from her farm. All her farm products Burastan sells at the city’s wholesale market.

This loan amount Burastan needs in order to buy a lot of fodder for her farm chickens, and she also wants to help her husband, so some part of the loan amount she will give him for the repairing of his truck, since he has some little problems with it.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for her farm chickens and for repairing her husband's truck.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a dark-skinned, smiling, extroverted, happy, responsible, and energetic woman. She is a mother of 10 with a deeply engraved passion in dairy farming. After all, that is what she has been doing for over 20 years. She owns a small farm in Kamagut village, which is situated in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. 

The income she makes from farming is not sufficient to comfortably sustain her large family. As a result, Leah has ventured into a couple of small side businesses to make extra shillings. With the aid of her 45-year-old handsome husband, Leah also rears poultry and grows maize, amongst other crops. 

Leah is seeking a loan of KES 120,000 for constructing a cowshed. She plans to put up a well-designed barn that will provide a clean, comfortable home for her herd and a pleasant, efficient workplace for her. In a bid to increase milk production, the cowshed will provide a favorable environment for the cows. 

With your loan, Leah has carefully planned for the storage and handling of milk, feed, bedding and manure, as these account for most of the labor in any dairy farm. The housing will have a plentiful, dependable supply of good water, made available 24 hours a day. The income she will make from this investment will put her in a position to comfortably afford increasing farming costs. Her family also stands to benefit from the growth of their agribusiness.
Support this heroine who wants to always put a smile on her large family's faces.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit (cowshed).

loans.name: Rael

texts.en: Rael, at 46 years old, is seeing her dream fulfilled, which is to be an independent person and have her own business. Thanks to the introduction of Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders in her life, she can achieve this dream and continue upward. Rael is a very ambitious and enterprising go-getter who hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of six and has been doing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Her primary sources of income are from selling eggs, milk and crops and from some personal business she does to make ends meet. Rael loves farming and has even nicknamed her cow. She really takes good care of her dairy cows. The Eldoret area has favorable conditions for horticultural farming, which is good soil, climate and a transport system as well as an existing market for horticulture products. Rael wants to take advantage of these conditions and start horticultural farming. She is seeking a loan to start this new enterprise. Through an increased income, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. The financial benefits that Rael will reap will be almost immediate; hence she will be assured a secure future. She plans to start exporting her horticulture products to international markets once she has accumulated more profits.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Robert's Group

texts.en:
Robert is 33 years old and is often described as a very reliable person. He has three children and is married. As a group leader, Robert is representing his group of 11 farmers in Teso District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Robert's desire to earn enough to send his children to school. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

Robert and his group will receive a total of 9 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total 4 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Mona Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Mona Al-Hodeidah. It consists of four women living in Hodeidah city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Basema is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old married woman, living with her family in their own house in Hodeidah city, Yemen. The husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. His income is very a small and not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family. 

Basema decided to help him through selling incense and perfumes door to door. She has done that humble business for more than four years. The income from this business is very low. Basema wants to enlarge it but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more incense and perfumes to resell to her customers.

Basema hopes to open a small shop for selling all perfumes and incense.

loans.use: to purchase more incense and perfumes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine is the group leader of her group in Matete District, and she is representing 10 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of 4 children. Christine joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for more than 20 years.

Like many other farmers, Christine decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

Christine's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 4.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights, as, even though Christine decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: George's Group

texts.en:
George, pictured above, has 7 children and is always described as a very trustworthy person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. George is representing his group of 16 farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

George has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, George is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 7.75 acres will be planted by George's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Hezron's Group

texts.en:
Hezron is 42 years old and has 7 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Hezron has been farming with One Acre Fund for several years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Hezron also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Hezron's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Timvane Group

texts.en:
Annie, who is wearing the blue suit in the photo, is 27 years old with three children. She sells groundnuts and popcorn by the side of the road. She started this business in order to easily provide her family with basic needs and to be able to pay medical bills for her children. 

She requested for this loan from Kiva lenders in order to bulk buy popcorn and groundnuts to attract more customers. Her goal is to diversify her business by opening a grocery shop selling assorted items. She also dreams of providing better education to her children. Having access to loans has allowed Annie to easily able to pay school fees for her children and feed her family.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts, rice, and maize for resale.

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 45-year-old proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Rosemary has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Rosemary described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Rosemary’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David, pictured above, has 6 children and is always described as a very reliable person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. David is representing his group of 12 farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

David has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, David is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 4.25 acres will be planted by David's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Jesca's Group

texts.en:
Jesca, pictured above, has 5 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Jesca is representing her group of 9 farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Jesca has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. She will purchase farming inputs and a solar light with her loan. She is very happy to be getting a solar light as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Jesca is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 4.75 acres will be planted by Jesca's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize as well as to purchase a solar light.

loans.name: Flora Virginia

texts.es:
La socia  Es la señora Flora Virginia, ella pertenece al banco “LUZ DEL SUR” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
La socia continua dedicándose a la docencia universitaria, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, siendo de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia está solicitando el préstamo para comprar víveres para su hogar.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This group member is Flora Virginia, and she is a client at the ‘Southern Lights’ bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. 

She continues her work teaching at the university. She is a responsible and hard-working person, who has been doing the same work for a long time. Her job is going well thanks to the dedication she shows every working day, and in this way she can continue to support her family. 

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her home. 

Flora Virginia is very thankful for KIVA and commits to paying back her established instalments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her home.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Mmbale, a town near Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Josephine is married and has six children. She runs a small kiosk. She is a farmer as well. She has been farming for 13 years now, and she is currently growing maize, vegetables and tea, and she also keeps cattle. Josephine is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide her with honey for medicine.

This is Josephine's first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her kiosk. Josephine's hope for the future is to build a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth lives in Mmbale, a town near Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Japheth is married and has three children. He runs a business of weaving baskets and mats. He is a farmer as well. He has been farming for 13 years now and is currently growing maize, bananas, tea and trees. Japheth is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Japheth's first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to build a good house for his family. Japheth's hope for the future is to become self-sufficient in farming.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Fred's Group

texts.en:
Fred, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. He is 29 years old, a married father of five children, and often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Fred has been a farmer for 10 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Even though he is new to the program, Fred wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Fred hopes to be able to invest in a business.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 9 solar lights, as, even though Fred decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Phanice's Group

texts.en:
Phanice is 50 years old and has 10 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Phanice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Phanice also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore, save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Phanice's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Kamalamma

texts.en:
Kamalamma lives in Orvakal village of Kurnool District in Andhra Pradesh. She is 58 years old, married, and has two children. This family's living depends mainly on agriculture done by Kamalamma because her husband is an alcoholic. She cultivates jowar (sorghum) and cotton in her cultivable land. 

Kamalamma is a member of “Sahaja Samrudha” (an organic farmers' union). Her family’s income is not adequate to meet their daily needs. Hence, she is requesting a loan of INR 50,000. She is planning to improve her agriculture, so that she can earn more profit. The money will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and for other expenses of cultivation. She expects that the income will help her expand her current business and pay for the family's food and health care. 

Kamalamma hopes to save enough for her future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Karisa's Group

texts.en:
Karisa is a 21-year-old Komaza tree farmer. In addition to growing trees, Karisa is also a mason and farmer. He decided to join Komaza to earn money from the sale of his trees and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to open a business such as a retail shop. 

Karisa’s favorite part about the microforestry program is the training Komaza provides to tree farmers. Karisa is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in Malava, a small town in Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Nancy is a single business lady and a farmer. She has been farming for three years now and she is currently growing maize, bananas and sugarcane. Nancy is excited about beekeeping as it is an easy project to manage and it will provide her with honey for medicine.

This is Nancy's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her business. Nancy's hope for the future is to one day have her own family.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Mmbale, a town near Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage.

Alice is married and has five children. She runs a small business while her husband runs a motorbike transport business. They also practice farming. They have been farming for fifteen years now and they are currently growing vegetables and bananas and they also keep poultry. Alice is excited about beekeeping as it will generate her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Alice's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Alice's hope for the future is to see her children finish school and become independent.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Taphroza

texts.en:
Traphoza lives in Mmbale, a town near Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Traphoza is married and has seven children. She runs a small business and she is a farmer as well. She has been farming for fifteen years now and she is currently growing maize and vegetables and she also keeps cattle. Traphoza is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Traphoza's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to provide for her family's needs and to pay school fees for her children. Traphoza's hope for the future is to become successful in her business so that she can live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Hazina's Group

texts.en:
Hazina is a 38-year-old Komaza tree farmer. She has seven children, all of whom are in school. Hazina is married, and her spouse is a driver. In addition to growing trees, Hazina supports her family by selling second-hand clothes. 

She decided to join Komaza to develop herself and her business. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to educate her children and expand her clothes-selling business. Hazina’s favorite part about working with Komaza is "watching her trees grow big and healthy so they can be harvested for good profits to improve her family's living standard." 

Hazina is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es:
Las Reynas es un grupo ubicado cerca de las vías del tren donde la llamada "Bestia" que recorre todo el país de sur a norte hace su aparición 4 veces al día. Anteriormente era un ferrocarril agrícola el que atravesaba estas vías, pero de este ya solo queda un viejo andén desde donde se pueden apreciar el ingenio (fabrica de azúcar), la iglesia, el río y las viviendas.

El nombre de este grupo de préstamo tiene su origen en la vida y pensamiento de las integrantes quienes respondieron “Las Reynas de la casa somos nosotras” ellas son:

Ofelia -Venta De Abarrotes y Carnitas
Liliana -Venta De Ropa
Soledad -Venta De Bordados 
Hortencia -Venta De Abarrotes
Gabriela -Venta De Tacos
María Tita -Venta De Ropa Americana
María -Venta De Comida
Belem -Venta De Comida
Claudia –Venta De Abarrotes

Doña Ofelia es una gran mujer, es viuda desde hace 10 años y madre de dos hijos mayores de edad. Cuarenta años atrás comenzó a vender carne de puerco y chicharrón fuera de su casa donde colocaba una gran mesa, una báscula y una lona para cubrirse del sol. A las 7 de la mañana comenzaba su actividad ofreciendo siempre un buen trato al cliente lo que la llevó a incrementar sus ganancias. Invirtiendo sus ahorros, hace 25 años logró comprar un un pequeño local frente al parque donde estableció una tienda de abarrotes y posteriormente reinició la venta de carne para dedicarse a ambas actividades. Para mejorar el negocio, doña Ofelia necesita una cortina metálica y así tener mayor protección.

"Siempre me gustó el comercio y gracias a las ganancias, mis hijos pudieron estudiar". Actualmente uno de ellos le ayuda a atender el negocio. Ofelia reconoce el apoyo y confianza de VisionFund al otrogar una oportunidad con la que antes no contaba, pues recuerda que hace años era muy difícil acceder a préstamos y hacer una buena inversión en el negocio.

*La fotografía tomada en las vías del ferrocarril que pasa detrás de la casa de Doña Ofelia quien usa un vestido blanco con franjas negras.
texts.en:
'Las Reynas' (The Queens) is a group located near the train tracks where the "Bestia" (the Beast) train, which travels across the whole country from the south to the north, appears 4 times a day. Previously it was an agricultural railway which ran on these tracks, but now all that remains of that railway is an old platform from which you the sugar mill, the church, the river and some houses can be seen. 

The loan group's name was inspired by the lives and beliefs of its members who say "We are the queens of our houses".

Ofelia - Grocery and meat sales
Liliana - Clothes sales
Soledad - Embroidery sales
Hortencia - Grocery sales
Gabriela - Taco sales
María Tita - American clothes sales 
María - Food sales
Belem - Food sales 
Claudia - Grocery sales 

Ofelia is a wonderful woman. She has been a widow for 10 years and is mother to 2 grown-up sons. Forty years ago she started selling pig meat and pork crackling on a big table which she set up outside her house along with same weighing scales and a sheet of tarpaulin to protect her from the sun. At 7 in the morning she would start work, offering her customers a good service which helped her to increase her earnings. 25 years ago she invested her savings by buying a small shop premises in front of a park where she set up a grocery shop and then later on she started selling meat again to keep both businesses going. To improve her business, Ofelia needs a rolling steel shutter to better protect her shop. 

"I have always liked the shop trade and thanks to my earnings my sons were able to study". Now, one of her sons helps her run her business. Ofelia recognises the support and trust of VisionFund for having given her an opportunity which she previously didn't have. She remembers that it used to be very difficult to access loans and make a good investment in her business. 

*The photograph was taken on the train tracks which are behind Ofelia's house. Ofelia is dressed in a white dress with blacks stripes.

loans.use: to buy a rolling steel shutter.

loans.name: Jose Cruz

texts.es:
José, ha mejorado mucho su negocio con la ayuda de préstamo, sus cosechas de granos básicos son abundantes, los ingresos han tenido un cambio positivo, con las ganancias a comprado bueyes para trabajar en el trapiche y procesar la caña de azúcar para producir dulce de atado.
Él se ha decidió por un nuevo préstamo para comprar un trapiche (es un molino utilizado para extraer el jugo la caña de azúcar) e insumos agrícolas, mejorara el equipo de trabajo y dará un buen trato a sus cultivos, espera que la inversión le dé buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Jose has greatly improved his business with the help of the loans. His harvests of basic grains are abundant, the income has reflected a positive change, and with the profits he bought oxen to drive a mill that processes sugarcane to produce dulce de atado.

He has decided to request a new loan to buy a trapiche (mill that extracts the sap from the sugarcane) as well as agricultural inputs. He will improve his work equipment and take good care of the crops, hoping that the investment will pay off.

loans.use: to buy a trapiche (a mill that extracts the sap from the sugar cane).

loans.name: Naliaka's Group

texts.en:
Naliaka is a 46-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Naliaka has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Naliaka described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Naliaka’s Group will be able to plant a total of five acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in Mmbale, a town near Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well-suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Stella is married and has eight children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years, and currently they are growing maize, tea, coffee, and trees. Stella is excited about beekeeping, because it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Stella's first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to provide for her needs in her old age. Stella's hope for the future is to live a peaceful life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials, for honey production.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy lives in Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, makes Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Kennedy is single. He is a driver, and he also works in farming. He has been farming for two years, and currently he is growing maize, bananas, and sugarcane. Kennedy is excited about beekeeping, because it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is Kennedy's first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to start another business. Kennedy's hope for the future is to buy land and construct rental houses.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Benard's Group

texts.en:
Benard is 55 years old and has 8 children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Benard is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Benard started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

Benard’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Masha's Group

texts.en:
Masha is a 40-year-old Komaza tree farmer. He has two children, both of whom are in school. Masha is married and his spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Masha supports his family with subsistence farming. He decided to join Komaza because the trees improve the environment by bringing rain, and he expects to earn an income to support his family. 

He plans to spend the money he earns from his Komaza tree farm to to educate his children, purchase land, and open a business. 

Masha’s favorite part about working with Komaza is that the trees improve the environment, and they will provide farmers with a good income. Masha is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is 57 years old, married, and has one child. She is a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. She has been working in manufacturing and selling perfumes since 2008 to cover the needs and expenses of her child. She is the sole earner of the family.

Najah requested a loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to purchase special perfumes, essences, and bottles that will help to develop her business and increase her sales. She hopes to expand her business to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase special perfumes,essences, and bottles

loans.name: Cosmus

texts.en:
Cosmus lives in Kapsabet, a town near Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping, due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of food sources.

Cosmus is married and has three children. He is a farmer. He has been farming for forty years, and currently he is growing tea and vegetables, and he keeps dairy cattle and poultry. Cosmus is excited about beekeeping, because it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is Cosmus's first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Cosmus's hope for the future is to build a good house for his family.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a 26-year-old, single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a small, humble house. He works as a lawyer, in his own office. Sultan is new in this field, and he needs to train and gain experience.

Sultan requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his work. By taking this loan, Sultan will be able to organize the clients' files and communicate with others by email.

Sultan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his work.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en: Josephine is a forty-four-year-old tree farmer and Komaza client. She is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school. In addition to growing trees, Josephine supports her family with subsistence farming. She decided to join Komaza to earn money from the sale of her trees. She plans to spend the money she earns from the Komaza tree farm, to educate her children and start another business. Josephine’s favorite part about the microforestry program is being a Komaza farmer and part of a program that will bring income to her family. Josephine is the farmer with her hand raised, in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Dúo Oasis De Bendicion Group

texts.es:
DUO OASIS DE BENDCION
Doña Irma Yolanda es originaria de la Aldea Xetzac del municipio de tecpan, ella tiene 22 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad está su hijo que necesita mucho cuidado, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de pollos.
Ella a empezado con un pequeño negocio y gracias a Dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante ya que es el medio que tiene para sostener a su familia, gracias también al apoyo de su esposo ya que entre los dos se están ayudando para salir adelante.
El crédito que ella recibió lo utilizo para invertirlo en compra de materia prima para sus tejidos y en la compra de pollos para crianza.
El sueño de ella es ampliar un poco mas su negocio asi obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a su hijo a la escuela para un futuro mejor, y poder también mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Irma Yolanda is a native of Aldea Xetzac in the municipality of Tecpan. She is 22 years old and has a son who needs considerable care. Irma Yolanda makes typical indigenous clothing by hand, and she also raises chickens.

Irma Yolanda began with a small business and, thanks to God, little by little she has been able to advance to the point where this is now her means of sustaining her family, together with the help her husband provides. Through the efforts of the two, they have been able to get ahead.

The loan Irma Yolanda hopes to receive will be used to purchase primary materials for her sewing and for added chickens to raise.

Irma Yolanda's dream is to expand her business a little more and, thus, obtain better earnings, so that she can send her son to school and prepare him for a better future. Also, she hopes to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: buy primary materials for making typical clothing to sell and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine for her treatment.

loans.name: Urbanizacion Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal URBANIZACION NUEVO AMANECER, el banco está ubicado en el  distrito de Echarate, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosmeri ella es soltera y tiene 31 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos, cafe, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member, Rosmeri, belongs to the Ubanización Neuvo Amanecer communal bank, which is located in the district Echarate, La Convención province, in the department of Cusco.  

Rosmeri is 31, single, and has two children.  She has fruit growing business.  She has a plot of land where she grows bananas, coffee, mandarins, and oranges.  She works from 6AM until 5PM.  She's been in this business for several years and it's going well.  Her dream is to expand her plot.  She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

The other members have grocery stores, or businesses selling animals, clothing, or food.  

Rosmeri appreciates the people who are part of her dream and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary, pictured above, has been a farmer for 15 years and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Matete District. She is 37 years old, is married, and has six children.

Mary likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Mary plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Mary’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Dianah's Group

texts.en:
Dianah is 68 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by eight farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Dianah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Dianah also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Obtaining this loan means that Dianah's Group will be able to receive a total of 5 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem is a 23-year-old, single man. He lives in Almafraq. Saleem is studying for his Bachelor's degree in Computer Information Systems in his third year. His family of six members depend on his father’s retirement salary only, but having a big family makes it harder to afford paying the university fees sometimes.

For that reason, Saleem decided to request a loan that will help him pay his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is married and lives in AlSalt. Her husband works as a bus driver.  

She has a business planting flowers and plants in her front garden. She is the only one who runs and works in the planting.   One of the difficulties is the small space that she has, but she decided to postpone an expansion until she can make more profit to build a bigger plantation elsewhere. 

Amira is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and special seedlings that can grow in cold weather.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and special seedlings that can grow in cold weather.

loans.name: Mercy's Group

texts.en:
Mercy is 23 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has two children and is married. As a group leader, Mercy is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Mercy's desire to make more farmer friends in her community. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan. This is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she earns from this year’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

Mercy and her group will receive a total of 12 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Chrispinus Group

texts.en:
Chrispinus is the group leader of his group in Teso District, representing 16 farmers, including himself. He is married and the proud father of three children. Chrispinus joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for more than 20 years.

Like many other farmers, Chrispinus decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to buy a goat.

Chrispinus's group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 8.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 4 solar lights,      Even though Chrispinus decided not to, some farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost -fficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Ziporah's Group

texts.en:
Ziporah is 40 years old and has eight children. She has been a farmer for 14 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Ziporah is the only one in the above picture, she is actually representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Ziporah started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010.  She decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Ziporah’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. Additionally, some farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so that, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Agnes's Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 36 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has three children and is married. As a group leader, Agnes is representing her group of seven farmers in Teso District, in Kenya. She is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Agnes's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. In addition to receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan. She is very excited about the solar light, because now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and thereby save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

Agnes and her group will receive a total of six solar lights, and input loans of maize seed and fertilizer to plant a total of 2.5 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seed and fertilizer for the coming planting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David is 24 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. As a group leader, David is here representing his group of five farmers in Teso District, in Kenya. He is excited to be joining One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of David's desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. In addition to receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan. He is very excited about this, because now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and thereby save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

David and his group will receive a total of three solar lights, as well as input loans of maize seed and fertilizer to plant a total of 2.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and sand to renovate her house

loans.name: Cellina's Group

texts.en:
Celina, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group, formed by 11 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. She is 40 years old and the married mother of five children.  She is often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Celina has been a farmer for 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund.  She decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Celina wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. 

With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Celina hopes to be able to buy a cow.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.  Even though Celina decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Edigar's Group

texts.en:
Edigar, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 12 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Edigar will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Edigar plans to use the profits she earns this year to save more money for the future.

In total Edigar’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is 43 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is here representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Rosemary has been farming with One Acre Fund for years, now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family. Although she says her last harvest was very good, still she believes she could have a better one this year, by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rosemary also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan this year. She is very excited about this, because it will give her light during dark hours, for her children to study by.

Obtaining this loan means that Rosemary's Group will receive a total of 13 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Khawlah

texts.en:
Khawlah is a 19-year-old, single lady, who comes from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a small, humble house. Her mother works as an employee in the public sector, where she gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Khawlah studies Finance at the university; she is in her second year. She would like to complete her studies and find a job, to help her family in part of their expenses.

Khawlah requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Khawlah will be able to do her homework and read articles online.

Khawlah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies in Finance.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en:
This lady, by name Parvina, will use her loan to develop her business so she can meet her clients' needs and generate more income for her family. 

Parvina devotes herself to sales. She has a small restaurant as well as a larder, which she was able to obtain with great effort. She says that at the beginning it was quite hard, but that little by little, her business was able to take off and that her business is now growing. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase vegetables, fruit, goods in bulk, milk and other products. She is grateful for the opportunity she will be granted, as the loan will allow her to improve sales and to continue helping her family as she has been doing.

loans.use: To buy food items to increase her working capital

loans.name: Agnes's Group

texts.en:
Agnes, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by eight farmers in Teso District, Kenya. She is 44 years old and a married mother of six children, often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Agnes has been a farmer for more than 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Agnes wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Agnes hopes to be able to buy a cow.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of three solar lights, as, even though Agnes decided not to buy one, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Dúo Nueva Jerusalen De Tecpan Group

texts.es:
DUO NUEVA JERUSALEN DE TECPAN
Doña Gladys Elizabeth es originaria del municipio de tecpan, ella tiene 25 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus dos hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos a mano y a la crianza de pollos.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en materia prima para sus tejidos y en la compra de pollos para su pequeña granaja, gracias al apoyo de su esposo ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante, gracias a Dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante con su negocio.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio ofrecer otros estilos de güipiles a sus clientes ya que asi ella obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Gladys Elizabeth is a native of Tecpan municipality. She is 25 years old and is responsible for her two minor children. She dedicates herself to sewing traditional clothing by hand and to raising chickens.

The loan Gladys Elizabeth hopes to receive is for purchasing primary materials for her sewing and to purchase chickens to add to her small coop. Thanks to her husband's help, she continues to expand her business, since it is her main means to get ahead. Thanks to God, little by little, her business is advancing.

Gladys Elizabeth's dream is to grow the business even more and to offer her customers other styles of native blouses, thereby obtaining better earnings so she can send her children to school and assure them of a better future.

loans.use: buy primary materials for making typical clothing to sell and for buying more chickens to raise.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
Inobat comes from a rural area. She was born in 1961. Inobat is married and has a child who is a motor of her life. Inobat and her husband work hard to earn a living and offer a high living standard for their child.
