Twenty years ago, Inobat began a business deal, buying and selling national skullcaps. She has a store where she sells her goods. Inobat has regular customers, thanks to her good service. Little by little, from the profit of her business, Inobat repairs her house and, in this way, improves her living conditions. 

She is a repeat client of CSC MDO "IMON International" and she has a good credit history. Inobat is asking for a loan of TJS 5,000 (somoni) to buy skullcaps to increase working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy skullcaps to sell.

loans.name: Mehr

texts.en:
Mehr is a 52-year-old, married woman. With her husband, she has been running a business selling milk for many years. She also sells butter and cheese, to generate an extra amount of profit. Mehr has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.

For the improvement of her business she has obtained a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR. She will use it to purchase one more cow. She hopes that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 49 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is here representing her group, formed by eight farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Jane has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she says her last harvest was good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Jane also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan this year. She is very excited about this, because it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and thereby save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Jane's Group will receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is 25 years old  and married, with two children. He  works very hard to provide for his family. 

Justin has run a general business in the South Sudan for the past year.  He has requested a loan of SSP 800 through WOYE MFI to add goods to sell,  such as fuel.

loans.use: to buy more fuel to sell to his customers

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been a rickshaw driver for many years. He purchased a rickshaw with the support of Kashf Foundation 4 years ago. Now, it requires repair and maintenance due to an engine problem. Therefore, Shamim has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her husband who will use this loan to buy a new engine for the rickshaw. It will help him provide better service to his customers and generate more income. Shamim dreams of providing good quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for a rickshaw.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is 34 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. He is a fisherman, which he has been doing since 1995. He is the family's only source of living, since his wife does not work.

To increase his income, Khodor established his own cafe a month ago, which he is running during the day from 10 AM until 2 PM and from 6 PM until midnight. He operates his fishing business from midnight until the morning.


Khodor requested a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to develop his newly established cafe with the required ceiling for the autumn and winter seasons to keep it a healthy place for his customers. He is a hard working man, who seeks a better living for his family since fishermen are suffering from low income. He hopes that in the future, he can expand and develop his small cafe and attract more customers.

loans.use: to develop his newly established cafe with a required ceiling

loans.name: Wendlassida Moince Group

texts.fr:
Mme FOURATA est responsable du WENDLASIDA. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. Les 03 vont à l’école et elle a 04personnes en charge. Sur la photo, elle tient un cartable jaune.
Mme fait le maraichage depuis 2009. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac d’engrais, 02boites de semence d’oignon et 02bidons d’insecticide.
Mme  veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne pouvoir rendre sa famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fourata is the leader of the Wendlasida group. She is married and has three children: the eldest is 15 years old, and the youngest seven years old. All three go to school. Mrs. Fourata has four dependents in total. On the photo she is the one holding a yellow folder.

Fourata has been growing vegetables since 2009. She stocks up at nearby markets. She would like to buy one bag of fertilizers, two boxes of onion seeds and two jugs of insecticide. She would like to use her revenue to improve her children’s life conditions and strengthen her business. Her goal is to assure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy one bag of fertilizers, two boxes of onion seeds and two jugs of insecticide.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine is 23 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has one child and is married. As a group leader, Christine is here representing her group of eight farmers in Teso District, in Kenya. She is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Christine's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. In addition to receiving farming inputs, she is purchasing a solar light as part of her loan this year. She is very excited about this, because now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and thereby save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

Christine and her group will receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as input loans of maize seed and fertilizer to plant a total of four acres.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seed and fertilizer for the coming planting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Willimina's Group

texts.en:
Willimina is 44 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has four children and is married. As a group leader, Willimina is here representing her group of 10 farmers in Teso District, in Kenya. She is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Willimina's desire to earn enough to feed her family. In addition to farming inputs, she is purchasing a solar light as part of her loan this year. This is very exciting to her, because now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and thereby save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Willimina and her group will receive a total of nine solar lights, as well as input loans of maize seed and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seed and fertilizer for the coming planting season, as well as a solar light

loans.name: Nareman

texts.en:
Nareman is an 18-year-old single lady from Khanyounis city. She lives with her parents and four brothers and sister in a small humble house. Her father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Nareman is a student in a local university where she studies Information Technology. She would like to complete her studies and find a job  to help her family with part of their expenses.

Nareman requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Nareman will be able to do her homework and read articles online. 

Nareman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Marylecticia's Group

texts.en:
Marylecticia is 39 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Marylecticia is representing her group of 9 farmers in the Teso District in Kenya for a loan. She is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Marylecticia's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Marylecticia and her group will receive a total of 6 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming planting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is an 18-year-old single lady from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a small, humble house. Her father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income to support the family. Hanan is a student at a local university where she studies public relations. She would like to complete her studies and find a job to help her family with their expenses.
Hanan requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Hanan will be able to do her homework and read articles online. 
Hanan appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.en: Nasimjon was born in 1994 and lives with his parents in south Tajikistan. Nasimjon studies law in the 3rd course of the National University of Tajikistan. He is a very clever and hard-working student. Nasimjon dreams to be a high-quality specialist in the future. He must pay for the university tuition and is asking for a loan. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Julia Carolina

texts.es:
Julia de 35 años de edad, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el bachillerato, luego decidió casarse y ahora es madre de 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad de los cuales solo uno se encuentra estudiando, su esposo trabaja como vigilante, Julia vive con sus hijos y su esposo, Julia se dedica a la agricultura, a la ganadería y a la crianza de especies menores como cerdos y pollos de engorde desde hace 10 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su madrecita quien siempre se dedico a este oficio, para llegar a su trabajo Julia camina 2 kilómetros todos los días trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 11:00 am. 

El crédito que esta solicitando en credicampo, es para la compra de 2 vacas lecheras con eso ella podrá vender la leche y así lograra tener un poco mas de ingresos para el sustento de sus hijos y así le dará una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

El sueño de Julia es ampliar el hato de ganado, darle a sus hijos todo lo necesario para que sean personas de bien y construir una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
35-year old Julia is a homemaker and has a high school education. After graduating she decided to get married and now has two children aged 4 and 2. Her husband is a security guard. She has earned her living raising cows and other animals such as pigs and chickens for ten years,  a skill she learned from her mother who has always raised animals. To get to work Julia walks two kilometres every day, and she works from 7 am to 11 am.

The loan she is seeking from CrediCampo will be used to buy two milk cows. Then she will be able to sell the milk they produce and earn a little more money to help support her children. The family will have a better standard of living.

Julia’s dreams are to have a larger herd of cows, provide her children with everything they need to become people of means, and build a nice home for the family.

loans.use: buy two milk cows

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is a 40-year-old, married woman, who with her husband has been running a business selling milk for many years. She has one cow, which she uses for milk to sell to the people of her locality. She has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her fourth loan cycle. She has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. Mukhtaran hopes that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia is 35 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a barber by profession.  He is known in his town for doing good hair styling and cutting. He makes enough to contribute in the family income. Now, he needs to serve more customers, time after time. For this reason Fozia has obtained a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR, for her husband. It enabled him to purchase more packs of hair scissors, brushes and combs, along with some furniture for his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of hair scissors, brushes and combs, along with some furniture, for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Teegawende De Moince Group

texts.fr:
Mme SALIMATA est responsable du TEEGAWENDE DE MOINCE. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 06personnes en charge. Sur la photo, elle est en soutra blanc voile  noir.
Mme fait le jardinage depuis 2005. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter 05sac d’engrais, 03boites de semence de choux et 03bidons d’insecticide.
Mme  veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne pouvoir sortir sa famille dans la pauvreté.
texts.en:
Salimata is the representative of the 'Teegawende de Moince' Group.  She is married and has five children.  The eldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 3 years old.  Three of her children currently attend school, and she is responsible for a total of six people.  In the photograph she is wearing a white robe with a black veil.

Salimata has been growing vegetables since 2005.  She buys her supplies from local markets, and will use her loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer, three boxes of cabbage seeds and three drums of insecticide.

Salimata intends to use her profits to improve the living conditions of her children and to strengthen her business.  It is her aim to help her family to move out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer, 3 boxes of cabbage seeds and 3 drums of insecticide.

loans.name: Rosa Coralia

texts.es:
Rosa, es empleada como secretaria desde hace tres años, como una forma de tener ingresos extras empezó a ayudarle a otra persona a vender productos de revista, posteriormente tomo la decisión de trabajar sola en dicha actividad, ya tiene clientes  establecidos; vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos los cuales están estudiando, cuida mucho de dar a su familia lo necesario para subsistir. 
Invertirá en la compra de cosméticos, lociones, cremas corporales y otros productos de revista, al tener nuevos productos podrá estar preparada con anticipación para la época de celebraciones estudiantiles y fiestas navideñas, espera obtener mejores ingresos y cancelar su deuda sin problemas.
Sueña con tener casa propia, salir adelante con su familia y tener un nuevo rubro para crecer con su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa has been employed as a secretary for three years. As a way to earn extra income, she began helping another person to sell beauty products. Later, she made the decision to work alone in that business and already has established clients.

Rosa lives with her life partner and her children, who are in school. She takes a lot of care to give her family what they need. 

She will invest in the purchase of cosmetics, lotions, body creams and other beauty products; having new products will have her be prepared for the graduation and Christmas season. She hopes to get a better income and pay off her debts without any problems. Her dream is to have her own house, to move forward with her family and to have a new heading to grow with her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, lotions, body creams, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Jafferson's Group

texts.en:
Jafferson is a 57-year-old proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hard-working individual, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Jafferson has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Jafferson described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, along with fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Jafferson’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Noon

texts.en:
Noon is 47 years old and married.

For some years, her son (also in the photo) has been running a business of food stall selling "dahi bhallay," a dish consisting of balls made from ground lentils, deep fried, and served in a yogurt sauce. 

To increase his sales, he needs to purchase packs of black and white chick peas, salt, oil, and spices. 

For this reason, Noon has availed a Murabaha of PKR 35,000 for her son. She is positive that her son’s business will flourish in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase packs of chick peas, salt, oil, and spices.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is involved in the interior design of buildings. He lives in Yerevan, with his wife and one-year-old child. He receives different orders from local people and provides them with interior computer designing for houses. Vardan is an educated and experienced professional who works hard to sustain his family's living.

To be able to purchase a new computer for making interior 3D design, he has applied for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a computer for making interior 3D design.

loans.name: Wycliffe's Group

texts.en:
Wycliffe, pictured above, has seven children and is always described as a very hard-working individual, which is why he was selected to become the leader of his group. Wycliffe is representing a group of eight farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Wycliffe has been a farmer for 10 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Wycliffe is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 2.75 acres will be planted by Wycliffe's Group, and between them they will receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very hard-working individual, which is why she was selected to become the leader of her group. Eunice is representing her group of eight farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Eunice has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Eunice is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 3.5 acres will be planted by Eunice's Group, and between them they will receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a 20-year-old married woman who lives in a sector called Marka in Amman.

Yusra is starting a small business at home selling clothes. She is planning to bring the goods through her husband from the free zone market in Aqaba at wholesale prices, as her husband works in a company located in Aqaba. Now Yusra is applying for a loan to buy a big quantity of clothes for the winter season.

loans.use: to buy a big quantity of clothes for the winter season to sell

loans.name: Teltaaba Moince Group

texts.fr:
Mme HABIBOU est responsable du TELTAABA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 05personnes en charge. Sur la photo, elle est en soutra noir voile blanc fleuri noir.
Mme fait le maraichage depuis 2007. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter 02sac d’engrais, 03boites de semence d’oignon et 02bidons d’insecticide.
Mme  veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour aider son mari à nourrir la famille et renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne pouvoir envoyer ses enfants dans des écoles supérieures.
texts.en:
Habibou is the representative of the 'Teltaaba' Group.  She is married and has four children.  The eldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is 5 years old.  Three of her children currently attend school, and she is responsible for a total of five people.  In the photograph she is wearing a black robe with a white, flowered veil.

Salimata has been growing vegetables since 2007.  She buys her supplies from local markets, and will use her loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer, three boxes of onion seeds and two drums of insecticide.

Salimata intends to use her profits to help her husband to feed their family and to strengthen her business.  It is her aim to be able to send her children to higher levels of school.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer, 3 boxes of onion seeds and 2 drums of insecticide.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter, featured in the above picture, is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. He is 51 years old and a married father of five children, and he is often described as a very hardworking individual.

Although Peter has been a farmer for more than 30 years, he is new to One Acre Fund. He decided to join this year, because he really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though he is new to the program, Peter wanted to represent his group, because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Peter hopes to be able to send his children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. In addition, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package, although Peter, himself, chose not to. The group members will receive a total of three solar lights, in addition to the farming inputs, as part of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Michael's Group

texts.en:
Michael, pictured above, has eight children and is always described as a very hard-working individual, which is why he was selected to become the leader of his group. Michael is representing a group of 14 farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Michael has been a farmer for more than 40 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Michael is planning to send his children to school.

A total of six acres will be planted by Michael's Group, and between them they will receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Krisanto's Group

texts.en:
Krisanto's group is formed by 12 farmers in Teso District. Krisanto is the group leader pictured above. He is 40 years old, is married, and has three children. Krisanto has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Krisanto isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in  that he has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. 

This year, Krisanto will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Krisanto's group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Fedinand's Group

texts.en:
Fedinand is the group leader of his group in Teso District, and he is representing 15 farmers, including himself. He is married and a proud father of four children. Fedinand joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for 10 years.

Like many other farmers, Fedinand decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to save more money for the future.

Fedinand's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 6.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights, as, even though Fedinand decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to buy efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Soita's Group

texts.en:
Soita is 34 years old and is often described as a very friendly person. He has three children and is married. As a group leader, Soita is representing his group of 10 farmers in Matete District, in Kenya. He is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Soita's desire to get the best-quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In addition to receiving farming inputs, he is purchasing a solar light as part of his loan. This is very exciting to him, because now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and thereby save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

Soita and his group will receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as input loans of maize seed and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and cost-efficient hybrid seed and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Consolata's Group

texts.en:
Consolata, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group, formed by 16 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. She is 40 years old and the married mother of five children.  She is often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Consolata has been a farmer for 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund.  She decided to join this year because she really wants to earn enough to feed her family. Even though she is new to the program, Consolata wants to represent her group because she wants to help more farmers. 

With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Consolata hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.  Even though Consolata decided not to, some farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 35-year-old father of four from the Mundri County of South Sudan. He operates his own business, buying and selling grocery items such as sugar, cooking oil, soap, stationery, candles, flour, milk, juice, and salt. 

He is requesting a loan from WOYE MFI so that he can expand his business. He will be able to increase the stock and boost his sales. Abdallah hopes to build own shop in the community and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his grocery business.

loans.name: Leah's Group

texts.en:
Leah is 30 years old and is often described as a very experienced farmer. She has four children and is married. As a group leader, Leah is representing her group of 12 farmers in Matete District in Kenya.  

She is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.  The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Leah's desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. 

Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her. She will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. 

With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Leah and her group will receive a total of 13 solar lights, as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Khatoon

texts.en: Khatoon is a 59-year-old married mother of eight children. For the past five years, she and her husband have been running a business buying and selling livestock. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them while her husband sells to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. In order to expand her earnings, Khatoon has requested from Murabaha a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy more animals such as calves and heifers for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy more animals such as calves and heifers for resale purposes.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila is a 25-year-old married woman. She has two children. One of her children and her husband are also pictured with her. Her husband has been doing a business selling crockery for many years. He offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls, etc. and makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her husband’s business, Naila contacted Kashf Foundation and availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR. In this way he purchased more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, glasses and plates in various sizes and designs. He expects a boost in his net income.

loans.use: to buy more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, glasses and plates in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Maram

texts.fr: MARAM est une femme très brave qui habite dans un village qui est à 10km de la ville ou se situe le Guichet. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants sont le plus grand à 18ans et le plus petit 1ans. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des poissons et légumes et a une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Etant à son 3ème prêt, elle sollicite ce crédit pour aller en ville acheter des poissons et légumes pour l’amener au village et les vendre à ses voisins. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 15h. A l’avenir elle souhaite agrandir son commerce et ouvrir un grand magasin sur le marché de la place et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi, elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Maram is a very courageous woman who lives in a village ten kilometres from the field partner's office.  She is married and has five children.  The eldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 1 year old.  She has more than ten years' experience selling fish and vegetables.

This will be Maram's third loan and it will enable her to travel to town to buy fish and vegetables for resale to neighbours in her village.

Maram helps her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family, and the school costs of their children.  She begins work at nine in the morning and finishes at three in the afternoon.

In the future, Maram would like to expand her business and open a large stall in the local market.  She hopes this would increase her revenue and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and fish for resale.

loans.name: Abdoulaye Dioum

texts.fr: Abdoulaye est un homme qui est marié et père de famille. Il évolue dans la fabrication des marmites en aluminium. Il a une expérience de plus de 20ans et sollicite ce montant pour acheter de l’aluminium pour fabriquer des marmites et les revend à ses clients. Il a un parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution et est à son 6ème prêt. Ainsi, il  est un habitué du guichet et paie  correctement  ses crédits. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir, il souhaite avoir une usine de production de fer et d’aluminium, de ce fait il pourra augmenter ses revenus, élargir le nombre des employés et épargner de l’argent
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is a married man with children.  He works making aluminium cooking pots, and has more than 20 years' experience in his craft.  He has requested a loan from the field partner in order to buy aluminium to make more cooking pots for sale to his customers.

Abdoulaye has another family member who works with the field partner, and this will be his sixth loan.  He is well used to working with the field partner, and always repays his loans correctly.

He begins work at eight in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening.  In the future, Abdoulaye would like to own a production factory for iron and aluminium.  This would increase his earnings, increase the number of employees he has and allow him to save money.

loans.use: to buy aluminium to be used to make cooking pots.

loans.name: Petronila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Petronila de 37 años de edad, es ama de casa, por la situación económica no estudió y decidió aprender a trabajar para ayudar a su familia en los gastos de la casa, estuvo casada y junto con su esposo procrearon 5 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos se encuentran trabajando y 2 estudiando, luego el esposo falleció y la responsabilidad le quedo solamente a ella, ahora en día Petronila se acompaño nuevamente y su compañero de vida trabaja como vigilante en un cañal del ingenio, mientras que Petronila se dedica a la agricultura, a la ganadería, a la siembra de hortalizas y a la crianza de especies menores como cerdos y pollos, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres y por la pobreza en que estaban viviendo, para llegar a su trabajo Petronila camina 2 kilómetros, trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm todos los días.

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar 2 terneras con las cuales podrá tener ganancias dentro de un periodo, así lograra tener un poco mas de ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Petronila es darle mucho estudio a sus hijos, para que sean profesionales y tengan mejores posibilidades de trabajo y también sueña con aumentar la ganadería de doble propósito.
texts.en:
Petronila, 37 years old, is a housewife. Due to her family's economic situation she did not go to school. She decided to learn to work to help her family with household expenses. She was married and with her husband she had 5 children. 3 of them are working and 2 are in school. Later her husband died, leaving all the responsibility to her. 

Today Petronila is in a relationship again and her life partner works as a guard of a canal at the sugar refinery while Petronila makes a living in farming and livestock, growing vegetables and raising small species such as pigs and chickens, work which she learned from her parents and because of the poverty in which they lived. To get to work, Petronila walks 2 kilometers, working from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm every day. 

The loan she is requesting from the institution is to buy 2 calves from which she can make a profit within a period of time. That way, she will have some more income to give her family a better quality of life. 

Petronila's dream is to give her children a good education so that they can become professionals and have better job possibilities. She also dreams of increasing her herd of dual purpose (meat and milk) livestock.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves from which she can profit within a period of time

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old and is often described as a very hard-working individual. She has four children and is married. Rose is representing her group of 16 farmers in Teso District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Rose's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Rose and her group will receive a total of 14 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of seven acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more women clothes, accessories, perfumes, henna and other items to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Fidelis's Group

texts.en:
Fidelis is a 36-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Fidelis has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Fidelis described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Fidelis’s Group will be able to plant a total of four acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Phanice's Group

texts.en:
Phanice is 42 years old and is often described as a very reliable person. She has four children and is married. As a group leader, Phanice is here representing her group of 16 farmers in Teso District, in Kenya. She is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time, this year.

Her decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Phanice's desire to earn enough to feed her family. In addition to farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan. This is very exciting to her, because now she will have light during dark hours for her children to study by. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Phanice and her group will receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as input loans of maize seed and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seed and fertilizer for the coming planting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Sixtus's Group

texts.en:
Sixtus is 57 years old and is often described as a very reliable person. He has two children,  and is married. As a group leader, Sixtus is representing his group of 15 farmers in Teso District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Sixtus's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

Sixtus and his group will receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: William's Group

texts.en:
William, who is pictured above, has seven children and is always described as a very reliable person. That is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. William is representing his group of 11 farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time, this year.

William has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will include not only farming inputs, but also a solar light. He is very happy to be getting a solar light, because that means he will have light during dark hours now, for his children to study by. With the profits from this coming season, William is planning to send his children to school.

A total of five acres will be planted by William's Group, and among them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light

loans.name: Al- Rhma Al- Jamia Group

texts.en:
Al- Rhma Al- Jamia is a group from four women, living in Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

The leader of this group is Naziha. She is a 26-year-old married woman and the mother of three children, living with her family in a rented house. She has a diploma certificate and is an employee with a small salary. Her house is without a lot of furniture and most of it is very old. Naziha and her husband work very hard to improve the living conditions of the family but their income isn't enough to do that. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase furniture for her house.

Naziha hopes to have her own house in order to save the money that they pay for the monthly rent.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her house.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a married woman. She is a mother of three school-going children. She has been running a business of hand embroidery for the past five years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Her husband is employed as a sales person in a general store, but he does not earn enough to support his family alone. Zahida's embroidery patterns are very popular in her area, and she has the best earning resource in her house.  

In order to expand her business, she requested a loan of PKR 55,000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. 

She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 35-year-old married woman. The man shown in the picture is her husband. 

She has been successfully running a general store with her husband from many years. She offers a variety of daily use products, and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Zahida needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

Zahida has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, rice, juices, etc. 

In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, rice, juices, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso De Huaycan Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Esperanza y Progreso De Huaycán”  está conformado 06 socios emprendedores y optimistas por desarrollarse en sus negocios. Marina de 52 años de edad separada con 02 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida así como el arroz con pollo y el lomo saltado.  El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de carne de res, pollo, arroz y papa. Su mayor deseo es contar con su restaurante ya que hasta el momento lo realiza en ambulatoriamente. El grupo  “Esperanza y Progreso De Huaycán” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por el crédito brindado. Marina es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca amarillo.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Esperanza y Progreso De Huaycán” is made up of six entrepreneurial members who are optimistic about developing their businesses.

Marina is 52 years old and separated with two independent children. She makes her living selling food like chicken and rice and lomo saltado [a Peruvian steak stir fry]. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy beef, chicken, rice, and potatoes. Her biggest wish is to continue with her restaurant because up until now she has been a street vendor.

The “Esperanza y Progreso De Huaycán” group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan offered. Marina is the first on the left side and is wearing a yellow jacket.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, rice, and potatoes.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: AISSATOU est une femme qui habite dans un village non loin du Guichet. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits de la période. Elle est à son 3ème prêt et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des fruits comme les oranges et les vendre à la station des bus. Elle a comme charges les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais médicaux de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de 10 ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle souhaite avec l’aide de l’institution augmenter son fond de commerce et diversifier ses produits  et gagner la part du marché.
texts.en:
Aissatou is a woman who lives in a village not far from the field partner's office.  She is married and has children.  She has no other family member who works with the field partner.

Aissatou has ten years' experience selling fruit in season.  This will be her third loan and she will use it to buy fruit such as oranges for resale at the bus station.  She is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of her family and the medical expenses of her children.  Her working day starts at seven in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening.

Aissatou's aim is to continue working with the field partner to increase her working capital, diversify the range of products she offers and gain a bigger part of the market.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Celestine's Group

texts.en:
Celestine, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very reliable person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Celestine is representing his group of 16 farmers in Teso District and he is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Celestine has been a farmer for 18 years and, in order to earn enough money to send his children to school, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs, but also two solar lights, which he is very happy to be getting since that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Celestine is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 8.25 acres will be planted by Celestine's Group, and between them, they will receive a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Gladys Angelica Rose

texts.en:
Gladys Angelica Rose is 29 years old.  She has two children, ages 2 years and 9 months, respectively.

he engages in running a sari-sari (or variety) store. She sells basic commodities like noodles, canned goods,biscuits, coffee, soap, and seasonings.  She hails from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She has been operating her sari-sari store for almost two years now.

She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy assorted groceries, like soft drinks, beverages, and canned goods. With these, she can fill her store with various stocks and attract more customers, thus providing her family with good food and better living conditions. 

Gladys Angelica Rose would like to expand her business to be successful, for the improvement of her livelihood and for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries, like soft drinks, beverages, and canned goods

loans.name: Philip's Group

texts.en:
Philip, pictured above, has 6 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Philip is representing his group of 10 farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Philip has been a farmer for 18 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Philip is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 3.75 acres will be planted by Philip's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light

loans.name: Afsana

texts.en: Afsana is a married woman with 3 children. One of her children is shown in the photo. Her husband (also shown in the photo) runs a shop where he sells  cosmetics and costume jewelry.  With this business, he earns sufficient income to provide his family with the basic necessities of life. He needs to purchase more jewelry items such as bracelets, earrings and rings along with packs of beauty products to increase his sales and earnings. For the improvement of her husband’s business, Afsana has asked for a murabaha (a non-interest-bearing loan common in Islamic financing) of 30,000 PKR.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry items such as bracelets, earrings and rings along with packs of beauty products for a shop.

loans.name: Antony's Group

texts.en:
Antony, pictured above, has five children.  He is always described as a very hardworking individual -- which is why he was selected to become the leader of his group of 11 farmers in Teso District.  He is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Antony has been a farmer for 20 years.  In order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. 

His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting.  That means he will now reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

With the profits from this coming season, Antony is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 4.5 acres will be planted by Antony's group.  Among them, the members will receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a smallholder dairy farmer, based in the Nkubu region of Kenya. She is diligently raising her three children, aged between 7 and 24 years, single-handedly. Being born second in a family of eight, Hellen learned at a tender age the value of sacrificing one's needs for the betterment of others. 

Eight years ago, she started farming on her father's two-acre piece of land to support her siblings and children. Today, she has two dairy cows, eight poultry birds, a pig, and 20 trees on the farm. She finds it easy to introduce any farming technique that adds value to the farm business and improves productivity. 

Some years back, Hellen introduced irrigation which has helped her crops grow green and healthy. Now, she is seeking a loan from the Kiva lenders to introduce cattle housing. 

A half-decade ago, Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to finance agricultural assets on various rural farms in Kenya. Over the years, we have learned from our dairy farmers that having a cowshed has quite a positive impact on milk production and the health of the cows. 

Hellen will use the income from this investment to continue to provide for her family and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Naomy's Group

texts.en:
Naomy is 32 years old, and she is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has one child and is married. As a group leader, Naomy is representing her group of 10 farmers in Matete District in Kenya. She is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Naomy's desire to earn enough to feed her family. 

Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan.  That is very exciting to her, as she will now be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. 

With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

Naomy and her group will receive a total of 10 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 28-year-old married woman and mother of 2 children. The man shown in the photo is Uzma’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Uzma has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR, for her husband to buy new tires and other spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers.

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and other spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Milda's Group

texts.en:
Milda's group is formed by 14 farmers in Teso District.  It is being represented by Milda, the group leader pictured above. She is 58 years old and has been a farmer for more than 30 years.  She is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Milda isn’t new to One Acre Fund.  She actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. 

This year, Milda will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Milda's group will purchase a total of 15 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet is a 48-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 16 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Violet has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Violet described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Violet’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8 acres of land and purchase a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a married woman and 34 years of age. Her great skill is hand embroidery and her experience of 4 years in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community.

Over time, the demand for her hand-embroidered cloth has increased and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her 3 children. 

Tasleem is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR with which she wants to purchase more spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper. She hopes that her skill will help her to grow her business in future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: Amadou est un jeune homme qui évolue dans les prestations de service. Il est n’est pas marié mais n’empêche il s’occupe de ses parents et de ses frères et sœurs. Il vient de découvrir l’institution et  voudrait commencer à prendre des crédits pour renforcer son activité qui est de faire des traitements de texte et de la photocopie. Ces charges personnelles sont ses frais de transport, l’habillement et parfois le crédit. Il commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h. A l’avenir, il voudrait installer une grande papeterie à l’université, ainsi il pourra augmenter ses revenus et former un ménage.
texts.en: Amadou is a young man who is gaining experience in the service industry. He is not married, but nevertheless he looks after his parents and his brothers and sisters. He has recently discovered our institution and would like to start taking out loans in order to grow his word processing and photocopying business. His personal expenses include transport fees, clothing and occasionally loan repayments. His working day starts at 9 AM and finishes at 8 PM. In the future, he would like to open his own establishment at the university so he'll be able to increase his profits and starting running his own household.

loans.use: to purchase stationary for the secretarial services he provides

loans.name: Nueva Luz De Poromate Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Nueva Luz de Poromate” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en la comunidad de Poromate del distrito de Vilcabamba de la provincia de La Convención, Cusco, Perú.
 La socia Zenovia tiene 49 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el  crédito para la compra de gaseosas entre otros.
 Los demás socios se dedican a la ganadería, a la agricultura, a la venta de comida, crianza de animales menores y otros brindan servicios profesionales.
 Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Nueva Luz de Poromate" (New Light of Poromate) of Arariwa Association and live in the community of Poromate, in the  district of Vilcabamba and the province of La Convencion, Cusco, Peru. 

One member, Zenovia, is 49 years old and is divorced with two children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business; she spends a lot of time at her store, which is doing well thanks to the determination she puts into it every day. Zenovia sells rice, sugar, milk, etc, and wants to be able to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family. Zenovia asks for a loan to buy soda water among others. 

The other members work raising livestock, in agriculture, selling foods, raising small animals, and others provide professional services. The members are grateful for those who form a part of their dream through this medium and promise to keep up with the payment of their fees in the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy soda waters etc.

loans.name: Bakur

texts.en:
Bakur is single and lives with his mother in Vanadzor town. Bakur has been in the construction business for several years and loves his job. He provides interior and exterior construction work for local people in Vanadzor town and gets income which is vital for their family living.

Bakur asks for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for providing construction work.

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing construction work

loans.name: Ben's Group

texts.en:
Ben is a 37-year-old, proud father of five children. He is a group leader, and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He is here representing his group of 15 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Ben has noticed that he has been able to feed his family consistently.

Ben says his harvest was very good last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to be purchasing two solar lights this year, in addition to fertilizer and maize seed. Now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and thereby save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Ben’s Group will purchase inputs enough to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land, and a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, and cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 19-year-old single woman. She lives in Al Zarqa with 6 family members. 2 of her family members are employers. 

Sahar is studying for her Bachelor degree in law in her first year. Sahar is working a part-time job selling clothes. 

Sahar’s future plan is to get her bachelor degree and her graduate degree. 

Sahar is applying for a loan to help her to cover her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees

loans.name: Vidal Ceferino

texts.es:
Vidal de 33 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador y muy responsable, actualmente se dedica a la albañilería y a los trabajos agrícolas siendo su principal fuente de ingresos, ademas vive con su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios del hogar y con su hijo, que aun no estudia por su corta edad.

Vidal tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a la albañilería, este oficio lo aprendió cuando trabajaba de ayudante de albañil y así fue como adquirió sus conocimientos en la construcción, ademas cultiva 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz para el consumo de su familia. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar unos pollos de engorde, ya que a finales de diciembre quiere venderlos y así poder generar un poco mas de ingresos para su familia que tanto lo necesitan.  Vidal quiere en un futuro tener una casa propia y así poder darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vidal is 33 years old. He is a very hardworking and responsible man. Currently, he makes his living bricklaying and with agricultural jobs, which are his primary source of income. Furthermore, he lives with his wife, who handles the housework, and with his son, who does not study yet because he is too young.

Vidal has worked as a bricklayer for many years. He learned the trade when he worked as an apprentice and that is how he acquired his knowledge about construction. He also cultivates 3,500 square meters of corn for his family's consumption.

The loan he is requesting is to purchase a couple broiler chickens because at the end of December, he wants to sell them and in doing so, be able to generate a little more income for his family, which they really need. Vidal wants to have his own house in the future and be able to give his son a better quality of life this way.

loans.use: to start a small business with broiler chickens.

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en:
For the last two years Jacklyne has been selling clothes to her customers and earns a monthly income of 26,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is married to Maurice and blessed with three children who are one, six, and nine years old.

She has applied for this first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more clothes, both new and secondhand, to sell in the coming high season.

Jacklyne will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and open a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 36 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. 

Margaret has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2008. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to the best seed prices and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Margaret also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Margaret's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jame's Group

texts.en:
James is a 75-year-old proud father of 8 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, James has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

James described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy more land to cultivate.

With this loan, James’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter is 37 years old and is often described as a very reliable person. He has four children and is married. As the group leader, Peter is representing his group of 15 farmers in Teso District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Peter's desire to earn enough to feed his family. In addition to receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

Peter and his group will receive a total of 13 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Virgen Inmaculada De Maranniyoc Group

texts.es:
La socia Fidelia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN INMACULADA DE MARANNIYOC, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de La Convención, distrito de Vilcabamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Fidelia continua con su  negocio de cultivo de frutas, como platanos, naranjas entre otros, la socia vende a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y  se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, a la vez la socia cuenta con su tienda de abarrotes el cual espera que le valla bien, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
Los demás socios también se dedican al cultivo de frutas.
texts.en:
Fidelia is a member of Virgen Inmaculada de Maranniyoc Communal Bank, located in the province of La Convención in the district of Vilcabamba and department of Cusco.

Fidelia still has her business growing bananas, oranges, and other fruits.  She sells to her customers on request.  She also has a grocery store that she hopes is going well for her, because this is how she gets her family ahead.

Fidelia's requesting the loan to buy seeds and soil amendments.  She's grateful for this loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

The other members also earn a living growing fruit.

loans.use: to buy seeds and soil amendments

loans.name: Raphael

texts.fr: RAPHAEL est un jeune homme marié et père de famille. Il évolue dans le transport et possède un taxi depuis plus de 10ans. Il est à son 2ème prêt dans l’institution et sollicite ce dernier pour acheter un nouveau moteur pour mieux entretenir son véhicule. Il n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il commence sa journée  à 6h pour la terminer à 22h. Il souhaite acheter avec l’aide de l’institution d’autres taxi pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus , élargir le nombre de ses employés et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Raphael is a young married father. He works as a taxi driver and has owned his own car for over 10 years. This will be his second loan with our institution. He is requesting this loan to purchase a new car motor so he can repair his vehicle if the need arises. He does not have a parent beneficiary within the institution. He manages his family's daily expenses and his children's school fees. He starts his day at 6 AM and finishes at 10 PM. With the help of our institution, he would like to purchase more taxis so he can increase profits, employ more staff and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car motor so he can repair his taxi

loans.name: Sikoe

texts.en:
For the last ten years, Sikoe has been in livestock trading, whereby he buys and sells animals and earns a monthly income of KES 90,000 (Kenyan Shillings). He is married to Grace and blessed with five school-going children.

Sikoe has applied for his first loan of KES 100,000 from VisionFund Kenya and he intends to use the loan to buy more goats and sheep to rear, then later sell at a profit.  

Sikoe will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's basic needs. His future hopes are to grow his business and to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep to rear and sell at a profit.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick is 35 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has 2 children and is married. As a group leader, Patrick is representing his group of 16 farmers in the Teso District in Kenya for a group loan, and he is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Patrick's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

Patrick and his group will receive a total of 13 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 7 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming planting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine, pictured above, is the group leader and is representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Catherine will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Catherine plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Catherine’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of five acres of land. They will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a 40-year-old widow woman living in a small village called Gotmara in the Angul district of Odisha, India with two children. She is mother of a son who is 12 years old and a daughter who is 14 years old. Her children are in a school near her house. Rina is engaged in a tailoring business and it is the only source of income for her. She earns 3,500 INR per month. Her current income is not sufficient for her family's expenses. She wants to increase her income by producing more tailoring output to save some money for her children's education costs.

She has requested this loan to purchase a sewing machine and thread to increase her output. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and thread to increase her output

loans.name: Moses's Group

texts.en:
Moses, pictured above, has been a farmer for 6 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers in Teso District. He is 36 years old, is married, and has 6 children.

Moses likes to think of himself as a very reliable person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has a larger farm group support. Moses plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Moses’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvest

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily, a 61-year-old farmer from Kiplombe, a remote village in the Eldoret area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her children as a primary caregiver. For the past 20 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, and tomatoes and keeping dairy cows. Emily has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. After her husband lost his formal job, the role of primary caregiver of the family fell to Emily. It has been overwhelming because she now has to shoulder the responsibility of feeding the whole family. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said. Emily is requesting a loan to buy an additional quality dairy cow and to build a modern dairy unit. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profits and increased income levels. The profit from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise.
