Emily is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling it. She will also start selling dairy products such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets. Emily believes that if female farmers had the same access to resources as men, the number of the world's hungry could be reduced by half.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow and build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Benjamin's Group

texts.en:
Benjamin, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 6 farmers in Teso District. He is 62 years old, is married, and has 9 children.

Benjamin likes to think of himself as a very reliable person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has learnt a lot from his farming training. Benjamin plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Benjamin’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 3.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvest

loans.name: Gad's Group

texts.en:
Gad is a 67-year-old proud father of 10 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 8 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Gad has noticed that he has learnt a lot from his farming training.

Gad described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Gad’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Amanda Bety

texts.es:
Amanda, se dedica a brindar el servicio de sastres, vive con su esposo y dos hijos; es una mujer responsable que está al pendiente de lo que su  familia necesita; el oficio de confecciones de prendas de vestir lo aprendió siendo una adolescente en un curso impartido en su localidad, trabaja en un horario de 10:00 a.m. 4:00 p.m., hasta la fecha no representa ningún problema en su negocio.
Con el préstamo comprara hilos, telas, adornos y otros materiales para elaborar gabachas y venderlas, ya con su producto finalizado lo ofrecerá al por mayor en la zona de residencia. El principal objetivo es mejorar la economía familiar y cancelar con buena calificación crediticia su deuda.
Para Amanda es importante mantener su negocio estable y lograr comprase una maquina nueva con tecnología avanzada para realizar diferentes prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Amanda makes her living as a tailor and lives with her husband and two children; she is a responsible woman who is looking out for what her family needs. She learned the trade of making dresses and garments as a teenager in a course taught in her town. She works from 10am to 4pm, and to date she has had no problems in her store. 

With this loan she will buy threads, fabrics, ornaments, and other materials to make and sell aprons, and she will offer her finished product wholesale to her area of residence. The main objective is to improve her family's economy and pay off her debt for a good credit score. For Amanda, it's important to keep her store stable and to manage to buy a new sewing machine with advanced technology to make different kinds of clothing.

loans.use: to buy threads, fabrics, ornaments, and other materials to make and sell aprons

loans.name: Duaa

texts.en:
Duaa is a conservative married woman. She asked her husband Nafez to appear in the photo instead of her.

Duaa is 23 years old. She lives in Madaba. Duaa has an accessories and perfumes store that she started a while ago. Duaa is applying for the loan so she can get new merchandise of cosmetics and children’s accessories.

loans.use: to get new merchandise of cosmetics and children’s accessories.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita, es una señora que ha quedado viuda, ella vive con su hija de 19 años de edad y un hermano, en su localidad es reconocida como un persona responsable y luchadora; su negocio es la elaboración  y comercialización de loza, el cual nació hace 30 años como opción para tener recursos económicos para suplir las necesidades de su familia, oficio que heredó de su mamá, tiene un horario de trabajo de 5:00 a 6:00 p.m., su familia le ayuda a trabajar.
Invertirá en barro crudo, nacazcol, arcilla y leña, seguirá elaborando piezas de barro para uso doméstico y otras artesanías, Felicita espera tener mayor productividad para cubrir todos los pedidos de la temporada y tener mejores ingresos con los que podrá resarcir la deuda.
Sus sueños son contratar alfareros para ampliar su negocio y cambiar el nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Felicita is a woman who has been widowed. She lives with her 19 year old daughter and a brother. In her neighbourhood, she is well known as a responsible and hardworking person.

She works making and selling pottery, which she started 30 years ago as a way to earn money to supplement the needs of her family. She learned this work from her mother. Felicita works from 5am to 6pm, and her family helps her in her work. 

She will invest the loan in raw clay, nacazcol (a dye), other types of clay, and firewood, to continue making clay pieces for domestic use, as well as other crafts. Felicita hopes to produce more to cover all of the requests of the season, and to have better earnings with which to pay back what she owes. 

Her dream is to hire potters to expand her business and change her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest in raw clay, nacazcol (a dye), other types of clay, and firewood to continue making clay pieces for domestic use, among other crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her horticultural farm

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 33-year-old, married mother of three children. Eighteen years ago, due to the poor financial situation of her husband, she started working as a hairdresser to cover the needs and expenses of her family.

Fatima is a hard worker and has a good reputation among her customers because she has professional skills in this field. She tries hard to provide her family with better living conditions, thus today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to renovate her house and make it a better place for her family. 

She hopes to open her own beauty salon in the future, to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Jose Lorenzo

texts.es: Jose de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el trabaja como electricista desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una caja de herramientas ya que las actualmente tiene están muy deterioradas y así poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old, and lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked as an electrician for many years, and with the money he earns working he is able to pay the costs of his home and get ahead. 

José asks for this loan to buy a tool box, since the tools he has now are in bad condition. With this he will be able to continue with his work that brings him such good earnings.

loans.use: to buy a tool box.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
For the last nine years, Salome has been supplying eggs and earns a monthly income of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is a single mother of four school-going children.                                                

She has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy more stock of eggs for sale.

Salome will use the anticipated profits to plough back into her business and in the future, she desires to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more stock of eggs for sale.

loans.name: Esterlieta

texts.en:
Esterlieta is a 54-year-old  woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol and a mother of a 14 year old son. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities like eggs, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, canned goods and soft drinks. She has been operating the store for five years already. 

Due to her very limited amount of capital, Esterlieta has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy additional stock like soft drinks, beverages and assorted groceries. These are essential tools that will help improve her earnings, and allow her to display more stocks for the store, attracting more consumers to purchase.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her current business for the welfare of her son as well as continuing to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soft drinks, beverages and assorted groceries

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 45-year-old hardworking woman, married to Brian, who adds additional income to support their family, and they are blessed with four children.  Jennifer has been operating a charcoal sales business for a period of six years, earning herself an income of 25,000 at the end of every month.

Jennifer is now servicing her 7th loan of KES 100,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to buy charcoal to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Jennifer plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children, and she hopes to have growth in her business with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy additional charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Peres

texts.en: Hearing a description of Peres can sound a lot like hearing someone describe your own mother. She doesn’t stand out in a crowd. She’s not the first one to speak, nor the loudest. She sits down every day in the evening to catch the latest intrigue on her favorite local radio station, which provides maybe the only break in her day. Peres is married and blessed with four lovely children who she refers to as “my heartbeat.” Her primary sources of income are milk selling, poultry farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. Deciding to practice poultry farming for Peres was not difficult. “I was brought up with chickens raised by my grandfather and grandmother,” Peres said. “It is in my blood.” For the past ten years, Peres has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her poultry, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Peres is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Peres is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met. Peres believes that ending poverty begins with empowering women so that they can control their own destiny.

loans.use: To expand her poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and concentrate to feed his pigs

loans.name: Ananta

texts.en:
Ananta is a 27-year-old differently-abled man living with his parents, wife and two children. He works and lives in a small village in the Angul district, Odisha, India. He owns a grocery store where he sells basic household items such as sugar, rice, edible oil, etc. He earns 4,000 INR per month, which in not sufficient for his family's monthly expenses as this is their only source of income. He wants to increase his product range and variety so that he will be able to sell more products and make more money. He will use the extra profit for his children's education.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase of sugar, edible oil, rice, flour, spices, biscuits and some other grocery items in bulk to increase his  sales. He is thankful to Peoples Forum and Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, edible oil, rice, flour, spices, biscuits and some other grocery items in bulk to increase sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 20-year-old single lady who lives in Madaba. 

Salam finished her high school degree and stopped studying because of a difficult financial situation. 

Salam sells housewares. 

Salam is applying for a loan to buy more housewares and decoration pieces to sell.

loans.use: to buy more housewares and decoration pieces to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She is 46 years old and a mother of a five-year-old son.  She operates a restaurant, selling homemade meals like fish soap, fried chicken, stewed vegetables and other recipes. She has been in the food vending business for almost five years.

Catherine has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy additional supplies like rice, meat and vegetables.  This will help increase her production and serve a variety of meals that would definitely attract more consumers. This would create higher earnings, resulting in nutritious diets for the whole family.

In the future, she would like to expand her business to be successful and continue supporting the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy additional  supplies like rice, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Oscar Omar

texts.es: Oscar de 28 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar el se dedica a al venta y elaboración de hamacas, las elabora en su casa y las vende de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales como: hilos y nilón de diferentes colores por mayor para seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Oscar, 28, lives in his own house with family and makes his living by making and selling hammocks. He makes them in his house and sells them by travelling to different markets. 

He is asking for a loan to buy wholesale materials such as threads and nylons of different colors to continue with his work and thus earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy threads and nylon of different colors wholesale.

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Víctor, se ha decidió por un nuevo préstamo para invertir en la granja de pollos, comprara pollos de engorde y concentrado para alimentarlos, así podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes en la temporada de fin de año.
Con los financiamientos el negocio de Víctor ha mantenido la continuidad en el cultivo de granos básicos y la ganadería, su progreso económico le ha permitido iniciar a trabajar en la crianza de pollos.
texts.en:
Víctor has decided to request a new loan to invest in his chicken farm. He will buy chickens to fatten and concentrated feed for them, which in turn will allow him to supply his customers' orders during the holiday season.

With previous loans, Víctor's business has been running consistently both growing basic grains and raising livestock. His financial progress has enabled him to branch out and start raising chickens also.

loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Daniel Nature

texts.en:
Daniel Nature is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Daniel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his son Kenet.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Daniel Nature would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Daniel Nature can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Daniel Nature spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his son, eventually hoping to ensure his son is educated and has access to professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay his child's school fees and buy uniforms; and to store his harvest so he can sell his maize later at higher prices.

loans.name: Maria Vikyn Suley

texts.es: Maria se dedica desde hace 3 años a la crianza de pollos de engorde, y adicional también vende pupusas, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra sacar adelante a su familia, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos y concentrado para continuar con la crianza y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria has worked raising chickens for the past three years. She also sells pupusas in order to supplement her income. What she earns from her work allows her to provide for her family. She lives with them in her own house and is requesting this loan to buy chickens and concentrated feed so that she can keep raising them and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia, who is 50 years old and married, lives in a small village called Vakijvari. She has a husband and daughter who are temporarily unemployed. Mzia works hard to earn a living and provide financial stability for her family, but she finds it really hard. Mzia generates income from a small agricultural activity. In particular, she takes care of a milk cow and a plot of agricultural land, harvests nuts and sells products locally. In order to increase her productivity and generate a non-seasonal salary, Mzia requested a loan from local financial institutions. Her loan application was rejected several times because she was regarded as a high-risk borrower with no significant income for her existence. 

The joint initiative between MFO Credo and Kiva gave her a chance to get a loan of 850 GEL for building a greenhouse and improving her family's living conditions. Mzia will purchase all needed equipment and will build it in her yard. She will plant various kinds of vegetables and greens and will sell at good prices at the local market. 

The new business initiative will be a great help to this hardworking woman and her family as they will get a chance to have financial stability and increase their monthly income.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse and get a non-seasonal salary

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sonia, 36 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and her son. She has a small store in her residence where she sells a variety of products such as candies, sodas, basic foodstuffs, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies, sugar, etc. and she has many clients because of her good prices. She is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale merchandise because this is her only source of income. That way she can have better earnings with which to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candies, sodas, basic foodstuffs, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Margarita De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Margarita de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora Margarita quien tiene una miscelánea en general  como ropa  variada para damas como vestidos, trajes completos, faldas, pantalones, suéteres, blusas,  caballeros camisas, pantalones, chumpas y niños, trajes niño-niña, ropa de bebe variada, también venta de calzado para damas y niños en diferente calidad,  venta de regalos para toda ocasión como trastos, ollas, vajillas, relojes, lámparas, adornos de mesa, cuadros de foto, juguetes en general, desde hace 5 años.  Inicio su venta como vendedora ambulante y hoy en día cuenta con un local hermoso que arrenda, aunque su sueño es llegar a tener un local propio y no pagar más renta.  Contando con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo en todo y el amor dulce de sus dos hijas le da muchas gracias a Dios por lo que tiene. Las fiestas de graduación están cerca y tiene varios pedidos de pantalones de lona en diferentes tallas, colores, y marcas, el dinero que tiene no le alcanza y nuevamente necesita otro préstamo para poder comprar por docena los pantalones  que le hacen falta valorados en Q.1400.00 la docena de cada marca,  y no fallarles a sus clientes que son muchísimas personas que confían en ella y otras que compran con ella para poder revender  la ropa.
texts.en:
Margarita is in charge of the group Dúo Margarita de Vista Hermosa. She has a store where she sells assorted women's clothing like dresses, full pantsuits, skirts, trousers, sweaters, and blouses; men's shirts, pants, and jackets; children's clothing for boys and girls, baby clothes, and women and children's shoes of different kinds. She also sells gifts for all occasions, like pots and pans, dishes, watches, lamps, table decorations, picture frames, and toys in general. She has been in business for five years. She started out as a street vendor and today she rents a beautiful retail space, although her dream is to one day purchase her own space and not have to pay rent any more. She has her husband's unconditional support and the love of her two sweet daughters, so she is grateful for everything she has. 

Graduation parties are approaching, and she has several orders of linen pants in different sizes, colors, and brands. She doesn't have enough money to cover them, so she needs another loan in order to purchase the pants she needs by the dozen. They are priced at Q 1,400 per dozen. She doesn't want to let her customers down, because a lot of people trust in her and some depend on buying from her to make their living reselling the items.

loans.use: to buy new clothing items.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is from Vanadzor town, where she lives with her 24-year-old son. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country, trying to support his family financially.

Karine does accounting. She works at a local sewing factory and also provides individual accounting for locals in her town.

Karine is now asking for this loan to be able to purchase a new computer and pay for training on organizing for accountants.

The computer is very important for Karine to organize her work more efficiently and also participate in the training courses. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer and pay for training on organizing for accountants.

loans.name: Wendy Sarahi

texts.es:
Wendy de 20 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, viven en una casa que están alquilando con su pareja, es comerciante, administra una tienda familiar, pareja es empleado en la sucursal de una zapatería muy reconocida a nivel local.
Decidió iniciar el negocio hace un par de años, comenzó vendiendo ropa de mujer, al ver los buenos resultados, experimentó con artículos de primera necesidad y en cuestión de tiempo se hizo de un buen número de clientes y que siempre le buscaban que comprar.
El préstamo lo necesita para abastecer su negocio, aprovechando la época navideña y por la experiencia que ha tenido quiere tener equipada su tienda para la demanda que le harán los clientes que siempre buscan comprar un par de cosas de la temporada.
Wendy espera su negocio siempre de buenos frutos porque su hija pronto iniciara la escuela y espera darle el estudio hasta que se gradúe de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Wendy, 20 years old, is in a relationship and has a 2 year old daughter. She and her partner live in a house that they rent. She is a merchant who runs a family store. Her partner works at a branch of a shoe store that is very well-known on the local level. 

She decided to start her business a couple of years ago, which she began by selling women's clothing. Upon seeing the good results, she experimented with staple items and in a matter of time she had a good number of clients who were always looking to buy.

She needs the loan to supply her store. In order to take advantage of the Christmas season and based on her past experience she wants to have her store ready for her clients' demand. They always look to buy a couple of seasonal items. 

Wendy hopes her business will always yield good results because soon her daughter will begin school and she hopes to give her an education until she graduates from a university.

loans.use: to supply her business with seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian is 32 years old, has 2 children, and lives in Milanye village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya. Milanye village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Kopany borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Lilian and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Lilian works as a peasant farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Lilian and other promoters in her community, including Boniface, Maurine and Lawrence need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Lilian will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Lilian wants to be a promoter because she believes that the dispenser will do away with diseases that are caused by unsafe water.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink.
