Nancy is 24 years old, has 4 children, and lives in Kuria East, Kenya. Her village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Nancy's community may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Nancy works as a commercial farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables the community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Nancy and 4 other promoters in her community, Selina, Joanes, Josephine, and John need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Nancy will encourage her community to treat their drinking water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Nancy wants to be a promoter because she believes that the chlorine will kill bacteria in water making it safe to drink, thus improving the health of children and community members by protecting them from water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Nancy’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 60 years old, has 3 children, and lives in Kakur A village in Ndhiwa, Kenya. Kakur A village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Ka-Mary well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Mary and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Mary works as a peasant farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Mary and 4 other promoters in her community, including Eunice, Plister, Jemima and Emilly need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Mary will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Mary wants to be a promoter because she believes that the dispenser will help to prevent water-borne diseases in the community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Mary’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen is 31 years old, has 5 children, and lives in Ndhiwa, Kenya. Hellen works as a commercial farmer for a living. Where Hellen lives, her family and her community do not have access to safe drinking water. The community collects their water from a spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases.

This is why Hellen is requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser on behalf of her community. Hellen was elected to represent her community as a volunteer promoter. She is not only representing her community on Kiva, but also volunteers her time to educate the people in her village on the importance of safe water use and how to use the chlorine dispenser when they come to fetch water at their local water point. There are 3 other promoters named Janet, David and Seline also volunteering in this community.

The loan will be used for the installation of the dispensers and the initial supplies of chlorine. Hellen wants to be a promoter because she believes that chlorine fights germs that could cause water borne diseases, so it will be very beneficial to her community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Hellen’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses is 22 years old, has 1 child, and lives in Nguruna village in Kuria East, Kenya. Moses works as a peasant farmer for a living. Where Moses lives, his community does not have access to safe drinking water. The community collects their water from a local spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. If Moses' community had a way to treat their water, they could have improved health, keeping children at school and parents at work.

This is why Moses is requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser on behalf of his community. Moses was elected to represent his community as a volunteer promoter. He is not only representing his community on Kiva, but also volunteers his time to educate the people of his community on the importance of safe water and how to use the chlorine dispenser when they come to fetch water at their local water point. The loan will be used for the installation of the dispensers and the initial supplies of chlorine. Moses wants to be a promoter because he envisions a community free from water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Moses’ community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Simion's Group

texts.en:
Simion is 30 years old, has 6 children, and lives in Kuria East, Kenya. Simion works as a commercial farmer for a living. Where Simion lives, the people within his community do not have access to safe drinking water. The community collects their water from a local spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases.

This is why Simion is requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser on behalf of his community. Simion was elected to represent his community as a volunteer promoter. He is not only representing his community on Kiva, but also volunteers his time to educate the people of his community on the importance of safe water and how to use the chlorine dispenser when they come to fetch water at their local water point. The loan will be used for the installation of the dispensers and the initial supplies of chlorine. Simion wants to be a promoter because he envisions a community that is free from water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Simion’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Carolyne's Group

texts.en:
Carolyne lives in a home with mud walls, a dirt floor, and an iron roof in Ongeng village in Ndhiwa, Kenya with her family which includes 2 children. The community of Ongeng  collects their drinking water from Kamenya Kwandiku pond because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Ongeng’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Ongeng, 20 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Carolyne has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are 4 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community namely Saline, Hellen, Jocinter, and Evans who are also part of this group loan.

Ongeng community needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Carolyne believes that the dispenser will help them treat water leading to a reduction of water-borne diseases. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Carolyne’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 51, lives in her own house with her family. She's had a small store located in her place of residence for several years, and she what she makes from those sales she uses to solve various household expenses.

Maria is asking for a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc, and thus be able to make a better profit for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Zahaa Al Deen

texts.en:
Zahaa Al Deen is a 22-year-old, single man who lives in Ajloun. 

Zahaa Al Deen is studying to get his bachelor's degree and he is in his second year. He works in his father’s auto mechanic's garage in a part-time job after school, to make more money that can help him afford his school fees. His plan after graduation is to enroll with the military forces to serve the country. 

Zahaa Al Deen is applying for a loan to help him cover the rest of the semester fees.

loans.use: to cover the rest of the semester fees.

loans.name: Lado

texts.en:
Lado is a maize farmer from Badamasi village, in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Lado would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lado can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Lado, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Triphozah

texts.en:
For the last 18 years, Triphozah has been in mixed farming activity and earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is widowed with three children.

She has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy seedlings and fertilizers for use.

She will use the anticipated profit to provide for her family's basic needs and hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran is married and has two children. He is a furniture maker. Seyran owns a garage where he has all the proper tools and equipment for making furniture. Due to his professional work, he receives a number of orders during the month and is able to cover his family's needs. 

Seyran requested a loan from SEF International, which he will use to purchase materials needed for making furniture. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothing and linens

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from Vanadzor town, where she lives with her 21-year-old son. Her son is a sportsman working at a local sport school.

Emma has been involved in clothing sales for many years. She sells women's clothing in a rented store in Vanadzor town. Expanding her selection will enable her to  keep up with customer demand and attract new customers, so Emma has applied for this loan. She asks lenders to support her to purchase new winter clothing for her inventory. 

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of winter clothing to keep up with customer demand

loans.name: La Retumbadora Group

texts.es: María, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, reside junto a dos hijos en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. María siempre se ha dedicado a la producción de granos básicos y hace 12 años cultiva café. La producción de café la vende en grano en pergamino en la misma zona donde vive. La agricultura es su actividad que le genera ingresos para su familia. y ha decidido solicitar el segundo préstamo a la institución por 1,500 Lempiras, este préstamo es en forma grupal y lo va utilizar para comprar abonos para aplicarle a su parcela de café y garantizar una buena producción. Su meta es seguir tecnificando su finca y sembrar variedad de café.  El grupo se llama La Retumbadora, formado por cuatro personas, que se dedican al cultivo de café y viven en la misma comunidad. El monto grupal de préstamo es por 16,500 lempiras y lo invertirán para fertilizar y hacer viveros de café. En la foto esta Francisco a la izquierda, Mabel, Izamary y María Digna a la derecha.
texts.en:
María, 45 years old, is a single mother. She lives with her two children in a small village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. 

María has always made a living from the production of basic grains, and has cultivated coffee for 12 years. She sells her coffee production as pergamino beans in the same area where she lives. Agriculture is the activity that generates an income for her family, and she has decided to apply for the second loan from the institution for 1,500 Lempiras. This loan is in a group form and she is going to use it to purchase fertilizers to apply to her coffee farm to guarantee a good production. Her goal is to continue advancing her farm technologically and to sow a variety of coffee crops. 

The group is called La Retumbadora, and is made up of four people who make a living from the cultivation of coffee and live in the same community. The group amount of the loan is 16,500 Lempiras and which they will invest to fertilize and make coffee nurseries. In the photo, Francisco is on the left, and Mabel, Izamary, and María Digna are on the right.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to apply to her coffee farm.

loans.name: Naela

texts.en:
Naela is a conservative lady; she asked her brother Hamzeh to appear in the photo instead. 

Naela is a 29-year-old woman who works in the editorial department of a television channel. She and her big family live in Al-Baqaa. 

She is taking a loan to help her younger brother finish his education. Hamzeh is a 21-year-old student in his second year of pursuing his bachelor's degree. 

Hamzeh wants to get his degree so he can find a job in the field to be able to help the family later and support himself. But for now Naela is applying for an educational loan to help Hamzeh pay his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her brother's semester fees

loans.name: Kujaribu's Group

texts.en: Kujaribu is 64 years old, married, and has 10 children. He is a tree farmer. Kujaribu joined Komaza because he has planted trees before and understands the value of microforestry as a business. His favorite part about being a Komaza farmer is receiving training to improve his farm and watching his trees grow. Kujaribu is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Mirdita

texts.en:
Miredita is 38 years old and has two children. She is a very hardworking woman who puts forth a lot of effort to improve her family’s living conditions and help generate income for her family. She operates a handicraft business from her home and has a lot of customers because of her professionalism and her pleasant personality. She likes what she does and is grateful that she can be home with her children and still contribute to the family.

Miredita requested a loan, which she will use to purchase materials for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her to satisfy her customers even more and help to increase her customer base and income.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her handicraft work

loans.name: Bendera's Group

texts.en:
Bendera is 60 years old and a Komaza tree farmer. She has three children, all of whom are in school. Bendera is married, and her spouse is a farmer, too. 

In addition to growing trees, Bendera supports her family with farming. She decided to join Komaza to learn how to plant and maintain a tree farm. 

She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to to open a business. 

Bendera’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the working in farmer groups because it unifies her and her neighbors. 

Bendera is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture. One of the men in the picture is Kujaribu, also a Komaza farmer but not part of this Kiva loan group.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs, such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Нигина уроженка города Конибодом. Ей 41 год. Она одна без мужа воспитывет четверых детей. Ее старший сын работает в России, младший сын учится в школе, старшая дочь помогает матери в ее работе, а младшая дочь ходит в детский сад. Нигина в последнее время испытывет трудности с обеспечением семьи. Поэтому она решила начать новый бизнес, чтобы улучшить финансовое положение семьи и создать детям хорошие условия для их образования и здравоохранения. 
Нигина планирует заняться продажей детской одежды на рынке. В связи с тем, что ее начального капитала не хватает, она обратилась за кредитом. Нигина на сумму кредита собирается привезти ассортимент сезонной десткой одежды и начать торговлю. Благодаря кредиту у нее появится работа и она сможет обеспечить семью хорошим источником дохода. Помогите Нигине улучшить их жизнь.
texts.en:
Nigina is a native of the town of Konibodom. She is 41 years old. She is raising four children without a husband. Her oldest son works in Russia, youngest son attends a school, oldest daughter helps the mother with her work, and the youngest daughter goes to preschool. Nigina has been experiencing difficulties providing for her family lately. This is why she decided to start a new business in order to improve the family's financial situation and create positive conditions for her children to get education and health coverage.

Nigina is planning to get involved in selling children's clothing at a market. Due to the shortage in the starting capital, she requested this loan. Nigina is planning to use the loan amount to bring in a selection of children's seasonal clothing and start the sales. Thanks to this loan, she will have work and will be able to provide her family with a good source of income. Please help Nigina improve their life.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing in order to start a new retail business and provide her family with a source of income

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is from Stepanavan town, where she lives with her grandchild. Seda is considered to be the sole guardian of her granddaughter. 

Seda works day and night to gather enough income and cover her granddaughter's basic needs. She works at local school as a teacher, and she also cooks different pastries and cookies and sells them. 

She asks this loan to purchase an oven that she needs for baking pastries and cookies. 

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy an oven for baking pastries and cookies

loans.name: Kadzo's Group

texts.en:
Kadzo is a 50-year-old KOMAZA tree farmer. She is a widow with eleven children, all of whom are in school. In addition to growing trees, Kadzo supports her family with subsistence farming. 

She decided to join KOMAZA to improve her family's standard of living and she plans to spend the money earned from the KOMAZA tree farm to provide a quality education for her children, so they can find good jobs and start their own businesses. Kadzo’s favorite part about working with KOMAZA is maintaining the trees as they grow. 

In the picture, Kadzo is the farmer with her hand raised. Loice, the wife of a KOMAZA farmer, also appears in the pictures with the three women in the Kiva loan group.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs, such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Audu

texts.en: Audu is a maize farmer from the village of Tajiri in the state of Kaduna, Nigeria. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Audu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Audu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Audu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and he hopes to ensure that his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Rabiu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabiu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Rabiu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, become the most  profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby reducing  pressure to sell his corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is in her late 40s and is from Eldoret, Kenya, a community not known for farming, but she has been earning well through agriculture. She is a young farmer practicing mixed farming. For the past 10 years, her primary source of income has been milk, maize, and a variety of crops she plants. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to Mary's heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she earns profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit. Therefore, Mary requested a loan, which she will use to build a modern dairy unit. A dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of exposure to harsh weather conditions. Mary believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Bisalima

texts.ru: 42 летняя Бисалима из города Душанбе, занимается шитьем женской национальной одежды. Она замужем и имеет детей. Бисалима 4 года продвигает швейную деятельность. И каждым разом она усовершенствует свои навыки в деятельности. Бисалима хочет купить новую швейную машинку, потому что нынешняя машинка не выполняет все функции, что приводит к замедлению процесса работы. Бисалима уверена, что с новой швейной машинкой она будет выполнять работу быстрее и качественнее. Также удовольствие от работы она будет получать больше. Бисалима обожает свою работу и хочет дальше расти и усовершенствовать свое мастерство.
texts.en:
42-year-old Bisalima from the city of Dushanbe works with sewing women's national clothing. She is married and has children. Bisalima has been sewing for four years, and she continuously improves her skills.

Bisalima would like to purchase a new sewing machine, because the current machine does not have all needed functions, and this slows down the work. She is sure that with a new sewing machine she will do her work faster and with more quality. She will also get more joy out of her work. 

Bisalima loves her work and would like to further grow and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his semester fees.

loans.name: Abdugappor

texts.ru: Абдугаппору  57 лет. Он любящий муж, отец и дед прекрасных внуков. Он женат. Всю свою жизнь Абдугаппор зарабатывал на  жизнь  оказывая услуги населению по ремонту жилья. Это занятие перешло ему по наследству от отцов и дедов. Он вырастил своих детей, женил их и вот теперь считает что должен внести свой вклад и в том чтобы вырастить внуков. Подросшие дети помогают родителям. Его работа  в основном сезонная и Абдугаппор занимается ремонтом жил ишь в весеннее летнее время а зимой  у него перерыв так как люди в основном делают ремонт жилья в теплое время года.  Вот  с наступлением холодов уменьшились заказы от населения  и у него появилась возможность для  ремонта собственного жилья.  Для того чтобы быть готовым к зимним холодам он хочет  подремонтировать крышу дома , чтобы зимой она не протекала и   семье было тепло. Для того чтобы приобрести необходимый материал для ремонта ему необходимы денежные средства , которые решат его проблему.  Так как он не первый раз берет кредит в «Арванде» он обратился в Арванд за помощью и советом. Взяв кредит у нас он надеется что  несмотря на то что, холода уже наступили он успеет завершить ремонт кровли.
texts.en: Abdugappor is 57 years old. He is a loving husband, father and grandfather to beautiful grandchildren. He is married. Abdugappor has been earning a living his whole life by providing house repair services to people. He inherited this trade from his father and grandfather. He raised his children, married them off and now thinks that he needs to make his contribution to raising his grandchildren. The grown children help their parents. Abdugappor's work is mainly seasonal, and he does house repairs either in the spring or summer time, and has a break during the winter because people primarily do repairs during warm times of year. With the onset of cold weather, his work orders decreased and he now has an opportunity to repair his own house. To be prepared for the winter cold, he wants to repair his house roof, so that it would not leak during the winter, and his family would be warm. He needs money to buy the necessary materials for repairs that will solve his problem. Because this is not his first time obtaining a loan from "Arvand", he came to Arvand for help and advice. He hopes that obtaining this loan from us will allow him to complete repairs in-time, despite the fact that cold weather has arrived.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to repair his house

loans.name: Shapifmo

texts.ru:
Шарифмо проживает на районе Рудаки. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж Шарифмо работает на стройке, строителем. Шарифамо дома предоставляет услугу портнихи. Она, сидя дома занимается воспитанием детей, домашними делами, а также успевает принимать заказы на шитье. Шарифмо держится за эту деятельность, потому что ее услуги приносит в дом доход. Мужу одному тяжело обеспечивать семью и Шарифмо старается ему помочь.
   Сейчас Шарифмо нуждается в кредите, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Она боится, что их жилище не готово к большим предстоящим холодам и в спешку делает ремонт, но достаточных денежных средств не имеет для купли стройматериалов и завершения ремонта. У нее одна надежда, получения кредита. Шарифмо надеется, что мир не без добрых людей и найдутся те, кто откликнется на помощь.
texts.en:
Shapifmo lives in the Rudaki region. She is 47 years old. She is married and has three children. Shapifmo's husband works as a carpenter. 

Shapifmo provides a seamstress service from her home. Staying at home, she raises the children, does household work and also successfully takes order for sewing. She keeps this business because her services bring in money to the household. Her husband heavily supports the family, and Shapifmo strives to help him. 

Currently Shapifmo needs a loan in order to renovate their house. She is scared that their house is not ready for the upcoming severely cold weather, and would like to do renovations quickly. However she does not have enough money to purchase building materials and complete the renovation. She has one hope, which is getting a loan. Shapifmo hopes that the world is not free of good people and those exist, who will help her.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and complete the renovation of her home

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
De 50 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene cuatro hijos los primeros dos hijos ya tienen familias separadas y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad. 
	
El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de traje típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 15 años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de verduras negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de cinco años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

El uso que  dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería de trajes típicos para luego venderlas por los alrededores de su comunidad. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
She is 50 years old, and already has large aspirations to make her community and all that visit her know the activity that she performs with so much effort and dedication. She is married and lives with her husband, with the desire to improve her life and attain the great dreams that she wants to achieve in life. She has four children. The first two children already have their own separate families, and the last two are excellent students in their community’s school.

The work that she performs with so much care is the purchase and sale of traditional dress. She performs this activity in her home and in places close to the community where she lives. She was continued to perform this activity for 15 years. The second activity that she performs is the sale of vegetables, a business that she has performed with a sister for more than five years because it generates a profit for the wellbeing of her family and improves the economic conditions of her family and community.

The use that she will give to the loan that she is requesting is to purchase merchandise of traditional dress to then sell in the surrounding area of her community. One of her aspirations is to have a store in her community’s market and to see that her children become professionals in life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise of traditional dress.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, and cold cuts, among other ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ceramic floor tiles, cement, corrugated metal sheets, and beams, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a merchant who is operating a restaurant, selling homemade meals like fish balls, meat and fish soup, stewed vegetables, and other menu items. She is a fifty-five-year old married woman and has three dependents, the youngest of whom is 14 years old.  Together with her family, she lives in Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She has been engaged in this kind of business for ten years.

Virginia has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy supplies like vegetables, meat, and seasonings. With these, she can now cook a variety of menu items that will attract more customers. She can continue to operate her current business as well, thus making it productive, and she can continue to provide her family with proper food and better living conditions.

Virginia would like to expand her business to improve her livelihood status and to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy supplies like vegetables, meat and seasonings

loans.name: Gupron

texts.ru: Гупрону 48 лет. Он женат имеет троих детей.   Образование у него среднее. Они с женой вырастили  детей и  стараются дать им  образование, чтобы  в будущем они смогли  найти достойную хорошо оплачиваемую работу .  Гупрон не первый раз берет кредит в «Арванде  и у него хорошая кредитная история . Гупрон доволен тем как обслуживают  в «Арванде»  и ему удобно брать кредит именно здесь.  Основным источником  его дохода является то что он предоставляет услуги по ремонту жилых домов и квартир. Это занятие является для жителей небольшого городка источником  заработка так, как больших предприятий в городе нет. С наступлением холодов все стараются утеплить и укрепить кровлю домов. Дом самого Гупрона также нуждается в том, чтобы  произвести ремонт и утеплить кровлю. Для строительный материалов необходимых для ремонта ему необходимы средства и Гупрон берет кредит для этой цели.
texts.en: Gupron is 48 years old. He is married and has three children. He has a secondary education. He and his wife raise the children and try to provide them with education, so that they could find decent and well-paid jobs in the future. This is not Gupron's first time obtaining a loan from "Arvand" and he has a good credit history. Gupron is happy with the service at "Arvand" and finds it convenient to obtain a loan right there. His primary source of income is providing house and apartment repair services. This occupation serves as a source of income for residents of this small town because there are no large companies here. With the onset of cold weather, everyone tries to insulate and reinforce their roofs. Gupron's own house roof needs repairs and insulation. He needs money to buy necessary building materials for this repair, and Gupron is requesting a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to repair his house

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther is a fifty-one-year old Komaza tree farmer. She has eight children, all of whom are in school. Esther is married and her spouse is a pastor. In addition to growing trees, Esther supports her family with small-scale farming.

She decided to join Komaza because, after receiving profits from harvesting her trees, she hopes to raise the living standard of her family, which would include providing a high level of education for her children. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to to start other income-generating activities and send her children to higher education institutions.

Esther’s favorite part about working with Komaza is planting trees on her farm. Esther is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Abdulkadiri

texts.en:
Abdulkadiri is a maize farmer. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdulkadiri would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulkadiri can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Abdulkadiri is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to ensure that his child, Hafizu, is educated and has access to professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, and to store his harvest so he can sell his maize later at higher prices.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en: Garba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Garba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Aliyu, Lawaldi and Sefillshi. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Garba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Garba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Garba spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children. He hopes to eventually become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mohammadu

texts.en: Mohammadu is a maize farmer from Hayin Mallam Bawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mohammadu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mohammadu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Mohammadu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdourahmane

texts.fr: ABDOURAHMANE est un homme qui évolue dans le transport. Il est marié et père de famille qui n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Il sollicite ce montant pour réparer son voiture de transport en commun qui est en panne. Il gère les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il a une expérience de plus de 5ans et commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Il voudrait à l’avenir avoir plusieurs voitures de transport en commun. Ainsi il pourra épargner de l’argent  et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abdourahmane is a man who has worked in transportation for more than five years. He is married and a father of a family. He does not have parents who are members of UIMCEC. He is seeking a loan to repair his vehicle which has broken down. 

Abdourahmane manages his family's everyday expenses and his children's school fees. He begins his day at 8 a.m. and finishes at 7 p.m. 

In the future, he would like to have several vehicles. Then he will be able to save money and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour supplies to bake flatbread for selling

loans.name: Mamour

texts.fr: MOMAR est un vieux en retraite qui ne veut pas rester sans activité. Il est veuf et père de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires comme le riz, le sucre, le lait, le savon ….. Il a un parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution et demande ce montant pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et satisfaire sa demande. Il a une expérience de plus de 20ans et gère les dépenses quotidiennes et les frais médicaux de sa famille. Il commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 20h. Il voudrait avoir d’autres grandes boutiques d’alimentation générale et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi il pourra épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mamour is an old, retired man who wants to continue working. He is a widower and a father who has been in the business of selling food products, like rice, sugar, milk, soap… He has a beneficiary relative at the institution and is seeking this sum to reinforce his stock of merchandise and satisfy demand. He has more than 20 years of experience and manages the daily expenses and medical fees of his family. He works from 10am until 8pm.  He would like to have other large general food stores and to increase his revenues. He will thus be able to save money and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell

loans.name: Samaila Iliya

texts.en:
Samaila Iliya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila Iliya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ladi, Lois, and Hannatum.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Samaila Iliya spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure that his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms; and to store his harvest so he can sell his maize later at higher prices.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik is a taxi driver from Stepanavan town, where he lives with his wife. Garnik has been driving a taxi for more than six years. He is an enthusiastic and hardworking man and people are always happy to use his service. 

Garnik was able to save a partial amount of money for his new car and is asking for this loan to be able to have all the money for purchasing it. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Мохира женщина 40 лет. Она разведенная, имеет двоих детей.  У неё среднее техническое образование.Она работает 
инспектором отдела кадров в местом предприятии. Её старший сын работает плотником и неплохо зарабатывает.Он помогает матери, принося доход в семью. Мохира является  клиентом МДО Арванд уже более 3 лет. Она  очень порядочная женщина, своевременно погашала свой кредит без просрочки. Соседи и близкие очень уважают и любят её. 
Чтобы принести в семью больше дохода она занимается откормом скота. Мохира хочет получить кредит для покупки скота. Она заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за сотрудничество и за оказанное ей доверие.
texts.en:
Mohira is a woman of the age of 40. She is divorced and has two children. She has vocational education and works with HR administration at a local company. Her eldest son works as a carpenter and earns well. He helps his mother, bringing income to the family. 

Mohira has been a client of MDO Arvand for more than three years already. She is a very decent woman, who pays her loan back without delay. Her neighbors and friends respect and love her very much. 

In order to bring more income to the family, Mohira works with livestock breeding. She would like to receive a loan to purchase livestock. She thanks MDO Arvand in advance for the cooperation and for their confidence in her.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 52 years old and married. She lives in Al rasaifh with her family of five members. She holds a primary school certificate. 

Fatima sells some clothes that she brings from the clothing factory where her son works. Fatima’s husband works in a clearance company. 

Fatima is applying for the loan so she can get more merchandise of clothes and accessories to sell.

loans.use: to pay for new clothes and accessories to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a maize farmer from Yan Gwari village in Kaduna state. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Mary would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mary can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Mary, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and she hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, and to store her harvest so she can sell her maize later at higher prices.

loans.name: Adoko Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne a 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle vit à Tokoin non loin de hôpital du quartier tokoin. Depuis près de 3 ans, Jeanne vend à domicile des plateaux d’œuf. Toutes les deux semaines, elle se déplace à la ferme d’AGODEKE pour se procurer des œufs auprès des fermiers.Pour augmenter son stock et réduire les frais de déplacements, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 45 plateaux d’œufs.
texts.en: Jeanne is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She lives near in Tokoin, Togo. For nearly three years now, Jeanne has been selling trays of eggs out of her home. Every two weeks, she goes to an AGODEKE farm in order to purchase eggs from the farmers. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase 45 egg trays in order to increase her inventory, and reduce travel costs.

loans.use: to buy 45 egg trays.

loans.name: Nyame Aye Farms Group

texts.en:
Faustina is 38 years of age and a member of Nyame Aye group. Faustina is from Egyirkrom, in the Abura Asebu Kwamankese District, in the Central Region of Ghana. She is married and has seven children. Six of her children are schooling. Her first-born is 20 years old, and the last is 4 years old. 

Faustina has been in farming for the past 14 years. She has a lime plantation of three acres. She also has a cassava farm. Faustina sells the produce from her cassava farm at local market on market days, to supplement the income from her lime farm. 

Her hope is to expand the lime plantation in the future, to enhance her income-generating capacity. Faustina needs a microloan support to maintain her farm on time, by weeding it and buying fertilizer and food fly traps. This will increase the crop yield and thereby help her earn more to meet her future business aspirations. 

Faustina thanks all her lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to weed the farm, and to buy fertilizer and food fly traps.

loans.name: Kadzumba

texts.en:
Kadzumba is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor running water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan, she is requesting 50,000 KES to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 33 years old. He is married with 4 children who are between 4 and 11 years old, 3 of whom go to school. 

He is a motorcyclist taxi and has been in this business for 6 years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy spare parts for repairing his motorcycle for transport. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Istat

texts.ru:
Истат 27 лет. Она из города Конибодом, где в настоящий момент живет вместе с ребенком. Муж по вынуждению работает вдали от семьи, в Российской Федерации. Он уже несколько лет ездит туда на заработки. 
Истат начала свой торговый бизнес три года назад. У нее есть торговая точка на рынке, где она занимается продажей женской одежды. Средства от креддит Истат хочет использовать на расширение бизнеса. Она собирается привезти партию сезонной женской одежды на продажу. Истат надеется на вашу поддержку, так как благополучие ее семьи зависит от дохода ее продаж.
texts.en:
Istat is 27 years old. She is from the city of Konibodom, where she currently lives together with her child. Out of necessity, her husband works far away from the family, in the Russian Federation. He went there a few years ago as a migrant worker. 

Istat started her retail business three years ago. She has a sales point at the market, where she sells women's clothing. Istat would like to use the loan amount to expand her business. She has decided to bring in a batch of seasonal women's clothing to sell. 

Istat hopes for your support, as her family's well-being depends on the income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal women's clothing to develop her retail business and maintain her income

loans.name: Alanoud

texts.en:
Alanoud is a 23-year-old student. Alanoud is a single woman who lives in Mafraq. She comes from a big family. After his retirement, her dad started working as a driver to cover his children's needs. 

Alanoud is now applying for a loan to help her pay for her semester fees since she is studying in her third year in the university, majoring in English language.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Zailani

texts.en:
Zailani is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Zailani would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zailani can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Zailani expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 58 years old and lives in Accra, Teshie City in the Greater Accra region. He is married and has grown up children.  He lives with his wife who sells fish. 

Emmanuel sells customers soft drinks. He is proud to financially support his family with his small business. 

He has been doing this business for 10 years and still counting. He says that he has a number of loyal customers, who do drink from his stall regularly.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en: Husam is a 26-year-old single man. He lives in Rsaifeh. Husam is studying toward his Bachelor's degree in business administration. His father has retired and is now working as a land broker to be able to continue supporting the family. But now Husam is applying for an education loan to help him cover the rest of his semester fees.

loans.use: to cover the rest of his semester fees.

loans.name: Dalladi

texts.en:
Dalladi is a Babban Gona maize farmer. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dalladi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dalladi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Dalladi expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, and to store his harvest so he can sell his maize later at higher prices.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Saratu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Dantala, Dorcas and Laraba. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Saratu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children. She hopes to ensure that her children are educated and that eventually they will have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zapaniah

texts.en: Zapaniah is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Zapaniah joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Living and Stone.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Zapaniah would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zapaniah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Zapaniah  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Medelina

texts.en:
Medelina  is 30-years-old and is a single mother with four children - one boy and three girls, and one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Medelina was living in village of Mundri in the western Equatori state region of South Sudan. 

Medelina has requested a loan 300 SSP through WOYE/MFI to buy more food to cook and sell at the market. She is making bread with others and also hopes that in future her business will improve.

loans.use: To buy more food

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli lives in the house which she owns with her husband and son. She has been involved in clothing sales since 2012. As the cold season has already come, and people require warm clothing, Nelli needs some financial support to be able to meet current market demand. She asks lenders to support her purchase of new winter clothing for her inventory.

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of winter clothing

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen has been involved in retail business for ten years. He cooperates with one of the Armenian dairy factories and organizes the distribution of their products in Kapan, Qajaran and Meghri regions. He gets a share from each sale and works very hard to gather enough income for his family. He lives with his wife and is a father of two school age children.

To be able to acquire food products (eggs, butter, chicken, sausage) and organize delivery and retail service, Karen requests this loan. It has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for food products (eggs, butter, chicken, sausage) for delivery and retail

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Kapan town with her husband and son who is army officer.

Last year Karine started her bakery business. In her house, she bakes different types of cookies and sells them. Her husband helps her with the distribution work.

To be able to change her old working machinery and develop her small business, Karine needs this financial support. She asks lenders to support her with purchasing a new oven, a refrigerator and materials for her bakery.

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new oven, a refrigerator and materials for her bakery.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en: Yusra is a 45-year-old married woman living in Madaba with her family of seven members. Three of her children are in universities. Having three children at the university at once is a big challenge for her and their father to afford paying their schooling fees. For that Yusra works as a tailor at home 8 to 9 hours a day to make an additional income that is helping to make a difference. Now she is applying for a loan in order to maintain her sewing machine and buy new needles and tools to enhance her work.

loans.use: to maintain her sewing machine and buy new needles and tools to enhance her work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the shortage he had in his semester fees payment.

loans.name: Na'omi

texts.en:
Na'omi is a maize farmer. She is the mother of 3 children.

Before joining Babban Gona, Na'omi had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs for items such as school fees, food and uniforms.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Na'omi can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Na'omi  spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses (school fees, food, uniforms...), and store her harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo has been occupied in the retail business for already three years. He acquires stock of products from Yerevan town and resells it in Kapan town, where he lives.

Kamo is married and lives with his wife. He works hard to sustain his newborn family's daily needs.

To acquire new stock of products (skin care and household products) and sell it to his loyal customers, Kamo has applied for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Kamo hopes for lenders' support for his small, but sustainable business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of skin care products and household products for selling.

loans.name: Khitmah

To make additional income for the family, Khitmah  chose to buy honey from her brothers at wholesale prices and sell them back in Zarqa, where she lives, at market prices. Being a "people person" she was able to promote her small home business. Now Khitmah is applying for a loan to increase her order of honey, and begin selling other food such as dairy products.

loans.use: to buy more honey for resale, and buy dairy products to sell.

Fauzia will share this loan with her loan group Mtu Kazi, which consists of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Enjo, who is in her  late 20s, is married and has two children who are still in school. She has been running two businesses: a beauty salon and a clothing shop, for six years now.  She works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Enjo's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on both businesses and has paid back all her loans successfully.   She used the profit to pay school fees, built a house and covered household expenses.  She is doing fine with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. 

Enjo will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon equipment and to increase the clothes stock.  She dreams of building another house.

Enjo will share this loan with her loan group "KIBOSHO", which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy beauty salon equipment

loans.name: 12 De Abril Group

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 31 años de edad, soltera, madre de cuatro hijos de 16, 12, 8 y 4 años y su negocio es la venta y manufactura de chorizos artesanales.
Ella es emprendedora, activa, buena madre, responsable, paciente y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad un área caracterizada por el creciente comercio en todas las áreas, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura constante entre 21-30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Ana es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla con sus familiares mayores, para el comercio habla español (la primera de la derecha, usa calza verde y blusa azul). Su vida la realiza junto a sus cuatro hijos; los tres mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor todavía se encuentra al cuidado de la madre, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Debido a sus ganas de superación formó una banca de personas con negocios como; confección de tejidos, venta de pescado, servicio de construcción, venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos, venta de ropa de temporada y tejido a máquina, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de chorizos artesanales; La elaboración según los métodos tradicionales, posee el sabor especial que da a los embutidos la preparación en casa, estando su calidad determinada por la calidad de la carne que se emplea en su realización. Su elaboración a grandes rasgos es sencilla; consiste en picar primero la carne, la cual una vez mezclada con las especias, que deben estar bien picadas,  se amasa y va incorporando un anís seco y que le da su sabor especial; se termina el proceso embutiendo la carne en las mismas tripas del cerdo y atando las ristras con un hilo de algodón. “la receta viene de mi familia, es un negocio de larga trayectoria y ahora quiero ampliarlo…” comenta. Su sueño es producir a gran escala y proveer a mercados y supermercados sus productos. Ella desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de; mesas, sillas y un carrito cocinero, para poder ofertar su producto. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas y un carrito cocinero para ofertar sus chorizos artesanales cocinados.
texts.en:
Ana, 31, is a mother of four children, ages 4, 8, 12 and 16. She has a business making and selling artisan chorizo. She is enterprising, active, responsible, patient, hardworking, and a good mother. Her business is in the southern part of the city, which is an area characterized by growing commerce in all areas, as well as a warm, tropical and humid climate with a constant temperature of between 21-30 degrees Celsius all year.

Ana has tanned skin and is of medium height with long black hair. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her older relatives. For her business, she uses Spanish. In the photo, she is first on the right with green pants and a blue shirt. She lives with her four children. The three older children are studying at school and the youngest is still under her care. They live in their own house with running water and electricity. Due to her desire to succeed, she started a communal bank of people to apply for a loan and grow their business, which include making fabric, selling fish, construction services, selling empanadas, selling cosmetics, selling seasonal clothing and sewing with a machine. 

Her business is making and selling artisan chorizo. Using traditional methods to make chorizo gives it the special flavor which comes from making meat products at home. The quality of the product is determined by the quality of the meat used in making it. The process is generally simple and consists of chopping the meat, mixing it with spices which should be well chopped, kneading it, and adding dry anise which gives it its special flavor. The process ends by packing the meat into pig intestines and tying the strings with cotton thread. She says, "The recipe comes from my family, it is a business with a long trajectory and now I want to expand it..." Her dream is to produce her products on a large scale and to supply them to markets and supermarkets. 

She wishes to expand her business by buying tables, chairs, and a chef's cart to sell her products. This is her first sequence of loans with the institution in the eight years she has had her business activity. This is why Ana is applying for a loan to buy tables, chairs, and a chef's cart to sell her artisan chorizo.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and a chef's cart to sell her chorizo.

loans.name: Gjon

texts.en:
Gjon a 56-year-old villager from northern Albania who wants to repair a damaged stable for his animals, and he needs your help for this.

Gjon is married, and has three children; the middle daughter goes to university for geography/history and the youngest one, a 17-year-old, is in high school. Agriculture/livestock is what he’s been doing for some years now. He’s got a dairy cow, pigs, and chickens, and he sells eggs, meat and baby animals; he plants & sells seasonal veggies every season, and has also some orchards, including persimmons, plums, and grapevines. 

Gjon also works in a gas station nearby his home where he makes a pay of not more than $220/month and also some disability income for his wife, Age, who is in the photograph.

loans.use: to repair a damaged stable for his cows and pigs

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en: Magaji is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Magaji would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Magaji can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Magaji is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: pay expenses until he can sell his crops
